loans.name: Janny

texts.es: Janny, de 27 años es una mujer luchadora. Ella convive con Omar, su esposo desde hace 7 años. Ambos tienen una hija: Andrea, a la que quieren mucho y cuidan en casa de su madre, ubicada en el barrio de Chupaca. Su rostro apacible y tranquilo, muestra la serenidad que la caracteriza. A sus cortos 20 años enfrentó muchas responsabilidades. Uno de ellos es la llegada de su pequeña hija, a la que quiere mucho. Ella continuó estudiando a pesar de ello y ahora trabaja como asistente administrativa en el gobierno local de su comunidad, donde gracias a su trabajo recibe un sueldo mensual de parte del estado. Pero como ella desea mejorar su calidad de vida. Hace poco abrió una tienda de comestibles en casa de su mamá, que le ayuda a atender a sus clientes durante la mañana, ya en la tarde y culminando su trabajo ella asume la atención de su negocio. Además cría vacas y becerros que enseba para luego comercializarlos a un mayor precio. Con todos estos ingresos, espera juntar el dinero necesario para brindar a su hija una buena educación. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde agradece la confianza que depositan en ella, motivo que la estimula a seguir progresando. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Janny de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles, pues comenta que si compra en cantidad; tiene mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
27-year-old Janny is a tenacious woman.  She lives with Omar, her husband of seven years.  The couple have one daughter, Andrea, who they love very much and care for in her mother's house which is located in Chupaca neighborhood.  Janny's calm and gentle face reflects the serenity for which she is noted.

At just 20 years of age, Janny faced many responsibilities.  One of these responsibilities came with the arrival of her young daughter who she loves very much.  She continued studying in spite of this and now works as an administrative assistant with the local government in her community.  Thanks to her work, she receives a monthly salary from the State.  However, as she would like to improve her quality of life, she recently opened a grocery store in her mom's home.  Her mom helps her to serve her customers in the mornings and afternoons and, when she finishes work, Janny takes over.  In addition, she also raises cows and calves which she fattens and then sells at a higher price.  With all these sources of income, she hopes to be able to put together the money she needs to provide her daughter with a good education.

This is Janny's second loan from MFP and she is grateful for the trust that has been placed in her.  This drives her to continue making progress and she pledges to make her loan repayments on time.  With your support, Janny will invest the money she has requested in buying basic household products for her grocery store because she says that if she buys in bulk she makes more profits.

loans.use: to buy basic household products to stock her store

loans.name: Rustamjon

texts.ru: Рустам женат и ответственный отец троих детей. Он добросовестный и трудолюбивый человек. Более трех лет Рустам занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он выращивает овощей. Когда он начал данный бизнес он имел 20 соток земли, а теперь расширил землю до 1 гектара. Он хочет получить хороший урожай и максимизировать свою прибыль. Рустам хотел бы получит займ в размере 5500 Сомони для покупки семена и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Rustam is married and is a responsible father of three children.  He is a conscientious and hardworking person.  Rustam has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over three years.  He grows vegetables.  When he started this business, he had 20 sotkas of land and now expanded his land to 1 hectare.  He wants to gather a good harvest and maximize his profit.  Rustam wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 5500 Somoni to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Erian

texts.es: Erian, tiene la edad  de  22 años, está casado y vive con  su esposa actualmente que es su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar maquinas y materiales para fabricación de pan. El actualmente posee una panadería de varios años atrás y actualmente debe comprar unas maquinas indispensables para la fabricación de panes y repostería para poder abastecer a su clientela que aumenta con los días. El necesita poder darles a sus clientes más surtido de panes para así satisfacer sus gustos y a su vez aumentar la clientela para la prosperidad del negocio. El tiene como meta prioritaria aumentar su clientela, darle el surtido de pan a su local y generar ganancias para su bienestar económico de vivencia diaria para así tener su futuro con un mejor bienestar.    Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Erian is 22 years old, married, and lives with his wife who is currently his main priority.  He will use his loan to buy machines and supplies for making bread.  He has owned a bakery for several years and currently needs to buy some machines that are essential to making bread and pastries.  This will enable him to supply his customers who increase in number every day.  Erian needs to be able to provide his customers with a bigger stock of breads so that he can satisfy their tastes and also increase his number of customers for the good of his business.  His main goal is to increase his number of customers, stock his premises with bread and make profits to improve his daily financial situation so that he can improve his future better well-being.

This is the first loan Erian has received from FUDECOSUR.  He hasn't received previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR offered him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy equipment and supplies for making bread

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 61 years old and lives in Zamora Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children.
 
To earn a living, Rosita sells fish. She earns about 2,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Rosita has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.

Rosita has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Rosita would like to have a fishing boat in order to earn more money because she wants  to send their children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Showers Of Grace Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 42 year old Mable from Harare. She is divorced with three children, two of whom are attending school. She also cares for two dependents who are her sister's children. Mable runs a retail business selling fish. The business has been in operation for five years.
 
Mable finds it difficult to to pay for school fees and uniforms whilst keeping her business going. 

Mable has requested a loan of $400.00 to buy more fish for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to be able to send her children to a better school with complete uniforms. In the future, Mable plans to be a fish supplier in the southern African region.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Fedila

texts.en:
Fedila is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Fedila has a billiard hall that provides billiard games, where customers pay for every round or game finished on the billiard table. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy materials needed for the billiard hall.
Fedila has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Fedila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the billiard hall

loans.name: Benelyn

texts.en:
Benelyn is a married woman with four children. Benelyn is 32 years old, residing in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Benelyn owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for 8 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Benelyn has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Benelyn wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cristo Rey Group

texts.es:
En la  Ciudad de Paraguarí, se reunieron un grupo de señoras con la idea de saber más sobre el programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya, el cual les resultó una excelente oportunidad para salir adelante y progresar. El comite lleva por nombre Cristo Rey, debido a que hay una capilla del mismo nombre, está integrada por 14 mujeres muy trabajadoras quienes se sacrifican día a día para mantener a sus hijos y familias.
Una de las miembros es la señora Catalina, quien se dedica a la costura. Ella nos cuenta que siempre esta con mucho trabajo, ya que la mayoría de sus vecinos le hacen varios pedidos. Gracias a su arduo trabajo y esfuerzo ha podido mantener a su familia y ayudar con la economía de su casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, botones, cierres y demás insumos necesarios para poder cumplir con la demanda que le hace sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the city of Paraguarí, a group of women gathered together and came up with the idea of learning more about the Program of Women Entrepreneurs being offered by Fundación Paraguaya. This would result in an excellent opportunity for them to move forward and make progress. This committee is called “Cristo Rey” (Christ the King) because there is a chapel that has the same name. The group consists of 14 hardworking women who make sacrifices day after day to support their children and families.

One of the members is Sra. Catalina, who is a seamstress. She says that she always works a great deal because most of her neighbors place several orders. Thanks to her hard work and effort, she has been able to support her family and help with the household finances. She is requesting a loan to buy fabrics, thread, buttons, scissors, and other necessary supplies so that she can meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, buttons, scissors, and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock is 25 years old and single. He has been in the farming business in his locality for the last two years, supplying vegetables and fruits to nearby markets and other local buyers and earning a monthly income of KES 8,200.

He is requesting his first loan with KADET ltd of KES 20,000. He plans to use the funds to purchase seeds and fertilizer and to till the land. The anticipated profits will be used to expand the farm. His dreams are to increase his farm's production and to have a family.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer and to till the land.

loans.name: Sam Oeurn

texts.en: Sam Oeurn is 44 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing agricultural crops for more than twenty years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $3 each day. Three of her children are garment workers who earn about $9 each day. In order to improve her farming business, Sam Oeurn is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase a walking tractor to use for tilling her farmland. In the future, she would like to run an additional business of animal husbandry to generate more income to support the family and help her youngest child earn bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a walking tractor to use for tilling her farmland

loans.name: Mirian Lizeth

texts.en:
My name is Mirian A.. I sell Lovely brand products (Women\'s cosmetics) I have had my business for three years. My clients are mostly my neighbors. My sales are by catalog. My business generates income used to support my family. My goal is to increase my inventory. Profits will be used to support my family and pay for my son\'s education.

This loan will be used to buy Lovely brand products

Mi nombre es Mirian A., me dedico a la venta de productos de marca LOVELY (cosmeticos para damas) tengo mi negocio hace 3 años, mis principales clientes son mis vecinos, son ventas por catalogo, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el mantenimiento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario y con las ganancias que obtenga poder vender mas, mantener a mi familia y darle estudio a mi hijo.

loans.use: Compra de productos LOVELY

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is a 35 year-old woman who lives in Adenta, a suburb of Accra, Ghana. She sells textiles from factories and ready-made dresses from one place to the other. She walks a long distance to sell her items. She wishes to have her own shop where she can sell her goods. She is seeking a loan of $900 from Kiva to help her open her own shop.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Victor Amenawon

texts.en: Mr. Victor Amenawon E. is 34 years. He is married with a child. He sells handsets and recharge cards, and he makes call for the public. He hopes to get the above amount to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
I have few things in my home. My husband and I are in charge of covering the expenses. We have two children whom my mother-in-law takes care of at home. We work almost the entire day and are saddled with the children's bills. I'm requesting a loan of $1,200 for new front door, so we're safer and the children can't run out as easily.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Tengo poco que adquirí me casa, entre mi esposo y yo somos los que nos encargamos de los gastos, tenemos 2 hijo los cuales los cuida mi suegra en la casa. Casi todo el día trabajamos y estamos con el pendiente de los niños. Estoy solicitando un préstamo de $1,200.00 DLLS para el portón de enfrente y así estar más seguros los niños que no se salgan.

loans.use: Put up an iron door

loans.name: Faavae

texts.en: Faavae is a forty-five year old mother of two grown up sons.  Both her sons have moved overseas for employment opportunities.  Her husband works hard in order for the business to keep going.  Things went well and the money became plentiful so that they could pay back their loan.  They are asking for more assistance to expand their business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Chrispine

texts.en:
Chrispine Opolla O. is a 37-year-old widower who lives within the Kibera slums. He has four children (one boy and three girls) who depend on him. He also takes care of his sister, who he is supporting in the course of education by paying her school fees. He also takes care of his mother and grandmother back at home. Chrispine Opolla O. runs an automotive paint shop where he sells paints.

Chrispine was encouraged by his sister to get into business -- particularly the paint business, because of its uniqueness -- after studying the area in which he wanted to start the business. He started in 1999 using his savings of Ksh 10,000 (USD 150) from his previous employment at a transport company. His sister also supported him by giving him a grant of Ksh 10,000, which he was not required to pay back. Chrispine is still determined and his business is doing well despite the peak and low seasons that affect businesses.

Now Chrispine wishes to expand his business, and therefore intends to buy a spraying machine and stock of different colors and brands of paint worth USD 1,075. The loan, given in the form of paints and stock, will increase his income level to meet his family’s needs. His customers will be satisfied because they will be able to get a wide range of products and services under one roof, saving them time and energy. The repayment period for this loan will be 12 months.

loans.use: To purchase a spraying paint machine and assorted paints

loans.name: Yeyet

texts.en: Yeyet is 30 years old, and a mother of a 17 year old son. She has a small shop which sells some household goods. She can earn $30 per day. Her husband, J., is a driver who earns $3 income per day. She is requesting a $50 loan to buy more goods to fill her shop and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods to fill her shop

loans.name: Fátima

texts.es:
Fatima M. is a hard-working lady with a great drive to improve. Five years ago she started a business selling shoes in the area around the central market of Chinandega, using a small table to set out her products.

She started her business when she was very young, at first she concentrated on her secondary school studies but because of the need to support herself she decided to start her business.

Fatima has worked with CEPRODEL since a year ago, and has been the beneficiary of loans that have helped her business, as now she has been able to get her own stand inside the market and in addition has been able to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Fátima M. es una dama muy esforzada y con gran espíritu de superación. Desde hace 5 años inició su negocio de venta de zapatos en las afueras del mercado central de Chinandega usando una mesita para poner sus productos.

Comenzó su negocio desde muy joven, primeramente se dedicaba a los estudios de secundaria pero por la necesidad de manutención decide inaugurar el negocio.

Hoy en día la señora Fátima trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace un año habiendo sido beneficiada con créditos que le han beneficiado en su negocio ya que ha podido conseguir un local propio dentro del mercado y además ha podido sostener su núcleo familiar.

loans.use: Investment in her business.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Pham Thi N., 41 years old, lives with her husband and her three children (who are still in school) in Y Yen. She joined TYM Fund (Kiva's partner) since 2005. Her husband casts copper while she collects and sells wasted products. During the past two years, Mrs. N. uses most of her loan to buy these wasted products and then to sell them to the wholesalers. The job is hard, but it doesn't bring her much income. Mrs. N. wants to borrow 575 USD so that her husband can buy a specialized machine to process copper. N. hopes their income will increase after buying this machine. Right now her family monthly income is 150 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thị N., 41 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 3 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học tại Ý Yên. Chị tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2005. Chồng chị đi làm nghề đúc đồng còn chị đi thu mua phế liệu. Trong 2 năm qua, những đồng vốn vay từ Quỹ được chị N. sử dụng chủ yếu cho việc thu mua phế liệu ở các nơi về bán cho các đại lý thu mua trong vùng. Công việc thu mua vất vả nhưng thu nhập mang lại cũng bình thường. Hiện nay chị N. đang muốn vay 575USD để chồng chị mua máy gia công hàng đúc để nhận các hàng đúc đồng về làm không phải đi làm thuê. Chị hy vọng thu nhập sẽ tăng lên sau khi mua được máy. Thu nhập hiện tại của gia đình là 150USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy specialized machine to process copper

loans.name: Lois

texts.en: Mrs. Lois L. is 56 years old, is a widow with two children, and works as a farmer. On average, she earns $2 per day. Her children work in the factory to supplement their family's income. To generate additional revenue and income, Mrs. Lea L. is currently requesting a loan $300 from Kiva to purchase additional pigs to raise and breed.

loans.use: To purchase additional pigs to raise and breed.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: Filomena T. is a 26-year old mother of 2 children from Faleseela. She was educated in Samoa College (high school) and finished there. She didn’t have the chance to go to the university due to lack of finances, because both her parents got sick and had no strength to continue to work in their plantation. So, in 2005, Filomena joined SPBD, and borrowed $300 to restart her parent’s plantation. Her business was improving slowly month-by-month, until her father passed away. After her father's death, Filomena paid back her 300 loan and stopped working on the plantation. For a period of time, she relied on her husband's salary for supporting her family. Now her children are ready to start schooling, but she can’t afford to send them to school. That is why Filomena wishes to restart her plantation business. She is requesting a loan of $500 for this purpose.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides for her plantation and vegetable garden.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Saodat Q. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 44 years old, is married and has 5 children. She is a farmer. She rents a piece of land on which she grows wheat. Last year the harves was very poor due to natural causes. The profit from the business was very low. She has already planted the wheat for this year, but does not have enough to pay rent. She is in need of a loan that will help her with that. She plans to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Калбарова Саодат жительница города Вахдат . Ей 44 года , она замужем и имеет 5 детей. Занимается ратениеводством. Имеет землю , которую берет в аренду. Засеивает ее пшеницей. В прошлом году ее урожай не удался , из-за плохих природных условий.Прибыль она получила совсем маленькую . На этот год она уже засеила землю пшеницей. Сейчас ей необходимо оплатить арендную плату . поэтому она запланировала получить кредит, который поможет ей в этом. Погасить кредит Саодат сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Paying rent

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo Rolon has two school age sons with Martha Benitez.

Today, Bernando is taking care of the children alone since Martha went to Spain in order to find a job and thus earn more money. Paraguayans tend to emigrate from Paraguay to countries such as Spain and Argentina in order to produce more income. According to these people, there is no another solution than migration, because they do not find jobs in our country. Remittances are a very important source of income for the whole country.

Bernardo owns a grocery store. In rural areas in Paraguay, the Despensas could be considered as a meeting point, where people not only buy products but also gather and gossip. That is why is Despensas are a very profitable business in those areas.

The money provided by the credit will be used for the purchase of rice, sugar, oil, pasta, drinks, etc.

loans.use: The money provided by the credit will be used for the purchase of rice, sugar, oli, pasta, dirnks, etc.

loans.name: Malek

texts.en: Malek, 47 years old, lives in a small village close to Nabatieh in South Lebanon. He is a married man with 4 children. He owns a small clothes shop next to his home. He needs the amount of USD 1,000 to purchase from wholesalers perfumes and accessories for women. With the beginning of the summer season, there is an increased demand for such products. This inventory increase will allow Malek to expand his business by attracting more clients. Malek has been a client of Al Majmoua for the past 4 years and always repays his loan on time.

loans.use: USD 1,000 to purchase from wholesalers perfumes and accessories for women

loans.name: Aziza's Ujamaa Group

texts.en:
Aziza is 35-years-old, married and has four children, ages 18, 15, 8 and 5. She began selling food and owning livestock in 2000. She works from 6AM to 5PM each day at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Aziza has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Aziza now hopes for a loan to buy more cows and other utensils for her food sales business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who also have businesses dealing with alcohol sales and milk sales.

loans.use: To purchase cows and additional utensils for food sales

loans.name: Castorina

texts.es:
Mrs. Castorina C. is married to Mr. Ramon Cuellar. Together they have two children. Her job since she was young is to knit blankets, embroider lace, and to design and make tablecloths.

Due to her creativity and sacrifice, she began to grow her business and her work is now known throughout various regions of her country where she has sold her goods and grown her clientele. Doing this has enabled her to better meet her family's needs and improve their lives.

With this loan she plans to purchase more thread.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Castorina Cáceres está casada con el Sr. Ramón Cuellar, juntos tienen dos hijos, su actividad desde joven fue la de tejer colchas, encaje ju, confección de manteles.

A través de su creatividad y sacrificio fue creciendo y en la actualidad de la distribución la producción se encarga el conyugue que recorre por varias zonas del país adquiriendo clientes y aumentando la venta ,mejorando así el nivel de vida de su familia.

Con el crédito comprará hilos

loans.use: To purchase thread.  (Compra de hilos)

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is 48 years old. She is married with 6 children between the ages of 8 and 28 years old. She has been a vegetable seller since 1992. Everyday she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Tatu is now looking for a loan to buy more vegetables for her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Segunda

texts.es:
La señora Segunda C. A. tiene 55 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal San Luis y al Comedor Popular de su caserío. Vive en el sector de Carata 061 del caserío de Motil, distrito de Agallpampa, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta segundo año de educación Primaria y no continuó porque se quedó huérfana de madre y al papá no le interesaba que las hijas mujeres tengan instrucción. Se casó y tiene 4 hijos, los cuales  sólo uno dependen de ella. 
Segunda, como toda mujer emprendedora, realiza diversos negocios, compra y vende animales, entre ellos cerdos, ovejas y cuyes, los vende en carne o vivos y elabora pan, compra y vende leña. Su negocio se ubica en  su casa.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles, cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró animales y leña para su uso personal y para vender.
Con este crédito de 1,500 soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, piensa comprar animales y materiales para la elaboración de pan.
Su sueño es tener un gran negocio para poder ayudar a los más necesitados.
texts.en:
Segunda C. A. is 55 years old and is a member of the San Luis y al Comedor Popular community bank in her area. She lives in the Carata 061 sector in the area of Motil, Agallpampa district, Otuzco province, La Libertad department in Perú. She studied until the second grade and didn't continue because her mother died and it wasn't important to her father that girls receive an education. She got married and has 4 children, of which only one is still dependent on her. Segunda, like all enterprising women, performs various jobs. She sells and buys animals, such as pigs, sheep, and guinea pigs; she sells them alive or as meat. She also makes bread and buys and sells firewood. Her business is located in her house. With her first loan of 300 Soles, which was repaid in 4 months, she bought animals and firewood for her personal use as well as to sell. With this loan of 1,500 Soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she plans to buy animals as well as materials for making bread. Her dream is to have a big business to be able to help the needy.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of animals and materials for making bread

loans.name: Chomrong

texts.en:
Mr. Chomrong M. is 28 years old and works for a stone-crushing factory. He began working there in 2006 and currently earns approximately US $3.00 each day.

Chomrong's wife, Mrs. Noeuk Mao, 28, is a farmer who specializes in growing rice and vegetable crops. She is also a good housewife who care for their two young children, both of whom go to school. Together the family lives in Oprasat Commune, Banteay Meanchey Province. 

Chomrong is requesting a loan of US $250 for his wife, to purchase rice seeds. This loan will help them increase their income so they can support their children's school fees, as well as their daily meals.

Chomrong's wife, Noeuk, is pictured because Chomrong was unavailable at the time.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds

loans.name: Friday

texts.en: Friday O. sells shoes at Uselu market in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. The demands for his shoes are high. He is 39 years old and single. He needs the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more shoes to sell. He says "thank you" to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Sevindj

texts.en: Sevindj (her husband is pictured) is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. Now she is settled in the Fizuli region, in a Bala Bahmanli village. She is the mother of three children, and has been running her dairy business for six years. She is requesting a loan so she can purchase a pregnant cow to expand her business and help raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a pregnant cow for a dairy business

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es: Maria Angélica a la edad de 8 años, siendo una niña tuvo la iniciativa de ayudar a su abuela a la preparación de comida, que era el negocio que ella tenia, luego la ayudo a vender en el mercado la  variedad de comida que la abuela preparaba, después de un tiempo Angélica colaboraba a despachar la comida en bolsitas a las personas compradoras en el mercado local de Sumpango, al pasar varios años la abuela le dio la oportunidad de compartir las ventas dándole tres días a la semana para que vendiera la comida, esto  le ayudo a tener experiencia en las ventas de las comidas.  Con el tiempo su abuela ya no pudo continuar con el negocio de venta de comida y le dejo el negocio a Angélica, lo cual le dio la oportunidad de cambiar los tipos de comidas para obtener mas ganancias y es así como Angélica se hizo responsable por el negocio.  Ahora ella trabaja por su propia cuenta, y por eso necesita un préstamo para comprar mercadería por cantidades grandes  a un precio cómodo, y lograr de esta manera mejores ganancias.  Su deseo es ampliar su negocio para ser de apoyo a su familia y colaborar en las necesidades como lo es el sustento diario.
texts.en:
Maria Angélica, as a little girl, took the initiative at the age of eight to help her grandmother in the preparation of food, which was her grandmother's business. Later she helped her grandmother at the market sell the variety of food that she prepared. After a time, Angélica worked with her grandmother to sell the food in little bags to the shoppers in the local market of Sumpango. After several years, her grandmother gave her the opportunity to share the sales giving her three days each week to sell the food, which helped her gain experience in food sales. Eventually, her grandmother was not able to continue with the business of food sales and left the business to Angélica, which gave her the opportunity to take responsibility for the business and change the types of food sold to obtain more earnings. Now she works on her own budget, which is why she needs a loan to buy merchandise in large quantities at an agreeable price, and in this way make greater earnings. Her desire is to increase her business to support her family and help meet the daily needs of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for her business in food sales.

loans.name: Ogundare

texts.en: Ogundare is 36 years old and married with 3 children. Ogundare sells dried yams. Dried yams are used for making yam flour. She is requesting a loan of $350 to purchase more dried yam to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more dried yam to sell

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Bancomunal El sembrador.
Maria es conviviente tiene 46 años, cuatro hijos de 25,18,13 y  3 años los menores están en la escuela estatal.
Maria vende en la tienda de su hermana ropa interior y cosméticos por catalogo también ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo. 
Desde que esta en Finca, tiene mas capital, se siente contenta en el Bancomunal 
Maria necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de ropa interior y compra de productos de belleza.
El sueño de Maria es que sus hijos sean profesionales
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank "El sembrador". Maria is 46, a common-law wife with 4 children of 25, 18, 13, and 3 years of age. The younger are in the state school. Maria sells underclothing and cosmetics by catalog in her sister's shop. She also sells beauty products by catalog. Since she has been in FINCA, she has accumulated more capital, so she is very happy in the communal bank. Maria needs a loan of US$275 to purchase underclothing and other beauty products. Maria's dream is that her children would become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of underclothing and beauty products

loans.name: Ebenezer

texts.en:
Ebenezer M. is 29 years old, married and father of a school-going child. He lives with his family at Eguase in the central region of Ghana. Ebenezer is very hardworking and wants to provide for his immediate family. Ebenezer is a dealer in electrical and electronic parts. Professionally, he is an electrician who takes contracts from clients to wire their houses. He is consistent and reliable in his job, and has won many contracts.

At the time we visited him, he had four contracts which are yet to be executed by him and his three workers. He has been an electrician for nine years. He wants the loan to buy materials frequently used for work. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices at Accra and sells to his customers at retail prices. With the loan, he believes he can be more resourced to expand his areas of work. He says your assistance would be much welcome. Ebenezer belongs to a village bank called ‘Independence’.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of electrical and electronic parts.

loans.name: Sobirjon

texts.en:
K. Sobirjon is 30 years old and married. During the last eight years Sobirjon has been providing the services of transportation. As a rule, he is working in his region only. At the same time, together with the help of his wife, he is raising cattle, which gives additional income to his family.

Currently, Sobirjon’s truck needs repairing. So he requests $900 for the term of nine months. Sobirjon promises to pay the loan on time and would like to thank everyone for their support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts necessary for the maintenance of his truck

loans.name: Ablagan Mawuko

texts.fr: Cette femme est divorcée de son mari et a à sa charge ses 04 enfants. L’activité qu’elle exerce et qui lui permet de subvenir aux charges de ses enfants est la vente de charbons de bois et de maïs. Elle s’approvisionne à kpalimé qui est une ville à l’intérieur du pays. Son stock est épuisé, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 30 sacs de charbons de bois et 30 sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
This woman is divorce and has four children to support. The work that she does, and that enables her to provide for her children, involves selling charcoal and corn. She acquires her supplies in Kpalimé, which is an inland city. Because her inventory is exhausted, she wants to stock up again and is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 30 sacks of charcoal and 30 sacks of corn.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal and corn

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
Jovita es socia del Banco Comunal Rosas.
Jovita es casada, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Jovita tiene una ferretería llamada Renzo, en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hermana.
Jovita necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de accesorios de tubería.
Los sueños de Jovita son ser empresaria, ampliar su negocio y tener un local propio.
texts.en:
Jovita is a member of the Rosas (Roses) Communal Bank. Jovita is married, 37 years old, and has two children. Jovita has a hardware store called Renzo in a rented location where she works everyday with the help of her sister.

Jovita needs a loan of 1000 PEN which will be invested in the purchase of piping accessories. Jovita’s dream is to be a businesswoman, grow her business, and to have her own location.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of piping accessories.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
La señora Elva de Huancavelica, emprendedora e ingeniosa, tiene 46 años de edad, conviviente, tiene 3 hijos mayores e independientes. Trabaja con EDAPROSPO hace 3 años, se dedica a la venta de tejidos manuales diversos como   tapetes, adornos y otros, y también a la venta de queso, para realizar esta actividad Elva aprovecha la movilidad de su esposo quien se dedica al transporte de carga pesada todos los fines de semana a la Oroya. Teniendo ella la ventaja de vender a los habitantes de la mina y otros, luego de regreso compra queso para distribuirlos según pedidos. Esta actividad  le permite cubrir gastos en el hogar  y acumular  capital  para comprar  lana y queso. 
El reciente préstamo de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles lo invertirá en comprar  más lana de diversos colores. 
En el futuro le gustaría contar con más capital para poder cubrir los pedidos solicitados de sus clientes y completar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Elva, from Huancavelica, is entrepreneurial and ingenious. She is 46 years old, lives with her common-law husband, and has 3 adult children who live independently. She has worked with EDAPROSPO for 3 years and sells handicrafts such as small rugs, decorations, etc. She also sells cheese. To do this she takes advantage of the fact that her husband is a truck driver who transports heavy cargo every weekend to La Oroya. She can sell to the people who live at the mine and others, and on the return trip she purchases cheese to distribute and fill orders. This activity enables her to cover her expenses at home and to save capital to purchase wool and cheese. The most recent loan of 700.00 new soles will be used to purchase more wool in various colors. In the future she would like to save more capital to be able to cover all of her customers' orders and to finish building her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more wool in various colors

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is from the village of Villaflor, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Elizabeth is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, a sari-sari or general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2000 PHP per month for these activities.

In 1995, Elizabeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Elizabeth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary E. is married and has 5 dependants. She has received no formal education. Mary sells food at Amissanu in Elmina, which she has done since 2004. Her husband works at KEEA District Assembly. Mary uses her income to pay bills. Mary will use the loan to purchase more foodstuffs. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to reinvest.

loans.use: Mary will use the loan to purchase more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega específicamente en el Mercado Central la señora Albertina L. se dedica a la venta de mecates desde hace 23 años aproximadamente habiéndose destacado en esta actividad ya que es muy visitada por los clientes que hacen uso de estos mecates.

Ella ha solicitado el crédito para dar lugar a la compra de los mecates y de esta manera seguir adelante en su negocio. Su record crediticio con Ceprodel es de 40 créditos a lo largo de su vida en este trabajo y habiendo sido pagados todos los créditos satisfactoriamente por ella misma.
texts.en:
Albertina L. sells rope in the Chinandega department, more specifically, in the Central Market. She has been doing this for approximately 23 years. She stands out in this business. She is frequented often by her customers who use rope. She has asked for a credit to buy the rope. This way she will get ahead in her business. Her credit record with Ceprodel is that she has had 40 loans in her life in this work. She made all of her loan payments satisfactorily by herself.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rope

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.en:
Nicolasa A. is from the village of Rizal in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old. Nicolasa is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Nicolasa sells vegetables to local community members. Nicolasa has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 7,000.00 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Nicolasa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nicolasa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Nicolasa is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory to be used as working capital. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Nicolasa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Beina

texts.en:
Beina is a member of the Maendeleo borrower group in Nzonwe, Mbeya, She is 45 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 11, 23, 19  years old.

Beina has owned a food business selling soup for 4 years, she works 10 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Beina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities for her business. 


With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Beina hopes to save more money, pay school fess, get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more meat, chicken for her business

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es: El Sr. Celestino tiene 71 años esta casado con la señora Atanacia  de 67 años,cuentan con 1 hijo que esta casado  y  es estudiante. El señor trabajo mucho tiempo en la Argentina como empleado, se caso y decidio volver a su pais para posteriormente dedicarse a la venta de accesorios para guitarras. Actualmente cuenta con varios clientes formados ya que la zona en donde vive la gran mayoria se dedica a la confeccion de guitarras. Le gustaría que las autoridades inviertan mas su tiempo en salud, trabajo,  educacion y seguridad.
texts.en:
Mr. Celestino is 71 years old and married to Mrs. Atanacia of 67. They have 1 son who is married and a student. Don Celestino worked for a long time as an employee in Argentina where he got married and then decided to return to his country. Afterwards he sold guitar accessories for a living. At the present he counts on several customers as people in the area where he lives mostly make guitars for a living. He would like the authorities to invest more time in health, work, education, and security.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pegboxes and guitar strings.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Sao M., 43, is a professional decorator of women’s clothes who lives in Takeo province. Since 2005, she has been using beads and other materials to make flower designs on women’s clothes to earn a living and typically makes US$2.50 each day. Sao’s husband is a construction worker building houses and makes US$5 per day.

Decorated dresses are a kind of Khmer traditional dress and women wear them during Water Festival, P’chum Ben or Khmer New Year. It takes around 7 to 10 days to complete each dress and so they are expensive but most of the people prefer hand made over machine made. She said she learned how to decorate from her mother and she has been doing this business since before she was married.

Sao M. would like a loan of US$1,000 to purchase beads, cloth and other materials to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase beads, cloth and other materials

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa es una joven muy trabajadora, tiene 26 años y vive en su casa propia con sus 4 hijos: Raúl de 10, Miriam de 7, Yudith de 5 y Freddy de 1 año, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

La crianza de ganado es una actividad que Josefa aprendió desde muy pequeña de sus padres, quienes siempre trabajaron muy duro para darle una buena vida. Actualmente tiene su propio ganado, el cual cuida y alimenta muy bien, ya que sabe que de la buena crianza de sus animales, dependen los ingresos económicos que tendrá su familia.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es alimentar a sus animales, lleva 6 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trasladar su ganado hasta la feria donde lo vende. 
Para más adelante, espera poder incrementar el número de reses que tiene y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Josefa con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo, aunque para ello tenga que ahorrar poco a poco. En su banco comunal es una socia muy activa y solidaria, motivo por el cual es muy respetada por sus compañeras. Con los dos mil soles solicitados comprará una ternera para criarla y alimentarla, con el dinero que sobre comprará forraje (pasto) para su ganado.
texts.en:
Josefa is a very hard-working young woman. She is 26 years old and lives in her own home with her four children: Raúl, 10; Miriam, 7; Yudith, 5; and Freddy, 1; who are the motivation for all her efforts. Josefa learned how to raise cattle from a very young age from her parents, who always worked very hard to give her a better life. Currently she has her own cattle, which she raises and feeds very well, since her family's economic income depends on it. What she most enjoys about her job is feeding her animals. She has been doing this for six years and considers transferring the cattle to the market where they are sold is the hardest part. In the future, she hopes to increase the heads of cattle she has and in this way increase her income. This is Josefa's second loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she feels the responsibility to pay on time even if it means having to save little by little. She is a very active and supportive member of her community bank, which is why she is very respected by her fellow members. With the 2,000 soles she is requesting, she plans to buy a calf to rear and feed, and with the remainder of the money she will purchase feed for her cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thy O. lives in Thommoney village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectare (3.75-acre) piece of land on which she cultivates rice.

Mrs. Thy O. is a widow with five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school. Now she has decided to ask fO. a loan to buy a motorbike fO. her children to use to go to work to reduce expenses.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children to use to go to work

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en: Bernadette is a married woman and the mother of two children. She works as a beautician providing beauty services to the ladies in her town. Today, Bernadette is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy a laser machine in order provide this service to her clients.

loans.use: buy a laser machine

loans.name: Amistad Eterna Group

texts.es: En el Centro Focal “German Busch”, se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Amistad Eterna” tiene 10 integrantes, todas tienen diferentes negocios como de producción, comercialización y servicio. Su presidenta es Juana C., Secretaria de Actas es Bernarda Q. y Tesorera es Aurora Alanota, conjuntamente con la base elaboran su reglamento interno con el cual trabajaran el presente ciclo o préstamo, a todas les agrada capacitarse y visitar al consultorio.
texts.en:
You will find the Amistad Eterna Communal Bank in the German Busch community center. It has ten members who all have different businesses like production, commerce, and service. Their president is Juana C., their secretary is Bernanda Q., and their treasurer is Aurora Alanota. Together with the base they make their internal rules. They work with the rules for the present cycle or loan. They like the meetings and visiting the clinic.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies, raw material, and merchandise

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is 38 years old and married with a child. His wife sells foodstuffs to support her home.

Elijah loves baking and that is why he commercialized his baking skills. He bakes loaves of bread to sell at wholesale and retail prices to his customers. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He hopes to own a catering school in the future.

Elijah hopes for a loan of NGN 160,000 to purchase more bags of flour to bake more loaves of bread to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more flour to bake more loaves of bread to sell

loans.name: Afde Group No. 5

texts.en:
Ms. Ndeye Arame N. heads AFDE Group No. 5. Aged 60, she has a long experience working in small restaurants. Her aunt on her father's side introduced her to the business, teaching her the trade.

Ms. N. sells breakfast, lunch and dinner and would like to use part of her loan to replenish her stock of poultry and meat. The other part she will invest in her side business: selling hair weaves.

Each member of the group receives 100,000 FCFA for their business. Like Ms. N., Seynabou F. also sells hair weaves; Ms. Fatma F. sells breakfast items (e.g. sandwiches with bean-spread, mayonnaise, eggs, etc.); Ms. Maguath F. sells frozen juices; and Ms. Baba Coumba L. sells fish. 


L'Association des Femmes pour le Developpement d'Entreprises (AFDE: Association of Women for Business Development) is a cooperative of small-scale traders working in Thies, a city about seventy kilometers from Dakar. The Association was founded in 1993 by twenty entrepreneurial women as a cooperative to increase their purchasing power and to organize a tontine. A tontine is a revolving group loan in which each member contributes a small amount to a daily fund, with a different member financed each day.

The tontine has evolved to more formal group loans through UIMCEC. For such loans, the members are split into five-member groups, with a designated president and treasurer. These sub-groups may be the same for many years, but often change members depending on financing needs and other considerations. The AFDE organizes monthly member meetings and runs a cooperative for its members, allowing them to buy rice and other staples at a better price. The association's President is Ms. Mame Diarra Mar.

loans.use: To replenish her stock of poultry and meat

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Mrs. Agapita L. is from Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 54 years old and married with one child. She owns a sari-sari (variety) store and her husband is a farmer. Her store serves as their second source of income because her husband supports their basic daily needs.  

Agapita joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to engage in business activities. She has managed her business for more than five years and makes approximately $140 a month. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. Now she wants a new loan of 14,000 PHP for the purpose of additional capital to cover the expansion of her sari-sari store. It will be her 4th cycle loan from PMPC.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
El Señor Silvio  es casado, tiene 42 años, con 3 hijos.
La despensa montó gracias a un pequeño capital que había  ahorrado. Anteriormente se dedicaba como ayudante de albañil. 
Quiere comprar mercaderías al por mayor, pues, así consigue más barato las mercaderías y tiene un margen importante de ganancia.
El señor Silvio es una persona muy activa tiene un espíritu jovial.  Manifiesta que quiere mejorar su negocio ya que es la fuente de su ingreso. 
El se esfuerza a lo máximo para mejorar su negocio, pero sin descuidarse de su  capital  por lo que considero que es una persona a quien debemos apoyar constantemente, ya sea económica y moralmente.
texts.en:
Silvio is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children. He started up his general store thanks to a little capital he had saved. Prior to that he had made a living as a bricklayer’s assistant. Silvio wants to purchase wholesale merchandise, since such merchandise is cheaper and the extra margin would allow him to increase his earnings. Silvio is a very active person who has a cheerful demeanor. He says that he wants to improve his business, since it is his only source of income. Silvio puts his best effort into improving his business without being careless with his money. For that reason he is someone who deserves constant economic and moral support.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing soft drinks, yerba maté, wine, etc.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: El señor M. P. tiene 4 años de trabajar con esta institución financiera, actualmente habita en la comarca San Miguelito, El Sauce, se dedica a la actividad agropecuaria contando con su propia finca, asimismo su ganado y tierras dedicadas a la actividad  agropecuaria. Es necesario mencionar que tiene 41 años de experiencia de trabajar en la explotación de su propiedad.
texts.en:
Mr. M. P. has collaborated with this financial institution for 4 years. He currently resides in San Miguelito, El Sauce. He is a farmer/cattleman. He has his own farm, cattle and farmlands dedicated to these activities. It's worth mentioning that he has farmed his land for 41 years.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a young bull, a young cow, wire fencing and staples.

loans.name: Sheilla

texts.en: Sheilla is 28 years old. She is a married mother of two children. Sheilla owns a retail shop in Likoni, which she initiated in 2007 as a supplement to her previous business. She sells essential commodities used in the community such as sugar, flour, cooking oil, rice, beans and kerosene. She gets her stock from wholesalers in Mombasa town. She says that her stock level has gone down due to limited funds, thus she needs Kshs 30,000 to buy stock in bulk.

loans.use: To purchase more stock in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: He is 38 years old, married and has 5 children. He finished primary school. He will use this loan to develop and enlarge his shop. His family income will rise and he could get more constant clients to his shop. He is a good bread-winner and has to work hard to earn his living. He has a superb reputation in the market due to his age and also his fresh food and reasonable prices compared to his neighbors. This mini market is deemed as a major source to his earnings. He has been working in this business for a long time.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: EL SEÑOR ORLANDO ES SOLTERO, ESTUDIA EN LA UNIVERSIDAD, DEDICADO AL TRANSPORTE DIARIO EN DIFERENTES VEHICULOS Y DIFERENTES RUTAS DEL PAIS, SE DEDICA A ESTE SERVICIO DURANTE BASTANTE TIEMPO PARA SALIR ADELANTE YA QUE ES SU UNICO SUSTENTO PARA SUS HERMANOS Y SUS PADRES, SEL SEÑOR REALIZA ESTE TRABAJO DURANTE EL DIA YA QUE POR LAS NOCHES DEDICA SU TIEMPO A SUS ESTUDIOS YA QUE EL CREE QUE EL TRABAJO ACTUAL QUE EL TIENE SOLO ES POR UN TIEMPO CORTO Y ASI PODER EJERCER LA PROFESION, CLARO QUE EL TAMBIEN ENTIENTE QUE PARA ESTO DEBERA CONTINUAR TRABAJANDO CON MAS EMPEÑO, ES UN JOVEN RESPONSABLE Y TRABAJADOR CON MUCHAS GANAS DE SUPERACION, SU DESEO ES EL DE TERMINAR SU CARRERA UNIVERSITARIA Y A SI PODER MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE VIDA DE TODA SU FAMILIA. CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA REPUESTOS PARA EL ARREGLO DE SU VEHICULO YA QUE ESTE TIEMPO ESTA PRESENTANDO ALGUNAS FALLAS Y ESO NO LE PERMITE BRINDAR UN MEJOR SERVICIO A SUS CLIENTES, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Orlando is unmarried and is a college student. He also works as a driver of several types of vehicles, driving various routes around the country. He has had this job for some time in order to help him get ahead, because it is the only source of income for his siblings and his parents. He works during the day and studies at night. He believes that this current job will only be temporary and that he will eventually work in the profession he studies for. However, he also understands that in order to achieve that goal he must continue working hard. Orlando is a responsible and hard-working young man with a great desire to better his situation. He would like to finish his college degree and be able to improve his entire family's quality of life. With the loan money he will buy spare parts to repair his vehicle. It is currently having some mechanical problems and this does not allow him to offer the best level of service to his clients. He is very thankful to Kiva and Emprender [the Kiva field partner] for the confidence they have shown in him by giving him a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a LAPO client with good repayment record. She is 33 years old, married with 4 children. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports their home. Her children are excelling in school. She sells pineapples at retail prices to make a living. She is very happy to expand the size of her business in order to make more profits. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more pineapples to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more pineapples to sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa S. is from the village of Manuyog, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 27 years old. Teresa is married and has four infant children. To make a living, Teresa owns & operates a business selling seafood products including fish, dried squid and shrimp in the local community. Teresa is just starting this business.

In 2010, Teresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresa is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used as additional working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Teresa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Mohamed Jallo Group

texts.en:
Marama J., who we see here holding a sign, leads a group of five borrowers called Mohamed J.. She is 47 years old, widowed and has four children who range in age from 14 to 26 years old. She was not able to attend school due to poverty, and for the last 12 years has made a living selling rice and oil in a local market in Paynesville, a small town which is located on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She is good at attracting new customers to her stand because she enjoys talking to people in a friendly manner. She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 40,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more bags of rice and more gallons of oil to sell. Marama describes herself as a very peaceful person, and dreams of helping her children have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, we see loan group member Hawa in an inset at lower right because she was not able to be present at the interview.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and more gallons of oil to sell to her customers

loans.name: Kadidia

texts.fr:
Madame Kadidia B. a 30 ans, mariée et mère de deux filles. Elle vit avec son époux et leurs enfants à Sanoubougou I-Kapel Kourou, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Kadidia B. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et de vente d’huile alimentaire, de couscous arabe,  de cube maggi etc il y a maintenant six ans. Elle mène son activité à la maison et au marché de son quartier où elle dispose  d’une place. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux ans. Elle est actuellement à son 3ème prêt individuel et les deux précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 8 bidons d’huile alimentaire, 3 cartons de couscous arabe, 5 cartons de  cube maggi, 3 cartons du thé Arawane, etc. 
Elle  achète ses marchandises sur commande à Bobo Dioulasso (république de Burkina Faso) et aussi dans les huileries de  la place avant de les revendre en détail au marché de leur localité.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kadidia B. is 30 years old, married and the mother of two girls. She lives with her husband and their children in Sanoubougou I-Kapel Kourou, one of the boroughs on the outskirts of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having tried several activities without success, Mrs. Kadidia B. began six years ago the commerce of vegetable oil, Arabian couscous, and “Maggi” cubes. She runs her business at home and at her neighbourhood market where she has a reserved emplacement. She is very much in demand by her customers due to the quality of her products. To satisfy their increasing numbers, she decided two years ago to join the Soro Yiriwaso MFI. She is now requesting a third loan, having repaid both preceding ones. She will use this loan to buy 8 containers of vegetable oil, 3 packages of Arabian couscous, 5 packages of Maggi cubes, 3 packages of Arawane tea, etc. She orders her products from Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso) and from local oil producers, before retailing them in their local market. She hopes this loan will help her attain monthly earnings of 100,000 FCFA, which will be used essentially to increase her working capital, contribute towards family expenses and pay her loan interests.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
la sra. Martha E. G. tiene 40 años de edad, vive en union libre y se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, este a sido su patrimonio durante mucho tiempo ya que su madre crecio en este negocio y ahora Martha hoy se dedica a la venta de tortillas, las fabrica en su casa de habitacion y tiene la ayuda de su hijo mayor que le entrega las tortillas a los clientes en sus casas.
Martha vive con sus tres hijos renta su casa.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar maiz, leña, cal, agua y fosforos.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y la alimentacion de su familia.
su mayor deseo es que sus hijos sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha E. G. is 40, is in a common-law marriage, and has been making and selling tortillas for some years. She learned the trade in the family since her mother raised her with this business and now Martha works selling the tortillas. She makes them in her house and her oldest son helps her by delivering the tortillas to the customers at their homes. Martha lives with her three children in a rented house. She will use the loan to buy corn, firewood, lime, water and matches. She needs the earnings to cover the household expenses and to feed her family. Her biggest desire is that her children become people with good incomes.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, lime, flour, water and matches

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 40-year-old married woman from Lebanon. A mother of 5 school-age children, she has established a small clothing shop in her home. She sells women's and children's clothing including lingerie. Her husband is the provider of the family but she supports him with the income she makes. With her US $1000 loan requested from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., she will purchase more merchandise for her business, specifically to increase her selection of women’s and children’s clothes. In the coming year, she expects to increase her profits by 15%. Also, she hopes that she can open a formal store in the future. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been withheld to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specializing in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Crisanto

texts.en:
Crisanto T. is from the village of Brgy. Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 44 years old. Crisanto is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Crisanto owns and operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing tricycle transport services. Crisanto has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Crisanto joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crisanto has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase tires and other accessories. Crisanto is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair the existing vehicle to provide better service. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Crisanto from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Vitorino Ernesto

texts.pt:
Victorino  Ernesto M. nasceu na Provincia de  Inhambane sul de Moçambique, casado, é pai de 4 filhos de 5 aos 12 anos, todos eles vão a Escola. Vive na casa propria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém para alem da sua família.. 

Sai de Inhambane para cumprir o serviço militar obrigatorio e trabalha como guarda presional durante 5 anos. depois faz o curso de Acção Ambiental, é afecto na Agricultura no Distrito de Namaacha como agente de serviço (guarda) e na irrigação das plantas, (17h as 7h) auferindo mensalmente 1.900.00mt. Para alêm de trabalhar na agricultura tem prestado serviços de jardinhagem na Paróquia da Nossa Senhora de Fátima nas 2ª,3ª e 5ª feira no periodo da manhã auferindo 1.000.00mt e nas 4ª e sabados  no mercado informal onde faz seus negócios de venda de material de construção de pequena escala tais como (prego, estribus, fios de energia, quadros e mais).

Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Victorino na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar (ferro, pregos, quadros de energia e outros) para aumentar a quantidade do seu produto. Os empréstimos  anteriores de (6.000.00 e 10.000.00mt) forão usados para aumentar e renovar o seu estabelecimento comercial (ferragem). 
Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para criação de pintos.
texts.en:
Victorino Ernesto was born in the Province of Inhambane, South of Mozambique. He is married and the father of four children between the ages of 5 and 12. All children go to school. He lives in his own home with his family and doesn't support anyone other than them. He left Inhambane to comply with mandatory military service and worked as a prison guard for five years. He later took "Environmental Action" classes and was designated as a service agent (guard) and responsible plant irrigation (from 5pm to 7am) in the Department of Agriculture of the Namaacha District making 1,900 meticais per month there. Besides working for the department, he has rendered gardening services at the Our Lady of Fatima Parish on Mondays, Tuesdays and Thursdays mornings making 1,000 meticais. On Wednesdays and Saturdays he works in the informal marked where he has a business selling small construction materials such as different types of nails, power cables, switch boards and more. This is Victorino's third loan with Hluvuku and second with Kiva in the amount of 20,000 meticais. He intends to buy iron, nails, switch boards and other products to increase his inventory. The previous loans in the amount of 6,000 and 10,000 were used to increase the size and renovate her shop (hardware). He is confident he will pay back the loan ahead of time and request a new loan to raise chickens.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of iron, nails, switch boards and others

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is widowed and has a son. She runs a small business selling women's clothing at an open-air market in Kherson, Ukraine. She has been in business for fifteen years. Her monthly income is 2,500 UAH.

A large variety of clothes, a good location and great client service have helped Tamara to succeed in her business. She has many repeat clients who buy clothing from her. Tamara uses her income to help her son financially during difficult economic times.

Tamara is requesting a loan of 8,750 UAH to purchase seasonal inventory. She hopes to receive additional income and use it for her and her son's current needs.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis de 30 años, es taxista y tiene un pequeño taller mecánico, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil zona caracterizada por sus caminos montañosos.

El es taxista recorre todas las calles de Guayaquil con una tarifa muy baja. Para obtener mas dinero el trabaja en ocasiones con el papa en el taller mecánico que tiene. Trabaja de lunes a viernes desde muy temprano como taxista y los fines de semana en el taller donde arregla la parte eléctrica. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento y bloques para readecuar el taller mecánico. En un futuro quiere un local para tener su negocio mas establecido.
texts.en:
Luis is 30 years old, a taxi driver, and owns a small auto shop.  He lives in the urban outskirts of Paraiso de Guayaquil, an area characterized by its mountain roads.  

He is a taxi driver that circulates throughout the streets of Guayaquil with a very low fare.  In order to earn more money, he occasionally works with his father in his auto shop.  He works Monday to Friday from very early in the morning as a taxi driver and on the weekends, in the shop, where he fixes electric parts.  

With this loan, he wants to purchase cement and blocks in order to redo his auto shop.  In the future, he wants his own store front in order to have a more fixed business.

loans.use: Purchase cement and blocks.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina M. is a seamstress, but since 1999, she and her husband have been engaged in a food and household goods trading business in Ijevan city. Their shop works at night as well, so they have a good profit, which allows them to solve their family’s problems, to buy necessary furniture for their house and to organize their elder daughter’s wedding. 

In the future Nina hopes to increase her business and to gain more profit. Now she asks for a 700,000 AMD loan to increase the assortment of products in her shop. She wants to buy bars of chocolate and other sweets, beverage foods and household goods to resell.

loans.use: To buy bars of chocolate and other sweets, beverages, foods and household goods to resell

loans.name: Mabibo Freedom Group

texts.en:
Said M. is in his early thirties and is married with one son. Over the past 5 years he has been running a tailoring business to support himself and his family. The shop is open between 8:00 am and 6:00 pm and earns Said a low monthly profit. 

This will be Said's first loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Said's aim is to use the loan to increase his stock in garments in order to ensure a smooth production product, so that customers products are ready on time. Said's dream is to one day open a workplace where he can teach tailoring to other people.
