Said will share this loan with his loan group Mabibu Freedom, which totals 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Said can be seen second from left in the back row.

loans.use: Increase Stock

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en: Rosenda M. is 55 years old, married and supports her family by operating a sari-sari (variety) store. She lives in Crossing, Barangay Bunga, Toledo City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari store, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 5,200 PHP. Rosenda is now borrowing 25,000 PHP so that she could fund her business operations. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 20,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Rosenda aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Fund her business operations

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is 26 years old and married to a wholesaler who sells peas. She has two children who are between the ages of one and six. None of her children are enrolled in school yet. Jeannette sells peas and beans in bulk and she has been doing this for a period of six years. Her business is prospering and Jeanette has decided to request this loan to buy more beans to sell.  She hopes to renovate her house from the expected profits. She says that her business succeeds because she manages to pay rent for her business as well as pay for other basic needs. She would like to be a sole distributor of peas in the future.

loans.use: To buy more peas and beans to sell.

loans.name: Kipino Ole

texts.en:
Kipino is 32 years old and married to Motayian ene Kipino. They have three children. For the last eight years, Kipino has been rearing animals to sell in Naivasha town.

A friend introduced Kipino to KADET LTD and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy five bulls that he will raise and sell later at a profit. In the future, Kipino hopes to begin large-scale farming and have dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy five bulls

loans.name: Lupe Jazmin

texts.es:
Lupe de 34 años, es una mujer trabajadora que con dedicación y  ayuda de su esposo han podido mantener su hogar. Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada Suburbio ha trabajado con el empuje de su mama que desde que comenzó su negocio la ayuda dándole ánimos e incentivándola para que lo ubique en un mercado cerca de su casa. Ya tiene un año con el puesto de venta de bisutería y ropa trabajando desde las 08h00am hasta las 14h00pm vendiendo ropa, bisutería a un bajo costo. 

Quiere continuar ayudándole a su esposo con los gastos familiares por eso quiere con el préstamo comprar ropa y bisutería. En el futuro uno de sus objetivos es que su familia se encuentre unida y seguir trabajando en su negocio para poder agrandarlo.
texts.en:
Lupe is 34 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who, through commitment and the help of her husband, has been able to support her household.

Lupe lives in an urban area called Suburbio.  She has always had her mom's support and encouragement.  Since she started out in her business her mom has helped her, providing her with encouragement and motivating her to set up her business in a market near her home.  Lupe has had her sales stall where she sells costume jewelry and clothes for one year.  She works from 8.00am to 2.00pm selling clothes and costume jewelry at low prices.  She would like to continue helping her husband with their family expenses.  She needs this loan to buy clothes and jewelry.

In the future, Lupe's goals are for her family to be united and to continue working in her business and be able to expand it.

loans.use: To buy clothes and costume jewelry

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Martha; ella tiene 21 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende ropa para mujeres y varones como polos, chompas, polos y pantalones, ella tiene un pequeño Kiosco donde vende la ropa,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Martha is 21 years old.  She lives with her partner and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling clothes.  Martha sells men's and women's clothes such as polo shirts, sweaters and pants.  She has a small stand where she makes her sales.  Martha would like to expand her business and is requesting this loan to buy clothes wholesale.

Martha is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy clothes wholesale

loans.name: Tuul

texts.en:
Mrs.Tuul is a 45-year-old widow.  She lives with her only son in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her 18-year-old son, Lkhagvasuren, is currently unemployed and is planning to join the army, a compulsory service for men who reached 18 in Mongolia. At the moment he is helping his mother’s business. 

Since 2005 Mrs.Tuul has been running a business selling children's clothes. Once a month she travels to Ereen, a Chinese border city, and buys  clothes for resale. Sometimes she buys them from wholesalers who bring them from China. She rents a stall in Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar.

Mrs. Tuul is the only bread winner for her family and her business is the only source of income.  She is planning to increase her sales capacity by renting one more stall and buying more children's clothes before the lunar new year. She is applying for a loan to buy more children’s clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes for resale

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Саъдиева Зулфия жительница района Шахритус. Ей 33 года. Она замужем, имеет 5 детей. Дети еще учатся в средней школе. Муж работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сама Зулфия уже два года как занимается шитьем. У нее имеется ателье, где она и ее ученицы шьют национальные платья. Кредит берет для закупа новой швейной машинки. Она намерена расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Zulfiya S. lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 33 years old, married and has 5 children.  Her children go to a secondary school.  Her husband works at a dekhan farm.  Zulfiya has been involved in sewing for two years.  She has a sewing salon, where she and her students make national dresses.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a new sewing machine.  She intends to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase of a new sewing machine

loans.name: Gloria Etel

texts.es:
Doña Gloria, tiene 40 años D. edad, resiD. en Santa Elena departamento D. Usulután, su familia está conformada por su esposo y tres hijos D. 22, 18 y 12 años D. edad, su negocio es un comedor y pupuseria tambien posee una tienda donD. ofrecer variedades(peluches,bolsos, decoraciones), este negocio surge por la necesidad D. tener una fuente más para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, el horario D. venta es D. 7:00am a 7:00pm, actualmente necesita D. dinero para invertir en el negocio.
Por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería necesaria para el comedor y pupuseria, sería más en alimentos para preparar y los ingredientes necesarios para las pupusas. Esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar la atención a los clientes y prepara abundantes ventas.
Ella aspira mantenerse a largo plazo con el negocio, que sus clientes estén satisfechos por sus servicios y que a su familia no le falte lo necesario la alimentación y la salud.
texts.en:
Doña Gloria is 40 years old and lives in Santa Elena in the department of Usulután.  Her family is comprised of her husband and three children, ages 22, 18 and 12.  She runs a diner and "pupuseria" (tortilla stand) as well as a store where sells stuffed animals, purses and decorative items.  She started this business to help her husband with household expenses.  She opens from 7:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m..  She is in need of funding for her business and therefore has requested a loan to buy ingredients for the diner and "pupuseria".

This investment will help her improve attention to customers and increase sales.  She hopes to be able to keep her business running for a long time, keep her customers satisfied and be able to proviD. everything her family may need in the way of proper nutrition and health.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her diner

loans.name: Khvay

texts.en:
Khvay B., 59, is a low-income person living in Kompong Tom Province. She is a good and determined single mother, divorced from her husband, who is trying to feed two children. She has one married child who lives separately, while the others are staying in the family home and working in a variety of jobs.

Khvay B. sells fresh fish in the market to earn a living. Every day in the late morning, she goes to a place where fishermen sell fish in bulk. Then she hurries to bring the fish to the market, where she sells them retail.

Recently, the family's living conditions have not been comfortable because their lavatory is broken. Thus, Khvay B. will use her loan to build a restroom for her family's use and to ensure proper sanitation.

loans.use: to build a restroom for her family

loans.name: Alicia Delmira

texts.es:
La señora Alicia Delmira C. tiene 36 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, su esposo el señor Jesus Flores se dedica a la soldadura.
Doña Alicia y su familia viven desde hace 10 años en la aldea Agua Caliente dedicandose desde hace 3 años a la comercializacion de alimentos como ser desayunos, almuerzos, cenas y golosinas, ademas vende abarroteria en su pulperia.

Doña Alicia es una persona emprendedora, tiene un proyecto con su esposo en un futuro de hacer una cancha para jugar futbol para rentarla a los jovenes de esa zona.

el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria.

Alicia empezara a vender licuados de frutas tambien,  ya que estos se venden muy bien en la zona.

Su mayor deseo es construir esa cancha ya que ella y su esposo esperan tener ganancias y sobre todo aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Alicia Delmira C. is 36-years-old. She's married and has two children who depend on her. Her husband, Mr. Jesus Flores, is a metal worker. Alicia and her family have lived for 10 years in the village of Agua Caliente, and for 3 years have worked in food service, selling breakfast, lunch, dinners, and sweets. She also sells groceries at her general store. 

Alicia is an enterprising person. She has a project with her husband for the future; they want to make a soccer field to rent out to young people in the area. 

She will use the credit to buy groceries for her store.

Alicia will also begin to sell fruit smoothies because they sell well in the area.

Her greatest wish is to build the soccer field because she and her husband hope to gain income and above all increase their sales.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, milk, water, meat, pork, chicken, dairy products, coffee, rice, sugar, butter, oil, margarine, and flour

loans.name: Lilibeth Mariceth

texts.es:
La señora Lilibet es socia del banco comunal Las Rosas del Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 22 años de edad y es soltera.
Lleva 4 años trabajando con  los préstamos de Manuela Ramos.  Ella se dedica a la venta de comida, tiene un restaurant que ella personalmente lo atiende y está al pendiente que los clientes estén muy bien atendidos.
Con su nuevo prestamos de S/. 1,300.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 olla grande, 2 bandejas, 2 baldes, 1 tacho, 1 ciento de platos descartables.
Ser soltera le da la ventaja de poder trabajar y poder surgir rápido por lo que trabaja solo para ella, podrá forjarse un futuro mejor y más adelante formar una familia con alguien que le ayude a seguir trabajando.
Gracias a manuela Ramos ha tenido un capital de trabajo y las orientaciones necesarias para saber invertir de una forma correcta su dinero, siempre priorizando las necesidades de su negocio.
texts.en:
Lilibet, 22, is a member of the Las Rosas communal bank in Yarinacocha District, Ucayali Department; she’s single.

She’s been working with Manuela Ramos loans for four years.  She sells food.  She has a restaurant that she tends to herself watchful that her customers are well cared for.

She will use the new, 1300 new sol, loan to buy the following: one large pot, two trays, two buckets, one trash can and 100 disposable plates.

Being single gives her the advantage of being able to work and get ahead quickly for she works just for herself.  She will be able to build a better future and later on form a family with someone who will help her continue working.

Thanks to Manuela Ramos she’s had working capital and necessary training to know how to invest her money correctly always prioritizing her business’ needs.

loans.use: to buy pots and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Noem

texts.en:
The two people in this picture are Noem S., 25, and her husband, who is 35. They currently live in Siem Reap Province. Noem earns a living by raising pigs behind her house. She raises them to breed and also for slaughter. The couple has four children, all of whom are single. 

In order to earn extra income, Noem is requesting a loan to buy pig feed and to purchase piglets to raise.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and piglets

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda D., 45, is from the village of Poblacion Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with three adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 4,430 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Rosalinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional canned goods and soft drinks for resale. This will be her fifth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.ar: سحر امراة متزوجة عمرها 47 سنة ام لاربعة اولاد تعمل في محل لبيع الالبسة والانجري لها في عملها 14 سنة تعمل بكد ونشاط فهي امرأة مندفعة محبة للعمل تريد ان تؤمن مستقبل جيد لها ولأولادها تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة موسيمية للمحل وتكملة الديكور الخاص بالمحل فهي تسعى الى الاعتماد على نفسها بشكا مميز من خلال اعتمادها على عملها في تحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي لها ولعائلتها لها تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة حيث ساهم القرض السابق في تحسين الوضع المادي لها من حيث تمكنت من الانتقال من مرحلة العمل متجولة الى مرحلة العمل في محل خاص بها وهي الان بحاجةالى ان تزيد من مدخولها من خلال تحسين وضع المحل والبضائع التي تمتلكها
texts.en: Sahar is a 47 year old married woman with four children. She works in a shop selling clothing and lingerie and has been doing this for 14 years. She is hard working and loves her business. She wants to secure a good future for herself and her children. With this loan she wants to buy new seasonal stock for her store and complete the shop décor. She aspires to be independent and through her business she wants to improve her and her family's financial and social situation. She has a good credit history with al-Majmoua and a previous loan helped improve her financial situation enabling her to move to her own store. Now, she faces the need to increase her income by improving the store and her stock.

loans.use: to purchase new stock and complete the decorating of her store.

loans.name: Camila

texts.en: Camila is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Camila has a retail shop that sells clothing like t-shirts & blouses. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more products from NATASHA & AVON.  Camila is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Camila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more products from NATASHA & AVON

loans.name: Oreste Javier

texts.es: El señor Oreste, es un pequeño agricultor de la zona de Ticuantepe , al igual que se esposa e hijos ,  su esposa le apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que labora por si sola , los planes hacia un futuro es poder brindarle una mejor condición de vida , don Oreste desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de piña , la mayor afectación que se le presento que fue estafado con el producto lo cual lo llevo al incumplimiento de su crédito . Ahora se siente muy contento por la confianza y el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva para    seguir con su cultivo.
texts.en: Señor Oreste is a small farmer.  He lives with his wife and children in the Ticuantepe area.  His wife, who works alone, helps him with the household expenses.  His plans for the future are to be able to improve his living conditions.  Don Oreste has been growing pineapple for several years.  He suffered a  major set back when he was cheated with the product which caused him to default on his loan.  Now he is very happy because Afodenic and Kiva have placed their trust in him and given him the support he needs to continue farming.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge de 51 años, reside en la comunidad nativa de Shankivironi (selva central peruana). Ahí formó su familia junto a Jovita, su esposa desde hace 15 años. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero solo viven con 5 de ellos en su casa propia. El trabajo de este sacrificado hombre se centra en la “agricultura”, su principal sustento económico. Hace 15 años se dedica a la siembra de cítricos en toda su variedad, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero y trabajo. Lo que más le gusta de su labor diaria, es poder dedicar la mayor parte de su tiempo en cuidar y producir sus propios sembríos. Ya que según cuenta en sus tiempos libres, trabaja como peón cosechando café en diferentes terrenos agrícolas obteniendo una ganancias extra. Más lucha día a día contra su principal inconveniente que es la falta de capital de trabajo, pues tiene 5 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas de los cuales solo produce una hectárea, pero con el apoyo de su hijo, a quien le compró una motocarro para realizar trasporte público en la zona. Espera lograr sus objetivos trazados y así comenzar a sembrar café, para diversificar su producción. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Clavelitos de Shankivironi” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su apoyo para seguir logrando sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Jorge de obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varias plantitas de café para comenzar con su próxima siembra dentro de estos días.
texts.en:
Jorge is 51 years old and lives in the indigenous community of Shankivironi (in the central Peruvian rainforest).  There he started a family together with Jovita, his wife of 15 years.  The couple have eight children but only live with five of them.  They live in their own home.

This selfless man's work is 'farming'.  It is his main source of financial support.  He has been growing different varieties of citrus fruits for 15 years.  He looks after his fruit with a lot of care and hard work.  What he most enjoys about his daily work is being able to spend most of his time caring for and growing his own fruit.  He tells us that in his spare time he works as a laborer, harvesting coffee on other people's land, which makes him extra money.  He fights hard every day against his main problem which is a lack of working capital.  He owns five hectares of farmland but only produces crops on one hectare.  However, he has the support of his son for whom he bought a car so that he could provide a public transport service in their area.

Jorge hopes to achieve the goals that he has mapped out and start growing coffee, in order to diversify his production.  He is a member of the "Los Clavelitos de Shankivironi" community bank and this is his fourth loan from MFP.  He hopes to receive your support so that he can continue achieving his goals.  For his part, he pledges once again to make his repayments on time as he has done with his previous loans.  He enjoys being a member of his community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  With your support, Jorge will invest the money he has requested in buying some coffee seedlings in order to start his sowing which he will do very shortly.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants

loans.name: Samuel Nixon

texts.es: Samuel Nixon tiene 41 años, su actividad es ofrecer los servicios de fotografías. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado crecer y mejorar cada día, la mayoría de sus clientes  le solicitan una gran variedad de pedidos pero con ciertas dificultades ha logrado cumplirlas pues no tiene el capital suficiente. Este es el propósito del crédito para la compra de cámaras digitales, luces, revelador de papel, acido acético entre otros productos.
texts.en: Samuel Nixon is 41 years old.  His business is providing photography services and he has been in this business for more than 20 years.  With a lot of effort and commitment, he has managed to grow and improve every day.  His customers request a wide range of services but he has experienced some problems in meeting their needs as he does not have enough capital.  This is why he is requesting a loan to buy digital cameras, lights, developing solution, acetic acid and other products.

loans.use: to buy digital cameras, lights, developing solution, acetic acid and other products

loans.name: Console

texts.en:
Console is a 33-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur. She is a widow with six-year-old twins. For the past four years she has run a hair salon, and this business has helped her meet the needs of her family.  

She requires this loan so she may purchase and install hairdryers in her salon. She plans to begin to save her future profits so that she may provide for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy hairdryers

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia do mesmo nome ao sul de Mocambique, solteira e mãe de 3 filhos de idades entre 2 a 12 anos de idade os mais velhos vao a Escola. Esta no 3º ano do instituto comercial. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a mãe que vive com ela.
Nunca saiu de Maputo, é negociante ha mais de 10 anos vende produtos diversos e tem um rendimento de 13.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Ja fez emprestimo no BIM no valor de 45.000.00mt destinado a construção da sua casa,o qual conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente e este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 26.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (amendoim, refrescos, arroz,cervejas, e outros ). 
Sonha em concluir os estudos, e construir um estabelecimento comercial maior para obter mais lucros, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Maria was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique. She is unmarried and has 3 children between the ages of 2 and 12. The older children attend school. She is in her third year studying business. She lives in her own home with her family, and also supports her mother, who lives with them.
Maria has never left Maputo. She has had her own business for more than 10 years. She sells a variety of products and earns 13,500 meticals a month, which he uses to cover household expenses. She is also able to set aside a portion of his earnings in a savings account each month.
She has received one loan from a bank in the amount of 45,000 meticals, which she used to build her house and paid off without any problems. She heard about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client. This is her first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 26,000 meticals, which she will use to buy goods (peanuts, soft drinks, rice, beer, and so on).
She dreams of completing her studies and building a larger shop so she can earn greater profits. To that end, she plans to request additional loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase goods (peanuts, soft drinks, rice, beer, etc.) for her shop.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is asking for a loan amount of 8,000 Philippines pesos to buy cooking oil, salt and sugar for sale in the store she manages for a living. Martina wishes to live longer to provide a complete education to her youngest child through income from her general store business. Her capital was lacking because her neighbors sometimes were not able to pay their credits, and she had her youngest, whom she is providing allowances to continue his schooling. 

She is 55 years old and married to a simple farmer; they are blessed with five children. Her youngest is the only one who has not finished his studying. 

She loves doing her work in selling, for it is of great help in sending all her children to school. Without it, she would not know her children's future would be secured. She is proud that all her elder children finished college, and now her youngest is about to achieve also what his elder siblings achieved.  

She is just an elementary graduate who dreams to have professional children, and now she made it through the help of her business and loan assistance from ASKI.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, salt and sugar for sale in the store.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Loan was born in 1977. She lives in Xom Vang village with her husband and two small children. Her husband is a driver and Mrs Loan has a shop in the market where she sells shoes. Loan has worked in this business for four years. She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. Since 2007, she has been a member of Kiva partner, SEDA. For her last loan, she borrowed 8,502,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to expand her shoe shop.

loans.use: to expand her shoe shop.

loans.name: Reoun

texts.en:
Reoun, 51, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Reoun produces traditional baskets, earning an income of 3 USD per day. Her husband produces wooden windows to sell. Each month, the family has to spend 75 USD on food and 13 USD on the other necessary expenses. 

Reoun is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work

loans.name: Ayub

texts.en:
Ayub is a 30-year-old man, married to Yane, a 26-year-old lady. They have two children named Alya, aged 3 years, and Charly, aged 6 months. Ayub and family live in a simple house with a palm leaf roof, palm tree branches for walls and a cement floor. 

To cover their living expenses, Ayub works as a shrimp fisherman. He has been running this business for 10 years. Ayub usually catches the shrimp in the early morning at 4 am using a trawl net and returns home at 11 am. In a day, Ayub can catch about 2 to 4 kilograms of shrimp and he sells them to his customers. The customers usually pay him at the end of month after they weight all his catch.

However, Ayub cannot catch shrimp now since his trawl net is torn. He does not have money to buy a new trawl net or even to fix the old one. Therefore, he is seeking a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 10,000,000. He plans to spend the loan on some trawl nets to stock and another boat to support his work. Ayub really expects that TLM is willing to assist him with the loan.

loans.use: To purchase some trawl nets and another boat.

loans.name: Eloina

texts.es:
La señora eloina cuenta con 32 años D. edad, está casada su esposo se llama Daniel, quien es taxista, tienen 3 hijos Daniel, Óscar y Griselda, quienes estudian primero, segundo y cuarto año D. primaria, ella tiene una tienda D. abarrotes, desD. hace mas D. 10 años.
Doña eloina dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, ya que quería buscar la manera D. apoyar a su esposo con los gastos D. la casa y con la educación D. sus hijos, también para tener una mejor solvencia económica, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra D. mas mercancía, para tener más surtida su tienda como son: aceite, sal, leche, refrescos, azúcar, jabón, papel higiénico, etc.
Ella también tiene una meta para su negocio, desea hacerlo crecer muchísimo, ya que quiere ampliar su local para tenerlo mejor surtido, con una amplia variedad D. productos, y así contar con mejores ingresos.
Esta muy agradecida con los donadores D. kiva y FRAC, por todo el apoyo y confianza que le están brindando, ya que gracias a esta ayuda ahora pueD. continuar invirtiendo en su negocio y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Eloina is 32 years old and married to her husband Daniel, who is a taxi driver. They have three children: Daniel, Óscar, and Griselda. They are in the first, second, and fourth grades respectively. Eloina has been managing a grocery store for more than 10 years.

She says that she started this business because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses and their children’s education. In addition, Doña Eloina wants to have better financial solvency. The loan she will receive will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise so that her store will be well-stocked. She plans to buy oil, salt, milk, soft drinks, sugar, soap, toilet paper, and other items.

Eloina is very grateful to the Kiva lenders and to FRAC for all of the support and trust that have been given to her. She is thankful that the help she now has will allow her to continue investing in her business and supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy oil, salt, milk, soft drinks, sugar, soap, toilet paper, and other items.

loans.name: Hilda's Group

texts.en:
Hilda's group is comprised of ten hard-working women. Hilda is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Hilda has been working hard to manage her small kitchen, which sells fast food. 

To help expand her business, Hilda has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more ingredients and will help Hilda generate greater profits and improve her family's quality of life. Hilda hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Hilda is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Hilda's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save and budget for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Flor Blanca Group

texts.es: Freddy Antonio, Horlando y Claudia conforman el grupo solidario Flor Blanca. El Señor Freddy  tiene 3 años de tener el negocio de compra y venta de cerdos.   La mayoría de sus clientes saben muy bien que el siempre ofrece buenos calidad de carne. Cuenta con una clientela establecida y no tiene otra competencia cerca de su negocio. Esta solicitado un crédito para la compra de cerdos, y así satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes en su consumo. Juntos quieren salir adelante y mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en: The group "Flor Blanca" is made up of Freddy Antonio, Horlando and Claudia.  Freddy has had a business buying and selling pigs for 3 years.  Most of his customers are well aware that he always offers good quality meat.  He has an established customer base, and there is no competition that is located close to his business.  He is requesting a loan to buy pigs, so that he can satisfy the needs of his customers.  The members of this communal bank want to get ahead together and improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a 54-year-old married woman with six children. 

Violeta has a fermented shrimps and fish business in the Philippines. Violeta requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her fermented shrimps business.

Violeta has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Violeta would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her fermented shrimps.

loans.name: Saphaniah

texts.en:
Saphaniah is a married man with two school-going children. He rents a house with electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

Saphaniah has operated a retail shop for the past three years. His potential clients are the local area residents. Seasonality is the major challenge he faces. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), he wants to purchase more stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and soap for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and soap for resale

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Cecile has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Cecile has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Cecile hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Seng Oun

texts.en:
Seng Oun, 44, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She is a Khmer traditional medicine vendor. Her husband is a musician. One of her children is employed as a garment worker. 

Due to less income, Seng Oun is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run as a motor taxi when he is free from his musical work. By doing so, her husband can generate more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to buy a set of musical instruments for her husband for rental, build a new concrete house and support her children to study until they get a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run as a motor taxi

loans.name: Manuel Salvador

texts.es: El señor Manuel Salvador a sus 31 años de edad se dedica a trabajar la agricultura desde hace 20 años, aprendiendo esta labor de su padre. Actualmente, el señor  Manuel Salvador tiene cultivos de fríjol y arveja en un terreno alquilado en una  finca de un conocido. Por el invierno sus cultivos se han desmejorado y tienen enfermedades, por lo cual el señor Manuel Salvador necesita de la compra de abonos y riegos agrícolas que le permitan mejorar sus cultivos y producir verduras de calidad, las cuales pueda vender y así mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida de su hijo de 7 años y su esposa.
texts.en: Manuel Salvador, thirty-one, has been in agriculture for twenty years, having learned the trade from his father. He currently grows peas and beans on a plot of land he rents on an acquaintance's farm. Over the winter his crops have had disease and done poorly, so Manuel Salvador needs to buy fertilizer and an irrigation system to help them do better and produce a high enough quality of vegetable for him to sell. That way he can increase his income and improve the quality of life for his wife and seven-year-old son.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and an irrigation system for his peas and beans.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a married woman and she has three children. She is 32 years old and resides at Trigos, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental: Philippines.  

Marilou owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting corn for sale to earn a living. She has been in this business for eight years.  Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 from this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. 

Marilou has been a member of GDMPC for almost six years. In the future, Marilou wants to make improvements to her house and wants her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Dulce Maria

texts.es: Dulce nació en 1970 en Ixtapaluca, un municipio ubicado en el Estado de México con una población de casi 500 000 habitantes. Es una mujer muy entusiasta y trabajadora. Los últimos tres años se ha ganado la vida con un pequeño restaurante cerca de su casa. Todos los días ofrece un menú diferente de comida completa, quesadillas, tacos y postres. Dulce es quien prepara todos los alimentos y está a cargo de todo el negocio. Dulce está solicitando un préstamo por MXN 7,000 para comprar ingredientes para preparar todos los platillos con los que todos sus clientes quedan muy satisfechos, así como comprar un nuevo horno para ofrecer un mejor y más rápido servicio. Su mayor sueño es tener un restaurante más grande y ser reconocida en todo su estado. Dulce estará muy agradecida si la apoyas con en este negocio para continuar creciendo. Con este préstamo Dulce incrementará sus ventas e ingresos en un 60%, lo que le permitirá cumplir con sus obligaciones en su primer préstamo con Konfío.
texts.en: Dulce was born in 1970 in Ixtapaluca, a municipality located in the State of Mexico with a population of almost 500,000 inhabitants. She is a very enthusiastic and hardworking woman. The last three years she has made a living with a small restaurant near her home. Every day, she offers a different menu of a full meal, quesadillas, tacos and desserts. Dulce is the one who prepares all food and is in charge of the entire business. Dulce is requesting a loan of MXN 7,000 to buy ingredients to prepare all dishes with which all customers are very satisfied, as well as buying a new furnace to provide better and faster service. Her greatest dream is to have a larger restaurant and be recognized throughout the state. Dulce will be very grateful if you support her in this business to continue growing. With this loan, Dulce will increase her sales and revenue by 60%, allowing her to meet her obligations on her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice and beans and an oven

loans.name: Silvia Maribel

texts.en:
My name is Silvai Maribel. I have had a grocery store for several years which generates enough to cover family expenses and the education of my son. I need to supply my business since the Christmas season is coming and people want different products.

Loan Use: Purchase sugar, beans, butter, rice, soap, eggs, meats and other products

Mi Nombre el Silvai Maribel, cuento con una Pulperia de venta de productos de consumo humano,tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de activida, generandome ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y de educacion de mis hijo, necesito surtir mas mi negocio ya que se aproxima la navidad por lo que hay demando de los diferentes productos.

loans.use: compra azucar, frijoles, manteca,arroz, jabon,uhevos, productos lactos,carnes, embutidos y otros

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles O. is 49 years old, and is living with HIV within the Kibera slums of Nairobi. He is married and has two wives, one living with him in Kibera, and the other living with his aging mother back in his home village in Busia District, in the Western Province of Kenya. In total Charles has 11 children, two of which with his first wife, now deceased. Three of his children - all daughters - are married, but the other 8 children, together with his wives and his mother all depend on him.

Charles started his hotel in 1999, after he got some savings money from his grocery shop, still in Kibera. He did this in order to diversify his business, and he has continued to run both businesses since. He works together with his wife in this business, and has also employed two employees to assist with the workload. Some of the favorite foods that he serves in his hotel include mandazi (similar to doughnuts), chapatti (a kind of unleavened bread made from wheat flour), beef stew, fish, ugali (A paste made from a mixture of maize meal and water), beans and githeri (made from a mixture of maize and beans boiled together then fried). Charles is a member of the Agape group of Action Now Kenya, within the Kibera slums, and has so far received loans of $57 and $85, which he used to buy stock for his hotel. Charles also received $115 from his group, which he used to buy 2 bags of cement and sand to plaster the walls of the hotel for better presentation. Charles has also been trained by ANK on living with HIV/AIDS, and has learnt about small business management and operation, together with loan management. 

Given the loan of $225, which is repayable within a period of 8 – 14 months, Charles intends to completely refurbish his hotel by fabricating a new set of chairs and tables which will be designed to save space through the sitting arrangement. This will be the first phase where two tables, with six seats each, will be fabricated. Once the loan is repaid, he intends to borrow an additional loan to make another two tables, to ensure that he has a sitting capacity of 24 people at any one time. Currently his hotel can only sit about 10 customers, yet he feels that there is space to accommodate more people. Through this support, Charles will be assured of additional income, due to the extra business created through the sitting arrangement in the hotel. Charles also hopes that in future as the business continues to expand, his hotel will create additional job opportunities for more people within the Kibera slums. He also intends in future on expanding by buying a television set and video machine, through which to attract more customers, and to also provide some educational information for his customers.

loans.use: Purchase of furniture to refurbish the hotel

loans.name: Josephine N.

texts.en:
Josephine is married with six children; three are in primary school and three have finished schooling. She has not undertaken any advanced schooling, though she finished her secondary school successfully.

Josephine started her business in 1976 operating with a cereal board. She has a great deal of experience since she has been in the business for a long time. Through the business she has been able to support her children by paying their school fees, meeting their basic needs and providing food security to the community.

With a loan from PEMCI, she intents to increase her stock to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To boost her business

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en: Gulnaz lives in Sumgayit town together with her husband and four children. She rents a booth where she sells mainly women's clothing. She has been engaged in this business since 1997. As she pays for the rented booth and has little of her own funds, her business needs investment. The variety of inventory to be sold in the booth is not high. She has applied to Normicro Sumgayit branch to get a loan in the amount of $500 to buy more inventory, develop the business, and in the future have her own booth or shop.

loans.use: To increase the variety of inventory

loans.name: Yao

texts.en:
Yao N’guessan Y. is 45 years old. She is married and the mother of 4 children and her younger boy plays in a local soccer team. She lives with her family in Marcory, a suburb in the south of Abidjan District. Y.'s husband is retired from a civil servant position and no longer significantly contributes to the household expenses.

Thus Y. who sells smoked fish since 1998 in the Marcory open market is actually her family's main resource provider. She cares about the educational expenses of her children. Y. wants to expand her activities to strengthen and sustain her revenues. She also has to face the school re-entry expenses of her kids.

loans.use: Yao N’guessan Yvette will use the loan to pay education expenses of her children.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam K. is 26 years old and single. She lives with her family in Koumassi, a populated suburb in the south of Abidjan. She has 3 younger sisters and brothers, and she contributes to their education expenses.

Mariam has been a hair dresser in Koumassi Market since she left school 8 years ago. She also sells hair creams and artificial strands of hair. Mariam is dynamic and courageous. She has benefited from several loans from AE&I that she has reimbursed in good manner. She is actively preparing for the end of the year period (Christmas, New Year, etc.).

loans.use: Mariam Kone will use the loan to purchase strands of hair and hair cream.

loans.name: Maria Angeles

texts.es:
Maria Angeles is the head of her family. She is a hard working woman who has fought hard to improve the lives of her three children. She began her business as a traveling saleswoman when she was about 15 years old so that she could feed her children. Before she ran this business she was a domestic employee, but her salary could not cover her basic needs. She rents the shop where she maintains her business. For two years she has worked with Ceprodel and has received 13 loans. Thanks to Ceprodel she has been able to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

MARÍA ÁNGELES ES JEFA DE FAMILIA ESFORZADA QUIEN HA LUCHADO DURO POR SACAR A SUS TRES HIJOS ADELANTE. INICIO SU NEGOCIO HACE ALREDEDOR DE 15 AÑOS COMO VENDEDORA AMBULANTE PARA DARLE DE COMER A SUS HIJOS. ANTES DE TENER SU NEGOCIO ERA UNA EMPLEADA DOMESTICA PERO EL SALARIO NO CUBRÍA SUS NECESIDADES BÁSICAS

EL LOCAL DONDE TIENE SU NEGOCIO ES ALQUILADO. DESDE HACE 2 AÑOS TRABAJA CON CEPRODEL CON UN RÉCORD DE 13 CRÉDITOS. GRACIAS A CEPRODEL HA LOGRADO INCREMENTAR LAS VENTAS.

loans.use: The purchase of products

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia C. de Barrios is widowed, has two grown children and lives with them in her own house.

For the last 28 years she is owner of a food store that is well situated in the city where she lives. She depends on the fact that she owns the space, has a good client base and also maintains a good inventory of products.

She is well known in the area for being very hard-working. She has excellent business and personal references.

Her goal is to increase her inventory of products in order to increase her sales and revenues and therefore improve her quality if life. The loan proceeds will be used for the purchase of various products for the food store.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Lucia Centurión de Barrios, es una señora viuda, tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad, vive junto con ellos en su casa propia.

Hace 28 años es propietaria de una despensa muy bien ubicada en la ciudad donde vive. Cuenta con un local propio y una buena clientela formada, también mantiene un buen stock de mercaderías.

Es una señora muy conocida en esa localidad por ser trabajadora. Tiene excelentes referencias comerciales y personales.

Su objetivo es aumentar su stock de mercaderías, para mejorar sus ventas e ingresos y tener una mejor calidad de vida. El crédito será destinado a la compra de mercaderías varias para su Despensa

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, flour, milk producs, baked goods, canned goods, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
For five years, Mister Rodolfo Benitez has sold clothing in the Santa Ana market, in the beautiful town of Chinandega. Benitez has one daughter and must find a way to give her an education, food, good health and a dignified home.

He began his business, selling clothing, with a small investment of merchandise. The strong competition of his business has lead to him acquire larger quantities of clothing, which has allowed him to see a slow rise in his profits.

Benitez has plans to invest more in his business with more merchandise and then commercialize it. He has successfully paid back previous loans with CEPRODEL, and despite fierce competition, his business is thriving, which is why he would like to continue benefiting from the micro-loan system which has helped spur on his success. He has had 6 previous loans in the past year with CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Desde hace cinco años el señor Rodolfo Benitez se dedica a la venta de ropa en el mercado Santa Ana de la bella ciudad de Chinandega. Benitez es padre de una hija que tiene la obligación de brindarle su educación, alimentación, salud y un techo digno.

Comenzó su negocio de venta de ropa con una pequeña inversión en mercadería sin embargo por la gran competencia de este negocio ha ido adquiriendo mayores cantidades de ropa lo que le ha provocado una mejora en sus ingresos pero lentamente.

Los planes del señor Benitez son invertir mas en su negocio para adquirir mercadería para comercializarla. No debemos obviar que con CEPRODEL ha realizado préstamos desde hace un año y a pesar de la fuerte competencia en su negocio ha comenzado a ver mejores resultados por lo que se ha propuesto continuar con estos créditos que le han traído mucho beneficio a su negocio. Su record es de 6 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Akbar

texts.en:
K. Akbar is 39 years old. He is married with seven children.

Akbar is a farmer. He grows such crops as onions and watermelons. At sale time, he raises cattle. For this season Akbar has planted wheat and onions and is planning to have a bumper crop and generate good income.

Today Akbar requests 2000.00 Somoni (US$600.00) for the term of nine months. He is planning to purchase seeds and fertilizer required for his business. Akbar is applying for a loan for the first time and he would like to thank all for supporting him and to promise to pay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Like any other family in her neighborhood, Mrs Nguyễn Thị Diện and her family were facing difficulty. With determination, hard work and self confidence they have raised above poverty. Mrs Diện is 35 years old. She joined TYM 5 years ago. She had a business plan and she was quite certain to success.After much discussion with her husband, they had decided to invest in fish farming which would yield high profit. Beside that they also cultivated vegetables (1/2 acre), planted 100 grapefruit plats and built a pig pen to raise pigs. After numerous rounds of loans, they have riped fruit from their hard work. They have overcome poverty. Now they are living comfortably. They manage their farm following the VAC process. Their annual income is 2000-2500 USD. Her wish is to remain TYM member, continuing to expand her business. This time she is requesting a loan of 1200 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cũng gặp khó khăn như nhiều gia đình khác trong cụm nhưng gia đình chị Nguyễn Thị Diện, 35 tuổi, thực sự đi lên nhờ sự tự tin, mạnh dạn, dám nghĩ dám làm. 5 năm trước, tuy mới tham gia Quỹ nhưng chị đã biết suy nghĩ tận dụng điều kiện đang có để đầu tư dự án đạt hiệu quả kinh tế cao. Năm 2003 chị Diện bàn với chồng nhận thầu khúc sông thả cá với số vốn khá lớn. Bên cạnh đó chị còn dồn điền đổi thửa đấu thầu thêm hơn 5 sào đất trồng rau hành và hơn trăm gốc bưởi Diễn. Ngoài ra chị còn xây dựng truồng trại chăn nuôi lợn. Sau nhiều vòng vốn vay đến nay cơ ngơi của gia đình chị Diễn đã khá khang trang, đời sống kinh tế gia đình từ chỗ khó khăn trở thành gia đình khá. Mô hình VAC mỗi năm mang lại cho chị Diễn từ 2000-2500USD lợi nhuận. Mong muốn của của chị và gia đình là sẽ tiếp tục tham gia Quỹ để vay vốn lớn phát triển kinh tế. Mức vốn đề nghị vòng này của chị Diện là 1200USD

loans.use: Buy pigs, fishes and food for them

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is married and has 3 children, ages 18, 12 and 5. She and her husband also take care of one other person, age 60. Janeth owns a small restaurant, which she started in 1995. Every day, she works from 11 am to 12 pm at the restaurant and can earn a monthly profit of about US$80 from the sales.

She now hopes to receive a loan to buy various items for her restaurant business.

loans.use: Purchase of various items for a restaurant business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Agnes M.. She is married and has 1 child, age 6. In 2002 Agnes established her music store and salon business. Working 7 days a week and 9 to 12 hours a day, she earns about US$30 every month from this business. She is assisted by her husband and 1 employee. Agnes has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from SELFINA, and she now requires a new loan in order to expand her range of CDs, cassettes, and haircare products. In the future, Agnes plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand her range of CDs, tapes, and haircare products

loans.name: Girasol Group

texts.en:
The group of women from the girasol (sunflower) group live in the remote town of Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan. They love their town because it is where they were born and raised. Most people in this town rely on farming for their livelihoods. The women wish to advance the education of their children, maintain a healthy family and support the work of their husbands.

Farming involves a collective family effort to buy the necessary materials, plant, care for, harvest, process and sell the crops. Among the borrowers, they grow broccoli, cauliflower, potato, carrot, onion and cabbage. Once the time consuming process of farming has been completed, they take their vegetables to the markets of Nahuala and surrounding villages to sell. During the rainy season, sales and profits are low which makes their profession a constant struggle. However, at the end of the day, it is their means of livelihood.

The loans proviD. families with credit to start a business and maintain a healthy business cycle where they can buy the necessary products, plant and harvest enough in order to keep their business profitable. With this loan, they will purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides.

Francisca S. initially requested a loan of 50 USD and now is servicing a 400 USD loan. She hopes to defy the odds and save enough money to be able to buy a large piece of neighboring land.

loans.use: to purchase equipment, seed, fertilizer and pesticides in bulk

loans.name: Hava

texts.en:
Hava is a 48-year-old woman living near the town of Gračanica. She is married, but her husband is currently out of work. They have one son, who is grown and working abroad in Slovenia. Hava farms her land and raises cattle, and right now she has a cow and a heifer.

This is her 3rd loan with ŽZene za ŽZene, and Hava wishes to use this one to help build her barn. Right now it's constructed partly out of brick and partly with wood. Unfortunately, the wood part is old and falling apart. She wants to renovate the barn and build it completely without of brick in order to provide a safe home for her cows over the winter.

loans.use: To build a barn for her cows

loans.name: Niño Nativo Group

texts.es:
The community of Acoria is a neighborhood in the district of Acoria, which belongs to the department of Huancavelica (the poorest in Perú). It is located at 2,880 meters above sea level. Its main activities are agriculture, raising livestock, and traD.. One arrives to the district by taking the Huancayo-Huancavelica railway.

Mauricia H. Garci is married and has 8 children, the youngest of which is 5-years-old. Two of her children are in school. She has a business where she sells food, which she started a year ago with a loan that she received from Finca Perú. Previously, she sold vegetable stew. Mauricia needs a loan of 500 soles, which she will use to purchase soft drinks and supplies for her business. Her goal is to grow her business, and her dream is to offer higher education to her children. Currently her oldest son is studying to be a chef in Huancayo. He is working to pay for his studies.

Teofila Cárdenas H. is married with 3 children, who are 15, 18, and 23. Two of her children go to school. She has a little store where she sells candy and groceries, which she started 2 years ago. She used to raise young animals, but this didn't go well for her, so she decided to start her store. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 soles, which she will use to purchase more products for her store. FINCA helped her and now she has access to credit. Her goal is to carry her business into other districts and to see her children become professionals.

María E. is married and has one son, who is 9 and goes to school. She has a grocery store, which she started 2 years ago to help her husband with the family finances. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 soles, with which she is going to buy more merchandise. Her goal is to grow and become a wholesaler. Her dream is to have a house in Huancayo where there is more commercial movement and better schools for her son. With FINCA, she is learning to save.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La comunidad D. Acoria es un barrio del distrito D. Acoria perteneciente al departamento D. Huancavelica (el mas pobre del Perú), ubicada a una altitud D. 2,880 m.s.n.m, las principales actividades son la agricultura, ganadería y el comercio. Al distrito se llega por vía férrea Huancayo – Huancavelica.

Mauricia H. Garci, casada, tiene 8 hijos, el menor D. 5 años, dos D. sus hijos van a la escuela, tiene un negocio D. venta D. comida el cual lo inició hace un año con el primer préstamo que recibió D. FINCA PERU, anteriormente vendía menestras. Mauricia necesita un préstamo D. 500 soles, con el préstamo va comprar gaseosas y alimentos para su negocio. Su desafío es crecer en el negocio, su sueño es brindar estudios superiores a sus hijos y actualmente su hijo mayor estudia para chef en Huancayo por lo que trabaja para pagar sus estudios.

Teofila Cárdenas H., casada con 3 hijos, D. 15, 18 y 23 años, dos hijos van a la escuela, tiene una tiendita que venD. golosinas y abarrotes, el cual tiene dos años D. creación, anteriormente criaba animales menores pero no le fue bien por lo que decidió crear su tienda, solicita un préstamo D. 1,000 soles, con el préstamo va comprar mas productos para su tienda. FINCA le ayudo pues ahora ya tiene acceso al crédito. Su desafío es salir con su negocio a otros distritos y ver profesionales a sus hijos .

Maria E., conviviente con 1hijo D. 9 años que va a la escuela, tiene una tienda D. abarrotes, que cuenta con 2 años D. creación, lo creo para apoyar a su esposo en la economía familiar, solicita un préstamo D. 1,000 soles, con el que va comprar mas mercadería. Su desafío es crecer y ser mayorista, su sueño es contar con una casa en Huancayo donD. hay mas movimiento comercial y mejores escuelas para su hijo. Con FINCA esta aprendiendo a ahorrar.

loans.use: The communal bank Niño Nativo is requesting a loan of 6,900 soles for its 14 members, who are requesting loans of 200, 400, or 1,000 soles to supply their businesses.

loans.name: Bélange

texts.fr: Bélange D., 31 ans, mariée avec 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Femmes Catholiques de Vélingara depuis 4ans et demi. Elle veut acheter et revendre des tissus (tissus teintés et tissus de saint). Ses revenus lui permettent de contribuer à la prise en charge de sa famille. <b>Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Bélange D., 31, is married and raising 3 children. She has been a member of the village bank Catholic Women of Vélingara for four and a half years. She wants to buy and re-sell cloth (batik-style cloth and cloth with pictures of saints). Her income makes it possible for her to contribute to covering family expenses. The loan that she is requesting will be repaid at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of cloth

loans.name: Darling Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Darling originaria del municipio de Ciudad Sandino en Managua es una dama que con gran esfuerzo se dedica al negocio de pulpería y venta de gaseosas atendido amablemente por ella misma en su casa de habitación.

La señora Darling es madre casada y con tres hijos en su responsabilidad. Hoy en día es necesario destacar que ella ha sido una fiel trabajadora por lo que ha logrado suplir la necesidad de su hogar. El motivo por el cual solicita un crédito es para la compra de mercadería y de las bebidas gaseosas para ofrecerlas en su pulpería y de esta forma continuar con el mantenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Darling is originally from the Sandino City municipality in Managua. She is a lady who, with great effort, dedicates herself to a general store business and soft drink sales. She tends amiably to her business herself, in her own home.

Darling is a married mother responsible for three children. Today, it is necessary to emphasize that she has been a loyal worker who has as a result managed to provide the necessities for her home. The motivation for her loan request is for the purchase of merchandise and sodas to offer for sale in her store so she can continue to help support her household.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Mukisa Women's Group

texts.en: Fatumah B. is one of the executive members of Mukisa women’s group in Jinja as well as one of its founding members.  Fatumah is a tailor with a business of making ladies’ wear, childen's and men’s clothes of all kinds. She has been in the trade for a long time now and has gained experience for making quality products for her customers. She has two sewing machines at the moment, but has a dream of one day owning as many as ten so that she can begin a tailoring school to teach young girls, mostly orphans, the same trade as a way for them to sustain themselves in future.  She is grateful for the loans because now she is able to sell some of the material she buys to her customers, unlike before when she did not have the capital to do so.

loans.use: To buy clothing material and threads for her business.

loans.name: Austin

texts.en: Austin I. owns a poultry farm where he rears poultry birds like chicken and turkey. His poultry farm can accommodate 400 birds.  He needs the loan amount of 120,000 NGN to purchase more poultry birds to sell. He is 40 years old and married with four children. He says, "thank you to all that made this loan possible."

loans.use: To purchase more poultry birds to sell

loans.name: Phanuel

texts.en:
Muraho ("Hello”) from Phanuel M. in Buliza, Gasabo district, Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda! Phanuel is 28 years old and still single.

Phanuel operates a small video library and he also provides various sound material for rent, earning about  US$ 195 per month.

This entrepreneur is requesting a loan worth 500 000 Rwf. This loan will be used to buy more materials for his business and will be repaid in 8 months on a monthly basis.

loans.use: buying more materials for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase goods.

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en: Idowu L. is 45 years old and married with 2 children. Idowu sells bags of pepper. He is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more bags of pepper to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of pepper to sell

loans.name: Rubina Iqbal  Raza Yousaf Group

texts.en:
Rubina Iqbal baji is 43 years old and a married lady and citizen of a city named Lahore, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Her husband's name is R. Y. and he drives a local 32-seat bus. Rubina baji is the mother of one son whose name is Mosa R. and he reads in 4th standard. Rubina baji runs a beauty salon in her house. She has a good number of customers. Mostly customers consist of her neighbors. She is applying for a loan to buy cosmetics and a hair dryer for her beauty salon.

Rubina Iqbal baji is the group leader for another four women from her locality. Nargis baji and Walayat baji each want a loan to buy cosmetics for her salon. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy cloth and colored thread for her boutique. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy materials for a beauty salon

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es: Nelida a sus 23 años, sabe que es hora de apoyar con los gastos económicos en su hogar, vive en la casa de sus padres, quienes le ayudaron a poner su negocio. Es una joven muy alegre y preocupada por salir adelante, es por eso que decidió poner una tienda de licores, con la cual le ayudaron sus padres, su negocio siempre es muy concurrido, ya que vende sus productos a precios muy cómodos. Le gusta su trabajo, disfruta mucho de aconsejarles a sus clientes cual es el licor de mayor calidad que pueden comprar, desea tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender toda clase de licores y así incrementar sus ingresos. Lleva 2 años realizando este trabajo y lo más difícil es conseguir los licores, ya que existen muchas bebidas falsificadas y de mala calidad, las cuales tiene que saber diferenciar. Este es el primer préstamo que solicita en MFP, y desea pagarlo a tiempo, ya que quiere acceder a otros posteriormente, se está siendo muy querida en su banco comunal, ya que siempre le da alegría al resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles que requiere comprará más bebidas para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Nelida, 23 years old, knows that it is time to help with the household expenses. She lives in her parents’ home, and they helped her start her business. She is a very happy young woman and is concerned with getting ahead. For this reason she decided to open a liquor store with the help of her parents. The store is very busy because she sells her products at good prices. She likes her work and enjoys advising her customers on the best quality of liquor that they can buy. She would like to have a bigger store where she could sell all kinds of liquors, and in this way increase her income. She has been doing this work for two years and the most difficult part is getting the liquor because there are many counterfeit liquors and liquors of bad quality, so she must know how to differentiate them. This is the first loan that she has requested from Kiva partner MFP, and she wants to pay it on time as she plans to take out other loans in the future. She is well-loved at her communal bank because she always gives great joy to the rest of the members. With the 1,000 new soles loan she will buy more beverages to better stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Mukadam

texts.ru: Мукадам Ёкубова 1982 года рождения , замужем имеет одного ребенка.  Имеет высшее образование. Работает швей в военном ателье. Там шьет камуфляжную форму и  мундиры для военных. Недалеко от их цеха расположена крепость- военная часть, где находятся солдаты. Для них и шьют  эту форму Мукадам и ее  сотрудницы. Кредит получила в 2008 году, на покупку материалов  для шитья  военной формы.
texts.en:
Makadam Y. is 27 years old, married, and has a child. She holds a bachelor degree. She works as a tailor in a military tailoring establishment. There, she sews army uniforms. Army soldiers are stationed a short distance away from her factory. It is for them that Mukadam and her co-workers are tailoring the uniforms. She obtained her loan in 2008 to purchase textiles for the army uniforms.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase textiles

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma es una mujer de 48 años, se caracteriza por ser muy trabajadora y comprometida con el bienestar de sus tres hijos, ya que es madre soltera y tiene el deber de asumir su rol como madre y padre. Desde que estuvo enferma se dio cuenta de que los medicamentos que tenía que consumir eran demasiado costosos y una amiga suya le recomendó unas medicinas naturales que le aliviaron todos sus malestares, al notar la efectividad de dichos productos inició su negocio de venta de medicinas naturales que desde hace 3 años le viene generando buenas ganancias. Irma ofrece y distribuye estos productos a sus familiares y amigos que le solicitan grandes cantidades, y ahora está empezando a involucrar a otras personas en este negocio, pues comisiona por cada persona que inscribe y a quien suministra mercadería. Este negocio le ayudó mucho en su salud y para realizar proyecciones de su vida, pues ahora tiene pensado invertir en la instalación de una tienda de medicinas naturales, donde pueda suministrar mercadería y venda al por menor al público que la visite. Irma es fundadora de su grupo y forma parte de la junta directiva, como líder trata de dar el ejemplo en cuanto a puntualidad y muestra de solidaridad para unificar al equipo que desde hace  3 años formaron en MFP. El dinero solicitado está designando para la compra de productos para la distribución a las personas que tiene a su cargo.
texts.en:
Irma, 48, is a very hard working woman who is committed to the well being of her three children. She is a single mother, and she has the responsibility of assuming the roles of both mother and father. Since she was sick she realized that the medications she had to take were too expensive. A friend of hers recommended some natural medicines that alleviated her discomforts. Noting the effectiveness of these products, three years ago she started her business of selling natural medicines. The business is generating good income. Irma offers and distributes these products to her family and friends. They request big amounts. She is now starting to bring other people into the business. She gets a commission for every person that joins and who she supplies with products. This business helped her health a lot and helped her reach her life’s potential. Her plan is to invest in the installation of a natural medicine store where she can provide merchandise. She will sell at retail prices to the public who go to her store. Irma is the founder of her group, and she is part of the board of directors. As a leader, she tries to set an example by being on time and being supportive in order to unify the team. Their group formed in MFP three years ago. The loan is to buy products to distribute to the people she has under her supervision.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es:
Joaquín A. es una persona que se dedica netamente a la fotografía desde muy joven, lleva 10 años en esta profesión y comenta que desde muy pequeño le gustaba sacar fotografías.  El negocio lo tiene a media cuadra de la Basílica de la ciudad de Caacupé y la atención del negocio lo realiza el mismo con la ayuda de una asistente por tener siempre cumpleaños infantiles y eventos en las escuelas y colegios de Caacupé.

Joaquín nos comenta que últimamente está viajando mucho por las distintas ciudades del país gracias al buen servicio que ofrece y a la calidad de su trabajo ya que constantemente se está capacitando en los cursos de fotografías que se dan en Asunción. 

El préstamo otorgado por la Fundación Paraguaya lo invertira en la remodelación y decoración de su estudio fotográfico que tiene en su local.  Nos comenta también que utiliza todo tipo de estrategias para la publicidad de su servicio, busca auspiciantes y lanza revistas con las fotografías de sus eventos.

El Cliente manifiesta su agradecimiento a la Fundación Paraguaya por el préstamo otorgado así va adquiriendo sus herramientas de trabajo.
texts.en:
Joaquín A. has been dedicated to photography from a young age; he has been working in this profession for 10 years and comments that from a very young age he liked to take photographs. His business is located half a block away from The Basilica in the city of Caacupé and he runs this business himself with the help of assistant because they always have children’s birthday parties, and school events to work in Caacupé. Joaquín comments that lately he has been traveling a lot to the different cities of the country thanks to the good service that he offers and the quality of his work that he maintains by constantly taking photography courses offered in the city of Asunción. The loan granted to him by the Paraguayan Foundation will be invested in remodeling and decorating his photographic studio that he has in his locale. He also comments that he will also use the loan to carry out various strategies to publicize his service, search for a logo, and launch magazines with photographs of his events. Joaquín expressed his gratitude for the loan that will be granted to him by the Paraguayan Foundation, which has helped him slowly gain important work tools.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel and decorate his photographic studio.

loans.name: Reymunda

texts.es:
Con gran entusiasmo en el negocio, la señora Reymunda J. se dedica a su actividad de venta de ropa en el municipio de Telica en León.

Sus ventas las realiza ambulantemente en diferentes lugares donde lleva siempre sus coloridas bolsas plásticas donde traslada la ropa y cuando llega a un lugar, muestra la ropa a las personas esperando que le compren el producto. Ella necesita el dinero para la compra de la ropa ya que se le está agotando y es por esta razón que hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de la ropa y así ofrecerla para obtener sus ingresos.
texts.en:
With great enthusiasm in her business, Reymunda J. dedicates herself to the sale of clothing in the municipality of Telica in Leon. Her sales are carried out as a street vendor in different locations where she always takes her colorful plastic bags that she uses to carry her clothing; when she arrives at a location, she shows her clothing to people hoping that they will purchase her product. She needs the money to purchase clothing because she is running out, and it is for this reason that she presently has sought Ceprodel to request a loan to purchase clothing that she will offer to obtain her income.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Olunowo

texts.en:
E. is 56 years old and married with five children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs and drinks and has been with LAPO Microfinance for the past eight months.

E. is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty tiene 35 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos. Para exhibir sus productos tiene una caja de madera donde coloca las golosinas que vende y cada tarde la saca en la parte de afuera de su casa para atraer a sus clientes. Su casa se encuentra frente a un parque, por lo que la concurrencia no le falta y tiene buenas ventas. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 3 años y lo que más le gusta es que se entretiene mientras vende. Adicionalmente, vende bebidas gaseosas y refrescos, y los fines de semana algunos platos de comida, de esta manera logra reunir el dinero necesario para solventar las necesidades de su hogar. Este es su 9no crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su grupo es que sus compañeros son muy unidos y responsables. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más golosinas y bebidas, también mandará a construir un kiosco para vender con mayor comodidad, que es lo que más quiere.
texts.en:
Betty is 35 years old, she is married and she has 3 children. To exhibit her products she has a wooden box where she places the snacks that she sells. In the afternoons she brings the box out of her the house to attract her clients. Her house faces a park so she has many clients and produces good sales. She has been running her business for the past 3 years, and her favorite part is that she has fun while she carries out her sales. She also sells soft drinks and juices and on the weekends she sells prepared foods. Thsi way she manages to collect enough money to cover the household expenses. This is her 9th loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and says that she enjoys working with her group. Her colleagues are a team and they are very responsible. With the funds that she is requesting she will purchase more snacks and drinks. She will also have a kiosk made to better accomodate her business, which is what she wants most.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To resupply her merchandise and to build a kiosk.

loans.name: Las Gaviotas Felices Group

texts.es:
Maribel F.
