Lelia  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Niño Jesús de Praga”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos.  Tiene instrucción superior incompleta.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace nueve años, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio de venta de productos de confitería como dulces, maná, fideos, etc.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de  S/ 3000.00 nuevo soles, comprará siete sacos de  maíz, fideos y azúcar.  Trabaja junto con su esposo y su suegra.  Nos cuenta que sus productos los venden en la ciudad de Puno.
Su sueño es tener su casa propia en cualquier otro lugar de la ciudad.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es el compañerismo entre las socias.
texts.en:
Lelia is a member of the communal bank "Niño Jesús de Praga," which is located in the district and province of Yunguyo in Puno province.  She is 33 years old, married and has 3 children.  She completed some college level work.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for 9 years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles, and she used that money to increase her working capital for her business selling sweets, manna (a sweet similar to marzapan), noodles, etc.  

With this new loan of 3,000 Peruvian soles, she will buy seven sacks of corn, noodles and sugar.  She works with her husband and her mother-in-law.  She tells us that she sells her products in the city of Puno.

Her dream is to have her own house in another part of the city.

What she likes about her communal bank is the camaraderie among the members.

loans.use: to buy 7 sacks of corn, noodles and sugar

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is a farmer and a businessman in Eldoret, North Rift, Kenya. His business involves selling vegetables at the local market. He has also been a farmer for the last 10 years, producing milk, potatoes, cabbage and maize.

Titus has made a loan request with Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo amounting to 31,200 Kenyan shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He sees inaccessibility to reliable artificial insemination services as a challenge to farmers such as himself.

Titus says he hopes to improve his business and rear pedigree cows with the hopes of increasing his income to uplift the living standards of his family

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Jose

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Maxixe, provincia de Inhambane ao sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 4 filhos dos quais todos são maiores de idade. Fez a 7ª classe e parou por falta de condiçoes financeiras. vive na casa propria com a  sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo a procura de emprego, é negociante a bastante tempo e tem um rendimento de 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que também é cliente e este é o seu segundo emprestimo no Hluvuku no valor de26.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos PAR REVENDA( amendoim, arroz, oleo, farinha, refrescos, e outros ). O primeiro emprestimo foi de : 20.000.00mt, também para o negocio.  
Sonha em ampliar o seu negocio oferecendo maior divercidade de produtos, e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Jose was born in Maxixe, Inhambane Province, in southern Mozambique.  He is married and has 4 children, all of whom are minors.  He attended school through the 7th grade but dropped out due to a lack of financial resources.  He owns the home where he lives with his family and does not support anyone else. 

He left Inhambane for Maputo to look for work.  He has had his own business for a long time and earns around 4.000.00mt per month, which he uses for household expenses and savings in his bank account. 

He has never had a loan with other banks.  He learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client.  This is his second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 26.000.00mt, which he will use to purchase products for sale (peanuts, rice, cooking oil, flour, soft drinks, etc.) The first loan was for 20.000.00mt, also for his business.  

He dreams of expanding his business and offering greater product selection.  He intends to request additional loans from Hluvuku to do this.

loans.use: to purchase products for sale (peanuts, rice, cooking oil, flour, soft drinks, etc.)

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.en:
Aida is the leader of this group. She is 39 and is married to a farmer.  Together with her husband, she brings up a daughter and two sons. The older son studies at university and the other children are attending local school. In order to earn money to meet their daily needs, the family breeds livestock and then resells it at a higher price. In this way, they earn about 5000 soms per month. 

With the money received from this loan, Aida wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future, she wishes to purchase a piece of land in Bishkek to build a house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: 3.7.58 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Ms. Cúc works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise to sell in the future.

Cúc is 50 years old and married with three children. She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 3.7.58 Quảng Hưng solidarity group. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2010, Cúc joined Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) to improve her  business. Cúc has successfully repaid 3 loans from FPW.

Cúc has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Cúc faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Cúc hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise to sell in future

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Mrs. Yem, age 50, has been working in a farming business for a long time. She has a plot of fertile farmland in Kompong Speu province that she got from her grandparent. Normally she is able to earn some income from her crop-planting business, around $2.50 each day to use for the family’s needs.  Her husband is a policeman in his community. They are blessed with two children who are employed in various places but with the same career as domestic workers.

Mrs. Yem said that she has a plan to purchase some piglets to feed for their offspring and for slaughter, but her savings are insufficient to do that. To deal with this situation, Mrs. Yem would like to request a loan from Kiva to buy some pigs for breeding purposes. Mrs. Yem believes that she can sell her pigs when they are big enough. She can use the revenue to expand this pig-raising business.

loans.use: to buy some pigs for breeding purposes

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary's group is comprised of 3 hardworking women. Mary is 17 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, she has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar and soap for resale, and will help Mary to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to become a doctor. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Mary's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and soap for resale,

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Julio tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida.

Él se dedica desde hace dos años a la venta de mariscos, junto con su compañera de vida decidieron emprender este negocio, debido a la necesidad de obtener ingresos para subsistir.

Don julio y su compañera de vida compran pescado y camarones en un puerto del país, cada ocho días, ellos preparan sus hieleras con suficiente hielo y depositan ahí 50 libras de camarones y 50 libras de pescado. Ellos compran directamente a los pescadores, por lo que les queda un buen margen de ganancia.

Él solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar más cantidad de pescado y camarones, ya que los venden a un buen precio y muy rápido, debido a que han buscado mercado en la zona norte del país donde los pescados y camarones son muy escasos. Para ir a vender ellos toman hasta tres autobuses con su mercadería y les lleva un día entero para vender su mercadería.

Don Julio ve en el negocio de mariscos una fuente de ingresos bastante buena, pero que al mismo tiempo requiere  de mucho sacrificio, por lo que piensa ahorrar de los ingresos que obtenga y poder comprarse un carro y de esta forma tener su propio medio de transporte y vender más rápido sus mariscos.
texts.en:
Julio, 48, lives with his life companion.  He’s been selling seafood for the last two years.  He and his life companion decided to go into this business together because of the need to earn income to subsist.  Julio and his life companion buy fish and shrimp in one of the country’s ports every week.  They prepare their coolers with enough ice and place 50 pounds of shrimp and 50 pounds of fish in them.  They buy directly from the fishermen so they earn a good profit margin.

He is asking Fundación Campo for a loan to buy larger amounts of fish and shrimp because they sell it quickly and at a good price because they’ve staked out a market in the north of the country where fish and shrimp are scarce.  To go sell there they take up to three buses with their merchandise and it takes an entire day to sell their merchandise.

Julio sees the seafood selling business as quite a good source of income but at the same time it requires much sacrifice so he plans to save up some of the income he earns to be able to buy himself a car to have his own means of transportation and sell his seafood faster.

loans.use: to buy more fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Akaki

texts.en:
Akaki is from the village of Balghojiani in the Kakheti Region. He is married and lives with his wife Ketevan.  Akaki and Ketevan earn a living through a family agricultural business. In particular, they have a milk cow and a calf.  They also grow cabbages and watermelons. The harvested fruit and vegetables as well as the dairy products are sold in the local market. The total average monthly income for the family is 550 Laris (approximately 330 USD). 

Akaki requested credit to purchase more calves. He will raise them during winter and spring and sell them in the summer for a higher price. The family will gain profit from the sale, which will be used for house renovation. After the house is renovated, the family will have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Roilith

texts.es:
Roilith tiene 37 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su pareja y de sus dos hijos a quienes quiere mucho. Juntos habitan en su casa propia que logró comprar gracias al apoyo de su pareja.
La actividad que realiza, es la venta de pescado y plátano, por lo tanto cuenta con un puesto de venta en el mercado municipal de su distrito. Es así que se levanta desde muy de temprano, tanto ella como su esposo se reparten las actividades, de esa manera se generan más ganancias. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que esta siempre al lado de su pareja, pues comparten muchas ilusiones, metas y anhelos, así como el ingreso económico que le genera y así solventar los gastos de su hogar. Su plan es ampliar su negocio y adquirir otro puesto de ventas en dicho mercado. Este seria el primer crédito con la institución MFP, y por ello espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de pescado y plátanos en mayores volúmenes.
texts.en:
Roilith is 37 years old and a joyful and hardworking woman. She lives with her life-partner and their two children who they love very much. Together they live in their own home which she was able to buy thanks to the support of her partner. 

Her business is selling fish and plantains, and she has a stall in her district’s municipal market. She gets up very early, and she and her husband share the work. This way they make more money. What she likes about her business is always being by her husband’s side. They share many dreams, goals, and desires. With the income she makes, she is able to afford the household costs. Her plan is to expand their business and buy another stall in the market. This will be her first loan with MFP, and she hopes for your support. With the amount requested, she will invest in the purchase of fish and plantains in large quantity.

loans.use: to buy fish and plantains.

loans.name: Hieu

texts.en:
Hieu is 57 years old and lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She is married with two children. Her husband is retired.

To earn a living, Hieu has a business selling soft drinks from her door. She has run this activity for fifteen years. Hieu would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of soft drinks to sell. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Mariétou

texts.fr:
Mariétou est une femme mariée âgée de 60 ans et mère de 6 enfants et 4 petits fils.
Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis le 01/09/2008 et fait parti du groupe de solidarité Sope Malick .
Mariétou pratique le commerce dans la vente de fruits et légumes une activité qu'elle maitrise bien pour l 'avoir pratiqué depuis longtemps.
Avec son nouveau prêt de 250000 elle va acheter 35 paniers d'oranges , 25 paniers de mandarines et 15 sacs d'oignons et des pastèques.
A l'aide de ses bénéfices Madame va aider son mari dans la prise en charge scolaire des enfants et acheter du riz du sucre et de l'huile à la fin de chaque mois.
texts.en: Mariétou is a married woman who is 60 years old and has six children and four grandsons. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois since 1st September 2008 and belongs to the Sope Malick solidarity group. She buys and sells fruit and vegetables, a business which she masters well since she has been doing it for a long time. With her new loan of 250,000 francs she is going to buy 35 baskets of oranges, 25 baskets of mandarins and 15 sacks of onions, as well as some water melons. With her profits Mariétou will help her husband with the cost of their children's education and also buy rice, sugar and oil at the end of each month.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables (oranges, water melons, mandarins and onions, cabbages, etc.)

loans.name: Hoson

texts.en:
Hoson is a 50-year-old woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Hoson sells blankets and clothes from her home and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to increase her income by purchasing more clothes and blankets to sell.

Hoson is looking to open a shop for her products instead of selling them from home.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and blankets to sell.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy is 41 years old and single. She lives with her parents in Ho Chi Minh City. Thuy supports her family with the income that she earns selling nutritional soup. She intends to use her loan to buy rice, shrimp, and fish to cook soup. She hopes her business will run smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice, shrimp, and fish to cook soup

loans.name: El Señor Es Mi Rey Group

texts.es: El Banco El Señor es mi Rey, está formado por emprendedores que día a día luchan por salir adelante con sus negocios. Este banco tiene 11 integrantes en el cual sus negocios son diferentes pero con sueños de crecer y invertir en sus negocios. La presidente del grupo que es Vilma de la Cruz los está siempre motivando para que todos juntos salgan adelante, apoyándose unos a otro. Heydi Johana  es parte de este grupo de emprendedores en el cual su actividad económica es la venta de cerdo,  enchiladas y tacos en su comunidad, ya tiene clientes fijos y eventuales que la visita, el financiamiento que está solicitando es para invertir en el negocio en la compra de cerdos y materia prima para la elaboración de las enchiladas y tacos. Al igual que el reto del grupo el financiamiento lo están solicitando para invertir en sus negocios en esta temporada que muy buena.
texts.en:
The ‘El Señor es mi Rey’ bank is made up of entrepreneurs who are struggling on a day-to-day basis to get ahead with their businesses.  The bank has 11 members; each of them has a different type of business, but they have a shared desire to grow and invest in their respective businesses.  The president of the group is Vilma de la Cruz, who is always motivating them to get ahead together and to help each other.  

Heydi Johana is part of this group of entrepreneurs.  Her economic activity is selling pork, enchiladas, and tacos in her community.  She already has regular customers as well as occasional customers that she visits.  She is asking for the loan so she can purchase pork and ingredients for making enchiladas and tacos.  As with the rest of the group, her main challenge is financing; the other members are also asking for loans to invest in their businesses, since this time of year is very good for business.

loans.use: to purchase pork and ingredients for making enchiladas and tacos.

loans.name: Moyo Group

texts.en:
Virginiah is 33 years old and married. She has three children, age 13, 11, and 4 years. Two of them are going to school. 

She is in the business of buying and selling shoes, operating from her residential place in Masvingo Zimbabwe. She has been in business for three years. These shoes are imported from South Africa. 

High competition in the market is the challenge she faces in the business. 

Virginiah has requested a loan of $250 to buy more shoes for resale. With the extra income from this loan, she will be able to improve the standard of living of her family. 

In the next five years she is planning to own her own shoe and clothes sales shop in the central business district of Masvingo.

loans.use: to buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine is married with five children. She lives in the Makangarawe area of Dar es Salaam and she keeps cows for milk production. She has employed two assistants to help with the cows. She supplies milk to various restaurants and nursery shools in the Temeke disrict.

She wants to buy new bicycles and vessels that will facilitate a greater supply of milk. Together with this business she owns a shop selling shoes. She wants to increase the stock of shoes as there is an expected rise in price. The two businesses need USD 1000 as the working capital to grow as she plans.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca operates a drinking spot in her community. She sells a variety of drinks ranging from local to foreign. Becky has participated in the TEACH Lending skills training of Kraban Support  Foundation and therefore requires a loan amount of $800 from Kiva to enable her to expand and improve upon her business by purchasing more drinks to sell to her customers. She wants her drinking pub  to be the number one spot in her community.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a computer, scanner, and printer

loans.name: Marisela

texts.es:
Marisela is married and has two children. The family lives in Monclova, Coahuila. Marisela has been making flour tortillas, which is a much-consumed product in northern Mexico, for the last 15 years. She began her business due to the need to help her husband with their children’s education and with improving their quality of life, which would have been impossible with her husband’s low salary. She has arranged a part of her house for making her torillas, for which there has come to be so much demand that she cannot keep up.

In order to improve the area of her house where she makes the tortillas, and to increase her production, Marisela is requesting a loan of $475, which she promises to return in 3 months. The growth of this business, and Marisela and her family’s wellbeing, is in your hands. Please decide to support them.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Marisela es casada y tiene dos hijos, ellos viven en la localidad de Monclova, Coahuila. Desde hace 15 años Marisela se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas de harina, que son un producto muy consumido en el norte de México, inició con su negocio ante la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo con la educación de sus hijos y mejorar su calida de vida, que sería imposible con el salario tan bajo que recibe su pareja. Ella ha acondicionado un lugar de su casa para la elaboración de sus productos, que poco a poco ha sido insufciente para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.

Para poder tener mejor acondicionado su local, y poder incrementar su producción, Marisela solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 3 meses. El crecimiento de este negocio y el bienestar de Marisela y su familia está en tus manos, decídete a apoyarla.

loans.use: Remodeling

loans.name: Nuriya

texts.en:
Nuriya S. is a pensioner. Her husband died 8 years ago and she was left to fend alone for 7 children. She was compelled to start whatever business she could. She had 10 chickens so she decided to sell eggs. Her first batch was 20 eggs, and she sold them to the canteen located in the station “Abreshim”, Khujand.

Soon the canteen manager offered to let her sell her eggs at a little stand outside of the canteen. Gradually Nuriya increased her working capital and was able to include some different kinds of goods to her inventory such as cigarettes, cookies, and plastic bags. Now she would like to further increase the variety of her goods. For this purpose she is requesting a loan of US$ 800.

loans.use: offer a greater variety of goods at her little stand

loans.name: Isnarda De Concepcio

texts.es:
Isnarda is married and has five children, of whom one has graduated from the University. She has a small clothing shop. Her husband is a taxi driver and she helps him with the household expenses. Her children still live with her and older ones help her with the sales in the shop, which is located in the Santa Ana Market of the city of Chinandega.

Before she had this job, she sold bread as a street vendor. The business has existed for 28 years and it started out on the sidewalks of the Santa Ana market, practically in the open air. After selling on the sidewalk for 10 years, she managed to obtain a spot inside the market and built a small stand from wood and black plastic, which she improved over time. She began the business with approximately $200.00 of capital. Isnarda is a very humble and hardworking person who has had to sacrifice, working in the sun and rain in order to raise and educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Esta señora es casada, tiene cinco hijos, de los cuales una de ellas se graduó de la Universidad. Ella posee un pequeño local de Venta de ropa, su esposo es chofer de taxi y le apoya en los gastos de su hogar. Aún sus hijos están a su cargo y los mayores le ayudan con la venta en el puesto de ventas, el cual está ubicado en el Mercado Santa Ana de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Antes de tener este negocio ella se dedicaba a la venta de Pan de forma ambulante, el negocio tiene más de 28 años de existir y al principio estaba ubicado en las aceras del mercado Santa Ana, con una pequeña mesita, prácticamente a la intemperie, luego de 10 años de vender en la acera, logra ingresar al mercado y construye un modesto puesto con madera y plástico negro el cual fue mejorando con el tiempo. El negocio inicia con un capital de aproximadamente US$ 200.00 dólares. Doña Isnarda es una persona humilde y luchadora que ha tenido que sacrificarse en el sol y la lluvia para criar a sus hijos y darles educación.

loans.use: To buy clothing inventory (men's, women's, and children's clothing)

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T. is one of the first members of TYM Fund (KIva Partner) in Minh Phu province, Vietnam. Before joining TYM, her life was very difficult. Her husband Le Xuan Tu is a veteran. He did not have a fixed job; their children are all small; and they did not have any fund to start a business. Since 1992, she started to borrow from TYM Fund but she did not use her loan quite effectively. In 1999, with the new trend of economic model that focuses on all three components: farming, fishing, and breeding, Mrs. T. discussed with her family and decided to change to his new model. She now has 3.2 acres of garden, 7 perches of pond with hundreds of fruit trees, and 750 ducks, chickens, and grooses. She would like to borrow 450USD to buy food for her poultry.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Thành là một trong những thành viên đầu tiên của Quỹ Tình thương tại xã Minh Phú. Khi chưa có Quỹ, cuộc sống của gia đình rất vất vả. Anh Lê Xuân Tự, chồng chị, là bộ đội phục viên, không có việc làm ổn định, các con còn nhỏ, gia đình lại không có vốn để làm ăn. Từ năm 1992, chị liên tục vay vốn từ QTT để phát triển kinh tế với nhiều mô hình kinh tế khác nhau nhưng chua thực sự hiệu qủa. Năm 1999, được sự góp ý của cán bộ kỹ thuật phụ trách và ban lãnh đạo thôn về chuyển đổi mô hình kinh tế VAC, chị Thành đã bàn bạc cùng gia đình và mạnh dạn dồn điền đổi thửa, tập trung làm kinh tế trang trại với diện tích 3,2 mẫu đất với vườn cây, ao cá, và các loại gia cầm (750 con vịt, gà, ngan, ngỗng, 7 sào ao cá, và hàng trăm cây ăn quả). Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 450USD để mua thức ăn cho đàn gia cầm của mình.

loans.use: Buy chickenfeed

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
Mrs. A. started her business by selling yucca, potatoes, tamarind, chayotes (prickly pear or christophine), sugar beets, and carrots as a traveling saleswoman since the age of 8. She used to accompany her sister in this line of work.

With the hope of improving her quality of life, she looked for financial aid and with the helping hand of CEPRODEL, she’ll be able to further her business.

Currently she has a small locale, not in the best condition but at least it has a roof to protect it from the elements.

One of her goals is to improve the conditions of her locale and that her daughter keeps up her studies in order to have a better life. She doesn’t want her daughter to have to work since childhood as she did and earn her keep as well as support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. A. inicia su negocio con la venta de yuca, papa, Tamarindo, Chayote, Remolacha y Zanahoria ambulante desde la edad de ocho años en un inicio acompañaba a su hermana en esta faena.

Con la esperanza de mejorar su nivel de vida decide la búsqueda de apoyo financiero y es por medio de la mano amiga de CEPRODEL que ha logrado el desarrollo de su negocio.

Actualmente cuenta con pequeño local no muy bien acondicionado pero por lo menos tiene un techo para soportar las inclemencias del clima.

Una de sus metas es mejorar las condiciones de su local y el que su hija siga estudiando para que logre un mejor nivel de vida y no le suceda con ella que tuvo que trabajar desde muy pequeña para ganarse su sustento y permitirse el apoyo económico de su familia.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos R. is a married father of six. For twenty one years, Carlos has operated a motorcycle shop which adjoins his house. With a good location, and constant clientele, his business has become very well known in the area. His reputation is among the best not only in motorcycle repairs but boat engine repair as well.

His ultimate goal is to have a larger shop, bring in more clientele, and increase the profits of his business. With a family of eight to support, Carlos understands the necessity of bringing in more customers, and keeping his current customers happy. He is asking for a loan to purchase motor parts and other provisions for his shop.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for motorcycles.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is a 29 year old divorced woman who takes care of 2 people, ages 10 and 27. Hawa owns a small food store, which she started in 2005. She works everyday from 5 a.m. to 9:30 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.
Hawa now hopes for a loan of $100 to start a new business.

loans.use: To start a new business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase the merchandise he has for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth's Songambele Ukonga A Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 58, is divorced with three children, ages 39, 28, and 18. She runs a nursery school and also tutors preschool-aged children on the side. She started her school in 1995 and it brings her a salary of about $230 a month. The school is open from 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. daily.

Elizabeth has taken three previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania, and she now hopes for a new loan to improve the quality of her school. She will share this loan with her subgroup, whose members have clothing and general item businesses.

In the picture, Elizabeth is the furthest on the right.

loans.use: To improve the quality of her nursery school.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr:
Born on August 5, 1966 in Cotonou in the economic capital of Benin, Littoral County, Ms. Josephine B. is married and the mother of 4 children. She is trained as a nurse and works at Bethesda, a Christian health care center in Cotonou, however she also sells various consumables that she purchases in Togo and Nigeria. In the beginning, she delivered her products to bureaucrats, going from office to office in her free time. Now she has a shop which she uses both to store her goods and as a sales point. She is requesting her first loan from Alidé and intends to use it to restock and diversify her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née le 05 Août 1966 à Cotonou dans la capitale économique du BENIN dans le département du Littoral, dame B. Josephine est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Infirmière de profession et travaillant à Béthesda, un centre de santé chrétien de Cotonou, elle exerce parallèlement à cette profession, la vente de divers produits de consommation courante qu'elle achète au Togo et au Nigéria. Initialement, elle livrait ses produits aux fonctionnaires en passant de bureau en bureau à ses heures libres. Elle dispose aujourd'hui d'une boutique qui lui sert à la fois de magasin de stockage et de point de vente. Elle sollicite son premier crédit à ALIDé en vu de s'approvisionner et de diversifier son activité.

loans.use:
Purchase of ten 10-kilogram bags of rice, 2 cartons of spaghetti, a carton of tinned food, and 50 liters of vegetable oil

Achat de 10 sacs de 10 kg de riz, de 02 cartons de spaguetti, un carton de boîte de conserve et 50litres d'huile végétale.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali, 38, is divorced. He lives alone in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut and the only thing that counts for him is his barbershop. Ali has requested a loan in the amount of US$ 500 to change the interior decoration of his shop, which was damaged during the July 2006 war. This is the first time Ali has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: to remodel his shop

loans.name: Catarina

texts.pt:
Catarina C. is 46 years old and a native of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. She is single and the mother of a 29 year-old son who is already married. She lives with 2 nieces and 2 grandchildren.

Catarina attended school until the 4th grade and stopped because she was pregnant. She grew up with her mother who was separated when she was a baby. She got pregnant when she was 16 which obliged her to quit school. The father of her son refused to assume responsibility so Catarina had to arrange for another husband. With their first child something went wrong, and since she was unable to have more children she was rejected for the second time. She decided to return to her mother's house and never married again.

She started an business to sell various products and gradually was able to build a home. Catarina has lived for 6 years raising chickens. She works alone, learned from a friend and has 6 years of experience. She has an average monthly production of 300 chickens which equates to about 3,000MT per month.

This is the second loan with Hluvuku and she had one with the Tchuma cooperative. The first loan with Hluvuku was for 10,200MT and the second will be for 16,000MT. All proceeds are for raising chickens. She came to know Hluvuku through a friend who was already a client. Catarina is confident that with this loan she will be able to increase her production, respond to her clientele, and consequently realize better profits.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer Catarina C. tem 46 anos de idade e natural da provincial do Maputo ao sul de Moçambique, solteira e mae um filho de 29 anos e já se casou. Vive com duas sobrinhas e dois netos. Catarina estudou até Quarta classe e parou por ter ficada gravida. Cresceu junto da mãe esta que separou-se quando ela era bebe. Ficou gravida aos 16 anos de idade situação que lhe obrigou a deixar de estudar e o pai do filho que veio ater negou de assumir e teve que arrumar outro marido e no primeiro filho algo não foi bem durante ao parte fez com ela não pudesse dar mais filhos e assim foi rejeitada pela segunda vez e decide voltar a casa da mae e nunca se casou mais e optou por criar um auto emprego de venda de produtos diversos e aos poucos construiu sua casa. Catarina vive a 6 anos na base de criação de frangos e trabalha sozinha, aprendeu a traves de uma amiga e tem uma experiência de 6 anos. Tem uma produção media mensal de 300 frangos o que aproxima a 3000,00mt liquido mensal. Este é o segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e um na Cooperativa Tchuma , o primeiro na Hluvuku foi de 10200,00mt e o segundo sera de 16000,00mt todos destinados para criação dos frangos e conheceu a Hluvuku a traves de uma amiga que já era cliente. Catarina está confiante que com este empréstimo vai aumentar a sua produção assim responderá a sua clientela e consequêntimente verá da melhor maneira os lucros.

loans.use: To raise chickens

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa is 27 years old and belongs to the Communal Bank “Niño Manuelito” in Huaraz. She hopes to have a secure place to sell her products and be able to support her children, as her husband is a brick layer and he has sporadic work. She also hopes to construct a house on land they have acquired with great effort.

She raises small animals like guinea pigs, turkeys and chickens, which she then sells in the markets on Mondays and Thursdays in Huaraz. She also sells her chickens’ eggs, averaging 30 eggs a week.

With the loan for S/1500.00 soles, which will be repaid in 8 payments, she will buy guinea pigs, chickens, and also will install the foundation for her new home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Elsa tiene 27 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Niño Manuelito” de Huaraz, ella espera tener un puesto seguro para vender sus productos y no descuidar a sus dos hijos, ya que su esposo es albañil y tiene trabajos esporádicamente, también espera poder construir su casa en un terreno que lo han adquirido con esfuerzo.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, pavos y gallinas, las cuales después los vende en las ferias de lunes y jueves en la ciudad de Huaraz, también vende los huevos que ponen sus gallinas, en un promedio de 30 huevos semanales.

Con el préstamo de S/ 1 500.00 soles, que lo pagará en 8 cuotas, ella comprará cuyes ,gallinas y también pondrá las bases para su nueva casa

loans.use: Buy small animales (guinea pigs, chickens)

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is a widow with one daughter, Yekaterina. Tatyana's vending stall, where she sells bedding and sheets, is located at one of the busiest city markets, called Kolos. She's been in this business for 2 years. 

Tatyana is a serious and prudent business owner. Her perseverance, together with lending services from Nadiya Ukraine, has enabled her to gradually expand her business. Today Tatyana owns a container-store. Container-stores are large metal shipping containers often used for overseas shipping. They can be used for storage, but make an ideal shelter from which market vendors can sell merchandise. In Nikolaev, most market entrepreneurs own little stores or such containers-stores. Tatyana's working capital has grown to $6,000 now. Tatyana's pleasant manner and willingness to meet clients' needs have helped her keep a loyal clientele. Tatyana is requesting a loan of 2000 Grivnas to purchase an assortment of linen sheets and blankets in bulk to sell during this chilly fall season. Her responsibility, stable business growth, and prompt payment record characterize Tatyana as a consistent and serious entrepreneur capable of loan repayment.  

Note: this is a short-term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To increase assortment of inventory

loans.name: Assadllah

texts.en:
Assadllah is married. He lives with his own family. He has a restaurant. He has been involved in this business for a long time. He got the first-cycle loan and used it for his business and until now he is furthering his business. Now he plans to enlarge his business. He wants to take out his second-cycle loan.

Therefore he has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghanis with a term of 12 months to enlarge his shop and complete his stock and change the design of the restaurant. He would love to be a good business dealer in the future.

He is happy. He plans to open another restaurant in the next 5 years. He tries his best to open another restaurant with his income. He wants to say that without this loan it was impossible to get his restaurant to be its best and he hopes that he is going to be the best in the future.

loans.use: To continue to expand his business

loans.name: Gloria A.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 58-year-old Gloria K. from Mbeya, married with five children between the ages of 25 and 34. Gloria has been running a cash-lending business since January 2008, lending small amounts of cash from $5 to $25 to the people around her, and being repaid with a small amount of interest after a certain period. Working for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week, Gloria currently earns about $45 each moth from her business.

Gloria is currently requesting a loan of $650 in order to lend to more people, and in the future she plans to employ more workers. Gloria thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To lend money to more people

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo is a member of the Manantial (“Spring”) Village Bank. Consuelo is 28 years old and single; she lives with her parents. She runs a store from her home where she sells dry goods, fruits, vegetables, gifts and pills; she also has a public telephone. Her store is located on a very busy street, and she and her sister work there every day of the week. Consuelo is also studying to be an elementary school teacher. Consuelo needs a loan of 3450 soles to buy fruitcake, wine and champagne. Consuelo’s dreams are to own a larger, wholesale store, and for her siblings to finish their studies and get jobs in their respective fields.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Consuelo es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial. Consuelo es soltera, tiene 28 años y vive con sus padres, Consuelo tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, regalos, pastillas, teléfono publico, su tienda esta ubicada en una avenida muy concurrida, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hermana. Consuelo además estudia educación primaria en la universidad. Consuelo necesita un préstamo de 3450 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de panetones, vinos y champaña. Los sueños de Consuelo son tener un negocio mas grande y ser mayorista, sus hermanos culminen sus estudios y ejercer su carrera.

loans.use: Buy fruitcake, wine and champagne

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Umwaka mushya muhire! (Happy new year) from Julienne N. in Nyarugenge District, Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. Julienne is 32 years old, married with 4 children.

This entrepreneur owns a small shop in her local area. She sells household materials such as soap, maize flour, cassava flour, matchboxes, salt, sugar, beans, Colgate, paraffin, biscuits etc. From all her business activities, she earns about US$ 85 per month.

Julienne is requesting a loan worth 500 000 Rwf which will help her to expand her business. This loan will be repaid over 8 months.

loans.use: Expanding her  little general store

loans.name: Mrs. Lina Pov Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eleven people living in Run village in Takeo province comprise this village bank, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Lina P., the 27-year-old village bank president, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Chuon Channy, is a furniture maker. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Lina P. decided to ask for a loan to buy wood to make more cabinets to sell. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. She has two children who are too young to work or study.

One member in this group loans has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. EoT borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy wood to make more cabinets to sell

loans.name: Mirgia Guadalupe

texts.es: la Sra. Mirgia tiene 51 años de edad es muy alegre, trabajadora y dinamica, tiene 16 años de dedicarse a su negocio el cual es un salon de belleza, ella tiene clientes fijos de todos los meses ya que les gusta como les hace el trabajo de corte de pelo, tintes, etc. ella tambien hace iluminaciones, aplica tintes, tratamientos para el pelo, lavado de cabello y tambien vende cremas, shapoos, acondicionadores, esmaltes de uña, cremas perfumadas, ella anteriormente solo se dedicaba a la venta de estos productos pero en la actualidad puso su negocio de salon de belleza, ella necesita el credito para poder comprar mas maquinaria que le ayude a hacer su trabajo mas facil, ella necesita comprar maquina para corte de pelo de hombres, cepillos para secar el pelo, planchadora de pelo etc, esto para tener mas clientes y atenderlos como se debe.
texts.en:
Mirgia is 51 years old. She is a happy, dynamic and hard-working person. She has been making a living for the past 16 years as the owner of a beauty salon. She has a set list of clients that come to her salon once a month since they like the work that she does of cutting, styling and coloring their hair. She also does highlights and hair treatments. She gives hair-washes and sells shampoos, conditioners and nail polishes and scented lotions. Before she started her salon, she only worked by selling beauty products. Now that she has the salon, she needs a loan to be able to buy more equipment that will help her to do her job better. She needs to buy trimmers to cut men's hair, brushes to remove hair, a straight iron, etc. Will all of this new equipment, Mirgia will be able to take better care of her clients and to attract new clients to her salon.

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clippers to cut men's hair, a straight iron, peroxide, hair dyes and ,cosmetic products.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: FRANCISCO DE 58 AÑÓS DE EDAD, SE ENCUENTRA CASADO. SE DEDICA AL TRANSPORTE DE PASAJEROS EN TAXI. PERTENECE A LA COOPERATIVA DE TRANSPORTE OBISPO ESTEBAN, ES DECIR SE ENCUENTRA AFILIADO A LA MISMA. ÉL ES PROPIETARIO DE LA MOVILIDAD QUE CONDUCE. LA FAMILIA VIVE EN UNA CASA QUE ES PROPIA, SU FAMILIA CONSTA DE ÉL SU ESPOSA Y SUS 2 HIJOS (HOMBRE Y MUJER). FRANCISCO TIENE UNA EXPERIENCIA DE 24 AÑOS EN EL RUBRO DEL TRANSPORTE POR LO QUE LA COMPETENCIA NO ES MUY RELEVANTA PARA EL DESARROLLO DE SUS ACTIVIDADES. EL DESTINO DEL CRÉDITO ES PARA USO PERSONAL. NO TIENE ANTECEDENTES NEGATIVOS EN EL SISTEMA FINANCIERO.
texts.en:
Francisco is 58 years old and married. He works as a taxi driver. He belongs to the transport cooperative Obispo Esteban. He is the owner of the cab he drives. His family, which consists of his wife and their son and daughter, lives in a house they own. Francisco has 24 years of experience in this field, so competition is not an issue for his business. This loan is for personal use. He does not have any negative history in the financial system.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Enoe De La Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Enoe de la Concepción Hernández,  tiene la edad de 36 años habita en el barrio la Francia numero dos, junto sus dos hijos, ella es madre soltera, los planes hacia un futuro es brindarle mejor condición de vida a sus pequeños, la actividad de ella es el comercio y la agricultura desde hace ocho años  como agricultura y diez como comerciante, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , los planes hacia un futuro en su cultivos es poder diversificarlo para obtener mejores ingresos y poder comprar un terreno y trabajarlo . El financiamiento lo quiere  para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para tener una cosecha buena.
texts.en:
Enoe de la Concepción Hernández is a 36-year-old single mother who lives with her two children in the “Francia Number 2” neighborhood. Her dream for the future is to provide a better standard of living for her children.

Enoe is a shopkeeper and a farmer. She has worked in agriculture for eight years and in business for ten. The biggest difficulty she faces is a lack of funding. In the future, she would like to diversify her crops to increase her income. She would also like to buy a plot of land to farm.

She is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizers and supplies to ensure a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase farming supplies for a good harvest

loans.name: Subira Huvuta Kheri Group

texts.en:
Time is 24 years old, married, and has two children aged 5 and 1. She has been a coconut and cassava seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar since past one year. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. She works at her business for 7 hours everyday. She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more coconuts and cassava to improve her business. She hopes that the loan will help increase her profit and grow her business. 

She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Aziza and Mwanaaha, who also have their own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts and cassava to improve her business.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
"To manage a farm is very difficult, especially when you don't have enough resources to finance most of the farming needs," says Rogelio A., a 47 year old father of two children. He tills a five hectare farm. He owns his farm and all of his harvest is managed well. Some of the harvest is saved for family use and the remainder is sold to rice traders in their village.

He is asking a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to purchase 13 sacks of fertilizers, as well as herbicides. The loan will really help him increase his income.

CEVI aims to help small businesses grow. They provide not just loans to all their clients but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase 13 sacks of fertilizers, as well as herbicides.

loans.name: Edma Clarisa

texts.es: La Señora Edma Clarisa T. tiene la edad de 86 años, su estado civil es soltera. La actividad económica de Doña Edma es la compra y venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante, por lo que ha sido muy difícil a su edad dedicarse a este negocio, pero Doña Edma le gusta mucho su manera de ganarse la vida. Los propósitos de Doña Edma son de invertir en productos nuevos para mostrar a sus clientes. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y así comprar en Managua camisas, pantalones, ropa interior, faldas y además calzado. El sueño de Edma es mantener su negocio ya que por medio de este ha logrado sufragar sus gastos.
texts.en:
Edma Clarisa T. is 86 years old and she is unmarried. She buys and sells general merchandise, and has been doing this for more than 10 years. She is a walking saleswoman, which is why it has been hard for her to do this work at her age. However, she really likes earning a living in this way. Doña Edma proposes to invest in new products to show to her customers. The loan will be used for working capital to buy Managua shirts, pants, underwear, skirts and shoes. Edma's dream is to continue her business since she been able to defray her expenses through her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa tiene 61 años, es una mujer noble, D. carácter sencillo y felizmente casada. Tiene 5 hijos, D. los cuales ahora sólo vive con uno D. ellos que tiene 20 años. DesD. hace más D. 42 años se dedica al cultivo y al cuidado D. sus plantas cafetaleras, las cuales le han resultado muy rentables, por ello les brinda toda su atención y dedicación. Luisa tiene el apoyo D. su esposo y D. su hijo para las tareas agrícolas, por lo que trabaja con complacencia. Entre los meses D. mayo a agosto la cosecha D. sus productos le permite captar dinero suficiente para cubrir la educación D. sus hijos. Años pasados realizaba sus siembras sin abonarlas, pero últimamente no le está dando buen resultado, por lo que ahora viene abonando sus tierras constantemente con la finalidad D. mejorar su producción y D. ese modo cubrir holgadamente la educación D. su hijo. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, durante los ciclos anteriores demostró responsabilidad en  sus cuotas, sometiéndose ahora a la misma responsabilidad. En las pocas veces que interviene durante las reuniones D. su banco comunal, lo hace con opiniones espontáneas y muy salomónicas, que muchas veces dejan sorprendidos a sus compañeros. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra del fertilizante denominado “súper fosfato” para el abonado D. sus cultivos D. café.
texts.en:
Luisa is 61 years old. She is a noble lady with an uncomplicated character and is happily married. She has 5 children, only one of whom she now lives with and who is 20 years old. For more than 42 years she has cultivated and cared for coffee plants that have been very profitable because she lavishes all of her care and attention upon them. Luisa’s husband and son help her with her farming chores so she does not have to worry about the work not being completed. Between the months of May and August, her coffee harvest earns her enough money to pay for her children’s education. In past years she sowed her seeds without fertilizer, but in the end this did not proviD. her with a good result. Consequently she now regularly applies fertiliser to her land and as a result increases her production and can comfortably cover the costs of her son’s education. This is her fifth loan with MFP. During the previous loan periods she demonstrated a responsibility in making her repayments and will be equally responsible in this one. During the few occasions that she was involved in the community bank meetings, her spontaneous and even-handed opinions often surprised her companions. The money that she is asking for will be used to buy a fertiliser called “Super Phosphate” for use on her coffee crops.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertiliser

loans.name: Nicole

texts.en:
Nicole D. is married and has two children, one boy and one girl. She lives with her family in Cotonou, the largest city and economic capital of Bénin. Nicole owns a hairdressing salon and has been working there for a year.  Before, she worked in a salon in the Aibatan neighborhood of Cotonou, but she quit that job in order to open her own shop. Nicole’s salon is away from the bustle of the city, but she is well situated to serve the needs of her clientele.  

Nicole is seeking a loan in order to purchase more cosmetic products to stock her salon. She normally buys her products at the Dantokpa Market, one of the largest open-air markets in West Africa. In the future, Nicole would like to expand the variety of her merchandise to include shoes, handbags and pagnes, beautifully colored West African fabrics.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.en: Celedonia M. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 69 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Celedonia owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. In 2000, Celedonia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Celedonia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 14th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Tika Llajta Group

texts.es: Los miembros del grupo “Tikallajta” esta representado por la señora Margot y conformada por 12 miembros los cuales tienen diferentes actividades como la venta D. bebidas en licorerías, atención en cafés Internet, venta D. cristalería, artesanías, cosméticos, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, elaboración D. masitas y al servicio D. limpieza y pintura decorativa para casas. Pese a la existencia D. la competencia en su ambiente laboral los miembros del grupo luchan cada día para poder brindar a sus familias el pan D. cada día. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. mercadería para incrementar más sus ventas D. cosméticos, cristalerías abarrotes, insumos para la elaboración D. productos D. mayor calidad, y herramientas que ayuD. a la realización mas eficiente D. sus fuentes D. ingreso que representa el ingreso D. sus hogares a los cuales desean brindar una mejor calidad D. vida. Una mayoría D. los miembros del grupo tiene conocimiento D. la modalidad D. grupos solidarios y saben que se debe tener unidad, honestidad y responsabilidad no solo con la institución sino con los miembros del grupo.
texts.en:
The members of the group “Tika Llajta” are represented by Mrs. Margot, and the group is maD. up of 12 members, who pursue different activities like selling drinks in liquor stores, taking care of Internet cafés, selling glassware, producing handicrafts, selling cosmetics, running grocery stores in the neighborhood, making cakes, and providing cleaning and decorative painting services. Because of the competition in their work setting, the members of the group fight every day to be able to meet the needs of their families. This loan will be used to buy merchandise to increase their sales of cosmetics, glassware, and groceries, to buy supplies to make higher-quality products, and for tools to help them work more efficiently, since these sources of income contribute to their households’ income. They want to offer their families a better quality of life. Most of the members of the group are familiar with solidary groups and know that they must have unity, honesty and responsibility, not only with the institution, but also with the other group members.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for their businesses

loans.name: Doeurm

texts.en:
At the age of 28, D. is now the father of a child who is still young, and he is the husband of Lok, 26, who owns a plot of farming land and is employed as a local farmer. D. is a local fisherman a long the Mekong River.

The family’s standard of living has been improved by taking a loan from HKL to buy fertilizer for their farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Salehe

texts.en:
Salehe R. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur and a married man. He runs a café business at Vingunguti Ward in Dar es Salaam. He sells cooked and fried food including soft drinks to customers. He has been running the business for the past four years and his business income does a lot to meet the family’s daily needs.

Business materials are purchased from the wholesale and retail shops. Salehe needs a loan of Tshs 1,400,000 to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for his business

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther es una mujer trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa provincia de Coronel Portillo, tiene 52 años, es madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales tres son mayores de edad y un menor, ella tiene un vivero forestal  y trabaja junto a su esposo en las parcelas. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth” desde hace ocho años. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles, que invirtió en el estudio universitario de su hijo, ahora ella necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles que será utilizado  en la compra de plantones y víveres que llevará  a sus parcelas.

loans.use: Invertirá en la compra de plantones y víveres que llevará  a sus parcelas.

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.es: La señora Leocadia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Rosales”, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Separada, tiene 50 años y es madre de 04 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes.Leocadia, es una mujer alegre, perseverante y capaz. Se dedica a la venta de ropas y nos comenta que le esta yendo muy bien ya que tiene clientes que la conocen y saben de su negocio. La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza, le ayudo a crecer como mujer independientemente y segura de si misma. También Leocadia se dirige, a los pueblos aledaños, a ofrecer su mercadería de ropas.Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, comprará  más mercadería de ropas para surtir su stock como: pantalones, shorts, blusas en todas las tallas y modelos, polos y vestidos para adultos y niñas. Ella manifiesta que esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado y lo hizo con mucho entusiasmo y optimismo.Agradece la oportunidad que le ha dado y sigue dando el Movimiento  Manuela Ramos, de  contar con los  préstamos que me ayudan a desarrollarme como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Leocadia belongs to the Las Rosales Communal Bank in the San José de Sisa district, Dorado province, San Martín department. She is 50, separated, and has four grown and independent children. Leocadia is a happy, perseverant, and capable person. She sells clothes. She tells us that it is going very well for her. She now has customers who know her and her business. The strength and perseverance that characterize her helped her to grow as an independent woman who is sure of herself. Leocadia also goes to nearby towns to sell clothes. With this loan for 2,500 PEN she will buy more clothes to stock her inventory. She will buy things like pants, shorts, blouses in all sizes and styles, shirts, and dresses for adults and children. She is very proud of what she has achieved, and she did it with much enthusiasm and optimism. She is grateful for the opportunity that the Movimiento Manuela Ramos gave and continues to give her. Having the loans helps her to develop as a woman and as an entrepreneur with a small business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing merchandise

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en: Victorina is a 64-year-old married mother of nine children, the eldest of whom is 44 and has his own family. She makes Filipino delicacies and sells them in her community. In addition, she also buys dried fish to sell. Victorina joined Kiva partner CEVI in 2006 to make use of its financial service. She likes the program because of the low interest rate (only 2 per cent) on CEVI loans. She is now requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy ingredients for her food-vending business and also dried fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food-vending business, and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Pov Daok Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of nineteen people, who all live in Khnar Thum village in Takeo province. Mrs. Srey Pov D. is the village bank president and was selected by the members.

She breeds pigs as a business. She is also a weaver. Now, she needs some money to buy more raw materials to support her business. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family's living with this loan. Mrs. Srey Pov D. is 41 years old widow with four children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials to support her business.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon P. is a well-known merchant and vendor in his neighborhood. He is 38 years old and has two children. He began his business in 1998. In 2005, when his mother had severe diabetes and needed one of her limbs amputated, he went bankrupt because he had to use all his money for medical costs and postoperative treatments.

In 2006, he reopened his business and has since then built up a permanent staff and continued to steadily grow his enterprise. Ramon will use his loan to buy wholesale jewelry to make a better profit.

loans.use: Merchandise to sell

loans.name: Eleanor

texts.en: Eleanor C. is from the town of San Roque-Dapdap, Bamban, Tarlac. She is 35 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Eleanor owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2008, Eleanor joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Eleanor is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fourth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is married with 4 children. She is 55 years old. She lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. She is a focused, hard worker. She sells garri(cassava flakes) at retail prices to her customers.She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more cassava to fry more garri to sell. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers.she hopes to expand her business in the future. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava to fry more garri (cassava flakes) to sell

loans.name: Leap's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, which consists of twelve people, is located in Tradak Pong village in Takeo province. Mrs. Leap C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members, and each of them will use the loan for a different purpose. 

Leap is a farmer who owns 3-hectares of land where she cultivates rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sok Chan, is a construction worker.  

Mrs. Leap C. faces a problem with her rice field because it has infertile soil, but she doesn't have enough money to support it. So she decided to request a loan to purchase fertilizers and additional pesticides. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are construction workers, while the third is studying in the local public school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 28-year-old single man who lives alone. In 2005, he bought a crane and starting working in construction. Operating as a freelancer, he managed projects across the whole region he lives in. His business has grown dramatically and he has a large and increasing number of customers. In order to continue expanding his company, he has applied for a loan for $1,200 to buy a new crane.

loans.use: to buy a new crane

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos es una persona de 31 años de edad, su estado civil es soltero, tiene un 1 hijo que depende de él. Juan Carlos trabaja como transportista de pasajeros, es decir es chofer de taxi. Si bien hay bastante competencia en el rubro del transporte de pasajeros de taxi, también hay bastante demanda del servicio por lo que se hace rentable el negocio y además de que Juan Carlos cuenta con experiencia en el rubro y sabe donde puede conseguir mayor cantidad de clientes a diferentes horas del día. El crédito fue solicitado para realizar mejoras en la vivienda donde habita, el vive en casa de su mamá junto también a su hijo. Juan Carlos no tiene una experiencia crediticia ya que este es su primer crédito.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 31 years old. His marital status is single, and he has one dependent child. He works transporting passengers, as a taxi driver. If there is substantial competition in his business, there is also substantial demand for taxis, which allows him to lease his business. In addition, Juan Carlos has much experience as a taxi driver and knows where to find a steady supply of customers at all hours of the day. This loan was requested to make improvements in his residence, which he shares with his mother and his son. As this is his first loan request, Juan Carlos has no credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home Improvement

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda C. is from Barangay Bacolod, Ozamiz City. She is 54 years old, is single, and has one adult child. Esmeralda works in a family member's business operating tricycle transport services. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Esmeralda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Esmeralda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle in order to provide better service. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle to provide better service

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en: Bolormaa is 39 years old and lives with her son in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the largest city and capital of Mongolia. She and her son live together in a small house that belongs to the one of her relatives. Bolormaa has been operating a fruit stall at a local market. She sells a variety of fruits and vegetables. Bolormaa has built her business to a consistent level and attributes its success to her strong communication skills. She is a very hardworking person and pays her loan on time.  Bolormaa is focused on the future and says, “I would like to purchase my own plot of land with a house and yard for my family.” She is requesting a 500,000-tugrug loan to purchase a variety of vegetables such as potatoes and carrots at wholesales price to resell for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: Née en 1967 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, A. Elisabeth vit depuis environs 26 ans au quartier Xwlacodji à Cotonou. C’est une veuve qui est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Elisabeth vit seule avec ses enfants et assure les différentes charges de la famille. Elisabeth n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Elisabeth vend des tissus, de façon ambulante. De plus, Elisabeth prépare et vend également de la nourriture (pâte rouge de Maïs) devant l’école primaire de Xwlacodji.  Elisabeth s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Elisabeth exerce cette activité depuis 15 ans, et est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé. Elisabeth a déjà bénéficié de six crédits auprès de ALIDé, et les a tous bien remboursés. Elisabeth sollicite un autre prêt en vue d’élever davantage le niveau de son activité de vente de tissus et de se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Born in 1967 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin, Elisabeth A. has lived for around 26 years in the Xwlacodji district of Cotonou. She is a widow who is mother to three children, all of whom are at school. Elisabeth lives alone with her children and takes responsibility for the family's various expenses. She did not go to school. In order to provide for her needs and those of her children, Elisabeth sells fabric on a door to door basis. Furthermore, she prepares and also sells food (red corn dough) in front of the primary school in Xwlacodji. Elisabeth gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. She has been carrying out this activity for 15 years and is a regular client of ALIDé. She has already had six loans from ALIDé and repaid them all in full. She is requesting another loan in order to raise the level of her fabric-selling activity and in order to make more money.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pieces of fabric

loans.name: Dolores Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora  Dolores Guaman  es una de las integrantes más antiguas del banco comunal Nuevo Porvenir pues lleva 16 ciclos gracias a la presidenta del bankito quien la invito, ella vive en la parroquia Cumbe donde podemos apreciar el centro parroquial organizado en torno a la plaza central y a las vías de acceso formando un conjunto de traza irregular, también se caracteriza por conservar parte de su arquitectura tradicional la cual se ve reflejada en las casas de dos plantas con soportes en la planta baja por  columnas de madera levantadas sobre bases talladas en piedra.  La iglesia es una de las más antiguas del sector su estructura es totalmente de adobe y bahareque con techo de teja, en su interior alberga  el crucifico del Señor de los Milagros.

Nuestra socia tiene 46 años de edad y casada hace algunos años y madre de cuatro hijos quienes se encuentran de 25, 23, 20, 15 años, su primera hija trabaja como contadora de una empresa y le ayuda un poco económicamente, la segunda es casada vive en su casa compartiendo los gastos, el tercero trabaja como chofer y ayuda un poco en casa,  su último hijo se encuentra estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad de Cuenca,  su esposo trabaja en su taxi y  gracias al esfuerzo de todos  han logrado construir su casa propia.

Dolores es comerciante de carne, faena su ganado o también le entregan carne para vender,  se encuentra  catorce años en ésta actividad  y aprendió sola el oficio,  vende los días viernes, sábado y domingo en el mercado de la feria libre (mercado de Cuenca), en un puesto de su propiedad, con  el dinero del nuevo credito va a comprar una moledora y cortadora de carne para agilitar su trabajo y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Su meta es conseguir un puesto en el mercado para trabajar todos los días.
texts.en:
Dolores Guaman is one of the most long-standing members of the Nuevo Porvenir communal bank as she has been through 16 cycles, she gives thanks to the president of the bank who invited her. She lives in the parrish of Cumbe where the parrish centre is organized around the central plaza and the access ways are irregular in appearance. It is also noted for conserving part of its traditional architecture which you can see reflected in the two story houses supported on the ground floor by columns of wood raised upon foundations carved in stone. The church is one of the oldest in the area and its structure is made completely of adobe and bahareque with a tiled roof. The crucifix of Señor de los Milagros is housed within. Our member is 46 years old and has been married for some years and is the mother of four children who are 25, 23, 20, and 15. Her eldest (daughter) works as a company accountant and helps her a little financially, the second (daughter) is married and lives in her home sharing expenses, the third (son) works as a driver and helps a little at home, her youngest (son) is studying at school in the city of Cuenca. Her husband works as a taxi driver and thanks to everyone's efforts they have managed to build their own home. Dolores sells meat, she slaughters her livestock and also people bring her meat to sell. She has spent fourteen years in this business and learnt the trade herself. She sells Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays at the Feria Libre market (market in Cuenca) at a stall she owns. With the money from the new loan she is going to buy a meat grinder and a meat saw to speed up her work and give her customers better service Her goal is to get a stall at the market every day.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a meat grinder and a meat saw

loans.name: Boudrosse Al Maou

texts.fr:
Né le 02 Septembre 1983 à Kita (région de Kayes), Monsieur Boudrosse Al Maou Keïta  est célibataire sans enfant résidant à Hamdallaye Extension, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
   Monsieur Keïta, après l’obtention du certificat d’aptitude professionnelle en bâtiment (CAP BÂTIMENT), s’est initié à la fabrique des savons qu’il a appris  à Bamako en marge de ses études il y a environ six ans. Il mène son activité  à son domicile avant de les revendre à Koutiala et à San où il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a quelque mois. Il est à son premier prêt individuel et compte l’utiliser pour acheter, 2 futs d’huile de coco, 2 sacs de soude caustique, 1 carton de parfum, etc.
   Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 120 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born 2 September 1983 in Kita (in the Kayes region), Mr. Boudrosse Al Maou Keïta is unmarried with no children, and resides in Hamdallaye Extension, one of the populous boroughs in Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Mr. Keïta obtained a professional certification in building construction (CAP Bâtiment), but six years ago began manufacturing soap, which he had learned to do in Bamako during his studies.
