He conducts his business at his home before selling his products in Koutiala and in San, where he is much in demand due to the quality of his products. To satisfy an ever-increasing customer base, he decided a few months ago to join the Soro Yiriwaso MFI. He is now requesting his first individual loan to buy two barrels of coconut oil, two bags of lye, one carton of perfume, etc. With this loan he hopes to attain a monthly profit of 120,000 FCFA, which will be used to deal with daily expenses, pay back his loan, and invest the remainder in his commercial activity.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make soap

loans.name: Tri

texts.en: Tri S., 57, is widowed and resides with her five children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. She raises pigs at home for an income of about USD 2 per day. One of her children is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 4 per day to help cover the family expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase more piglets for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more piglets

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, de 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos en la casa de su madre.Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores. Se dedica a la comercialización de forraje, maíz  y habas que produce, los lleva a la feria comercial de su localidad y a los comerciantes que lo solicitan. Su trabajo es durante todo el día, y su esposo  trabaja junto a ella y sus hijos también la ayudan en las labores. Para ella lo mas rentable es la venta de forraje, porque es lo que tiene mayor  demanda en su zona, además tiene clientes fijos es por eso que desea adquirir nuevas extensiones de terreno.Es la sexta oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete que será  muy responsable con sus pagos, y agradece  a las personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo, pues le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Gloria tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono que necesita para su próxima campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Gloria, 35, lives with her husband and their 5 children in her mother's house. She has worked in agriculture and raised small animals all her life. She sells fodder, corn and broad beans that she produces and brings to the commercial market in her area and to the merchants who request her products. She works all day, and her husband works with her. Their children also help them with the work. For Gloria, the most worthwhile activity is the sale of fodder, since it is most in demand in her area. She also has loyal clients, and so she wants to acquire new expanses of land. This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she promises to be very responsible with her payments. She thanks the people who are making this loan possible, as it will be very useful in the advancement of her business. Gloria plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of several bags of fertilizer that she needs for the next sowing season.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Ganiatou

texts.fr: K. Ganiatou est née en 1974 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Ganiatou est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés, dont seulement trois sont à sa charge. Ganiatou est une veuve qui vit seule avec ses trois enfants à charge. Ganiatou vit au quartier Finagnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis une quinzaine d'année. Ganiatou subvient seule aux besoins de la famille, grâce au revenu de son activité. Ganiatou n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Ganiatou vend en effet, des produits divers (pâtes alimentaires, conserves de tomate et de sardine, lait, mayonnaise, beurre, savons, huile végétale, vinaigrette, etc.) à son domicile. Ganiatou s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Ganiatou est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui effectue bien les remboursements de ses crédits. Face à la concurrence grandissante, Ganiatou désire renforcer son activité afin d'accroître sa clientèle et de se faire plus de revenus. C'est pour cette raison que Ganiatou sollicite un autre crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Ganiatou K. was born in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, in 1974. She is the mother of five children, all of whom have been educated. Only three of her children still live at home. Ganiatou is a widow who lives on her own with her three school aged children. She has lived in the Finagnon quarter of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for about fifteen years. Ganiatou has never been to school. Ganiatou manages the household on her own, thanks to the income from her business. She sells assorted merchandise (pasta, canned tomatoes and sardines, milk, mayonnaise, butter, soaps, vegetable oil, salad dressings, etc.) out of her home. Ganiatou buys her stock in Dantokpa, Benin's international market. Ganiatou has been a client of ALIDé for some time, and has paid back her previous loans. Because of increasing competition, Ganiatou wants to grow her business so she can have a bigger client base and generate more income. This is why Ganiatou is requesting another loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted merchandise (pasta, canned tomatoes and sardines, soaps, oil, milk, etc.)

loans.name: Geovanei

texts.en:
Geovanei C. is from the village of Makawa Aloran Misamis Occidental. He is 36 years old. Geovanei is married and has one school-aged child. Geovanei owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motortransport services to local community members. Geovanei has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2009, Geovanei joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to do business. Geovanei has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Geovanei is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Geovanei from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Berno

texts.es: El Sr. Berno vive en el Barrio el Mirador de la urb. El Recreo, de la zona del plan  3000, el se dedica a l transporte publico  y a la venta de verduras tiene su puesto en el mercado los pozos cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijas. El crédito es para construir un cuarto y su baño y necesita material de construcción como cemento, loza, etc.  El se levanta a las tres de la mañana para ir al mercado abasto y comprar las verduras que lleva al mercado los pozos, luego trabaja con su vehículo hasta las cinco de la tarde. El Sr. Berno es una persona trabajadora y dedicada a su familia siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Berno lives in the Mirador neighborhood in the El Recreo housing development of the Plan 3000 zone. He works in public transportation and selling vegetables. He has a stand in the Los Pozos market, and his daughters help him. The loan is to build a bathroom. He needs construction materials like cement and flagstone, etc. He gets up at three in the morning to go to the suppliers’ market. He buys vegetables there, and he takes them to the Los Pozos market. Then he works with his vehicle until five in the afternoon. Berno is a hard-working person who is devoted to his family. He is always thinking of his family’s well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a bathroom

loans.name: Marigold

texts.en: Marigold D. is a married woman who lives in Prk, Sambag, Brgy Bonifacio, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a sari-sari (general) store. Her husband Edgardo D. Jr., who is 33 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are 1 to 11 years old. Marigold joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past seven loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marigold has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 17,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her eighth loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 21,000, which she intends to use as additional capital so that she could continue to save up for their future needs. Marigold D. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team. http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: A. Christine est née en 1981 à Savè dans le département des Colines au Bénin. Mariée à HOUNKANRIN François, Christine est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Christine vit avec sa famille au quartier Agbodjèdo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Le couple s'est installé dans ce quartier il y a juste un an. Christine apporte une aide financière à son mari en l'aidant dans les charges du ménage, grâce au revenu de son activité. Il y a près de sept ans que Christine s'est mise à vendre des produits cosmétiques de façon ambulante. Christine fait ses provisions à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi à Lomé au Togo. C'est la deuxième fois que Christine sollicite auprès de ALIDé un crédit, en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux servir sa clientèle. Le premier prêt obtenu par Christine a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Christine A. was born in 1981 in Savè, in Benin’s department of Colines. She is married to François HOUNKANRIN and the mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives with her family in the neighborhood of Agbodjèdo in Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. The couple moved there just a year ago. Christine’s business income allows her to help her husband with the household expenses. She started selling cosmetic products as an itinerant vendor almost seven years ago. She gets her stocks in Dantokpa, Benin’s international market, and also in Lomé, located in Togo. This is Christine‘s second time seeking a loan with ALIDé to strengthen her business and better serve her customers. The first loan she was granted was repaid without incident.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 30 years old and married with one child.  He distributes bread and milk to small and medium traders including hotels. He has been engaged in the business for seventeen years.  His business is located in the slum settings within Lenana Village.  He has managed to employ one person.  

For financial support, Peter joined the  Unity Self Help group in Faulu Kenya.  He had previously taken out loans amounting to 210, 000 Kes through the group.  Now, Peter has started becoming a stable business-man and a responsible father.  He has requested for a loan of 50, 000 Kes to purchase a plot for future construction of a bread-making bakery.  He dreams of becoming a successful business-man with a number of bakeries in the country. Peter says that he is a young, hardworking and energetic man who likes rendering services to people.

loans.use: To purchase a plot for future construction of a bread-making bakery

loans.name: Betys Adela

texts.es: Betys Adela se dedica a la venta de refrescos y repostería, hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que ha sido muy buena experiencia ella trabaja duro todos los días ya que tiene que salir de manera ambulante para obtener nuevos clientes y además ofrecer los deliciosos refrescos y la repostería. Trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano por lo que tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, su mayor desafío ha sido dedicarse a su negocio y a sus hijos pues ambos necesitan de su atención. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de frutas, azúcar, bolsas y pajillas. Sueña con proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en: Betys Adela works selling drinks and pastries; for the past 3 years, she has run her business and it has been a very good experience for her.  She works hard everyday since she has to walk around the markets to get new customers and to sell her drinks and pastries.  She works everyday from very early because she has 2 young children to take care of.  Her biggest challenge is to balance her business and caring for her children who need her attention.  The loan she is seeking is to buy fruit, sugar, bags and straws.  She dreams of improving her home.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose B. Jr. is from the village of Bungad, San Pablo, Isabela. He is 37 years old. Jose is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Jose owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling ice cream. Jose has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jose joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jose has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Jose is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Jose from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Don Carlos, es un comerciante de mariscos y pescado, reside en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután, tiene 50 años de edad, y su familia está conformada por su esposa y sus cuatro hijos que sus edades están entre 9 y 25 años de edad; El negocio lo administra con su esposa y llevan ya 8 años dedicándose a este comercio, ellos viajan a otros pueblos a vender el pescado viendo la forma de atender nuevos mercados y que sean buenos para consumir este producto.
Don Carlos quiere invertir en las compras por mayor por lo que se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para realizar dicha inversión, que para él significa mucho puesto que de esta manera podrá tener mejores ventas y progresar con el negocio.
El propósito de él es luchar por que sus ventas aumenten pues él quiere tener un negocio estable y prospero para de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos y de toda la familia.
texts.en:
Don Carlos operates a seafood business.  He lives in Jiquilisco, a town in the Salvadoran "departamento" of Usulutan.  He is 50 years old and married with four children who range in age from 9- to 25-years old.  He operates the business with his wife and they have run it for 8 years now.  They travel to other towns to sell, looking for new markets and calculating which are best for sales.  
Don Carlos is applying for a loan because he wants to buy wholesale supplies of seafood.  For him, the loan offers a way to increase his sales and grow the business.  His goal is not just to increase sales, but to establish a stable and prosperous business so that he can improve the lives of his children and the rest of the family.

loans.use: Buy wholesale supplies of seafood for resale.

loans.name: Gigina

texts.en:
Gigina G. is a 43-year old married who supports her family by operating a business a fishing and fish vending  business.  She lives in Purok Suyac, Brgy Taba-ao, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her  fishing / fish vending  business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP10,000. 

Gigina is now borrowing PHP 12,000 so that her could purchase fishing materials. This will be her 4th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP9,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Gigina aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF: 
 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase fishing supplies

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en:
Marie Chantal is 22 years old and married, but they have no children. She runs a tailoring business in the market where she sews different clothes, such as dresses, skirts, trousers, etc. She has been running this business for two years and works from 7am until 5pm during the week.

Marie Chantal has requested her first loan from Kiva via Vision Finance Company to purchase more sewing materials. The extra income she makes from this loan will help her save for her future.

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing materials

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan N. weaves bamboo baskets for sale. He sells his finished products to buyers in and around Kompong Chhnang Province. Chan N. and his wife make over 30 sets of baskets before selling their output. They also order baskets from the other villagers and sell them for additional income. This couple is blessed with three children, all of whom are single, and they are still learning in public school. They often help them when they have free time from their studying. Currently, Chan N.’s house is broken down in some parts because of heavy rain and it is not comfortable for him and his family to live in. To solve this problem, Chan N. would like to use his loan to purchase some pieces of wood to repair the broken part of his house.

loans.use: To purchase some pieces of wood to repair the broken part of his house.

loans.name: Almash

texts.en:
Almash S. is 49 years old.  She has four children – three are grown and live on their own, and the youngest son is studying at school. She graduated from a trading college and worked as a seller in the local area. 

More than 20 years ago, in order to find an additional means of subsistence for their large family, Almash and her husband decided to engage in livestock breeding.  They started this business with the initial sum of 8,000 Kyrgyz Soms. With the revenues generated, they were able to give a good education to their children.  In spite of the expenses of a large family, they managed to expand their herd of cattle.   Today, Almash’s farm has two milk cows and twenty sheep.  

Almash wants to use this loan of 80,000 KGS to buy one calf and twelve sheep. With the revenues from this loan investment, Almash plans to reconstruct her house. In the future, she dreams to build a cosy house for her youngest son. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To buy 1 calf and 12 sheep

loans.name: Venancio

texts.es: Venancio, de 60 años, esta  casado con Leoncia  (45)  y tienen cinco hijos; juntos habitan su  casa que es propia, y esta ubicada en el distrito de Quimbiri.Es un hombre trabajador, y  vela por brindar una mejor calidad de vida  a su familia. Venancio llegó de su ciudad natal con el propósito de asentar su negocio en esta zona; él se dedica al negocio de pasamanería pues realiza implementos de decoración confeccionados a base de cordones, borlas o galones, envolvimiento de fundas, cortinas, confección de gallardetes, entre otros. Para realizar su labor cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa e hijos, y su trabajo le genera buenos ingresos económicos porque no existe mucha competencia, y es el único dedicado a este tipo de negocio por la zona del VRAE. También trabaja con diferentes municipalidades donde confecciona gallardetes para el premio de los desfiles cívicos. Su plan a futuro es instalar una nueva filial en el distrito de Pichari, pues desea aumentar su manufactura y a la vez quiere obtener mejores ingresos.Es el 13avo crédito con MFP, y  se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus pagos, tal como lo hizo en los anteriores préstamos, además esta satisfecho con el apoyo de la institución y con su banco comunal pues le están permitiendo progresar.Venancio tiene planeado invertir el dinero  solicitado en la compra de  telas y materiales que le hacen falta, con la finalidad  de abastecerse y producir con mayor  tranquilidad; de esta manera espera seguir con la prosperidad de su negocio.
texts.en:
Venancio, age 60, is married to Leoncia (age 45). They have five children. They live in their own house, which is located in the district of Quimbiri. He is a hardworking man and wants to offer a better quality of life to his family.

Venancio arrived from his home town with the goal of establishing a business in this area. He is engaged in the business of selling ornamental trim. He accomplishes this with tools with which he manufactures lace, pom-poms, and braid that are applied to slipcovers, drapes, and pennants, among other things.

He has the support of his wife and children in carrying out his work. His work generates a good income because there is not much competition. He is the only one engaged in the business in the area of Vrae. He also works with different municipalities when they make banners for the prizes in civic parades. His plan for the future is to open a new branch in the district of Pichari since he wants to increase his production and, at the same time, obtain better earnings.

This is his thirteenth loan with MFP, and he promises to continue to make all his payments, just as he has done previously. In addition, he is satisfied with the support he gets from the institution and his communal bank since they have permitted him to make progress. Venancio plans to invest the money applied for in the purchase of fabric and material that he lacks with the goal of supplying himself and producing with greater peace of mind. In this way he hopes that his business will continue to prosper.

loans.use: To purchase materials in order to supply his business.

loans.name: Ed Rose

texts.en: Ed Rose S. is 24 years old. She is from a municipality where we find the famous rafflesia, a very large and rare flower; this is the municipality of Sibalom, Antique, Philippines. She is a very industrious mother and a loving wife of July S., a fish vendor. They have two children; they are James Michael and Julie Rose. Because of poverty they did not finish their studies in college; that’s the reason opportunities for them are very limited and they could not find decent jobs. So when ASHI came into their baranggay (district or neighborhood), they didn’t let that opportunity pass by. Instead, she joined as a member and she starts to dream for their future. Her first loan was used in her business: buying and selling fish. This business is managed by her husband. The income that they earned from this business really helped them to sustain their basic needs, and sometimes, if they got a bigger income, she set aside some money for her savings. As of now, she is applying for 10,000 Philippines pesos for her next loan. This amount will be utilized as additional capital for her fish-vending business. Her greatest dream in life is to have more capital so that they will have also a bigger income that will sustain their needs, especially for the educational expense of their children. She also wishes to have a decent house someday.

loans.use: Fish vending

loans.name: Oqtay

texts.en:
Oqtay Q. is a 56-year-old man living in Sabirabad. He is married and has three sons aged 23, 22 and 19. Oqtay owns and runs an electrical goods and destined-for-dowry (housewares) store. He mainly sells to the local community. 

Oqtay has been in the trading business for over ten years and earns approximately 500 AZN per month. He successfully repaid a prior loan taken out from AqroInvest. Oqtay is a hard-working man and wants to expand his business and earn more income. For this reason, he requested a new loan of 1,600 AZN from AqroInvest and Kiva. He used this loan to diversify his inventory and enlarge his store. Oqtay plans to use all of his profits to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to diversify his inventory and enlarge his store

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is 46 years old. She has two children who are 22 and 18 years old. Florida is a widow. 

Florida sells foodstuffs, such as beans, and she has done this business for 10 years. Florida requests a loan to purchase more foodstuffs to make additional profits, and to renovate her house with the profits she plans to make.

loans.use: Buying additional inventory of beans

loans.name: Faxraddin

texts.ru:
Faxraddin G. rodilsya v 1963. On jenat i imeyet 1 rebonka. Faxraddin yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i rebonkom. On uje 7 let kak rabotayet taksistom. 
Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye zapchasti dlya pochinki svoyey mashini , Tak kak yeqo mahsina isportilas, seychas on ne mojet razvozit kliyentov poeotmu on nujdayetsya v pochinke mashini.
texts.en: Faxraddin G. was born in 1963. He is married and has one child. Faxraddin is an Internally Displaced Person from the town of Fuzuli, now living in Fuzuli Region together with his wife and child. He has been working as a taxi driver for the past seven years. At present he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy spare parts to repair his car. Since his car broke down, he is now unable to transport client, and this is why he needs to have his car repaired.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car

loans.name: Hugo Javier

texts.es: Hugo Javier A. de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus cuatro hijos, en Mejicanos departamento de San Salvador. El posee un puesto de refrescos en una zona peatonal muy concurrida de Mejicanos y eso le ayuda a tener mucha clientela, además el se caracteriza por ser muy servicial y la gente lo busca porque prepara los mejores refrescos del lugar, con el mejor sabor y a un buen precio; debido a esto Hugo ha tenido mucha demanda y necesita comprar más ingredientes para sus refrescos como agua, azúcar, maní,  cocos y otras frutas además utensilios como botes, bolsas, cucharas entre otros; es así como le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita obtener todo este material de trabajo. Hugo espera así lograr mantener activa su fuente de trabajo y  seguir solventando las necesidades de su hogar para dar a su familia la calidad de vida que merecen.
texts.en:
Hugo Javier A. is 44 years old.  He lives with his life companion and his four children in Mejicanos, in San Salvador department.  Hugo owns a soft drinks stall in a very busy pedestrian precinct in Mejicanos.  This means he has a lot of customers.  In addition, Hugo is very obliging and people seek him out because he prepares the best drinks in town, with the best flavor, and at a good price.  As a result, Hugo has a lot of demand and he needs to buy more ingredients for his drinks such as water, sugar, peanuts, coconut and fruit.  He also needs to buy utensils such as jars, bags, spoons, etc. 

Hugo is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow him to obtain all the supplies that he needs for his work.  He hopes that, in this way, he will manage to keep his source of work active and continue being able to cover his household needs, so that he can provide his family with the quality of life that they deserve.

loans.use: to buy water, sugar, peanuts, coconut, fruit, jars, bags and spoons

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel  tiene 26 años de edad que reside junto a su familia  el distrito de Lambayeque, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales. Ella cría a sus animales en algunos ambientes situados en su domicilio, cuando ya ha desarrollado lo suficiente los ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona. Esta actividad le permite ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento de la economía.

Isabel desea adquirir alimento balanceado para su ganado. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Isabel is 26 years old and lives together with her family in Lambayeque district, 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque department.

Isabel raises and sells livestock.  She raises her animals on her property and, when they have reached a sufficient level of development, she offers them for sale to the traders in her area.  This activity allows her to help her family financially.

Isabel would like to acquire balanced feed for her livestock.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa with which she plans to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed

loans.name: Marat

texts.en:
Marat S., born in 1962, lives with his wife and two daughters in Kapan. For a long time now, Marat has been engaged in gardening. He grows apple trees, pear trees, cherry trees, and fig trees in his garden. He also cultivates potatoes, carrots, and greenery. He sells his fruits and vegetables in Kapan market and distributes them via Kapan’s food shops as well. Thanks to his gardening income, Marat is able to support his family, pay for his elder daughter’s education, and develop his garden. 

Marat has a plot of unused land, where he intends to lay out a new garden with nuts, apple trees, and pear trees. This is why Marat is seeking to take out a 1.000.000 AMD loan, which will be used for soil cultivation, water supply system construction, and the purchase of young plants.

loans.use: to cultivate his soil, construct a water supply system, and purchase young plants

loans.name: Chabagan's Group

texts.en:
Chabagan K. is  50 years old and a leader of this group. She is a resident of Tokmok. For many years, Chabagan taught Russian language and literature in a local high school. Her husband is a coach in the same high school. Twelve years ago following the advice of her relatives, Chabagan purchased cattle and gave them to her younger brother for care. The initial investment was 10,000 soms with a monthly revenue of 1,000 soms. Chabagan says it is enough for every day purchases. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase two calves for fattening and reselling. She hopes to have a big household in the future. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Hadi

texts.ar: هادي عمره 29 ينة اعزب يعمل في تعهدات الحفلات وتأجير الصوتيات له في عمله 3 سنوات يحب عمله وهو كل اهتمامه يريد من خلال تكبير عمله الى توسيع المحل ودعم عمله وزيادة مدخوله يتيميز عمله بالدقة والابتكار يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء معدات جديدة صوتيات واجهزة اضاءة حيث انه يتميز بالانفراد في العمل في هذا المجال ولكن ما نقصه هو رأس المال في هذا المجال حتى يتمكن من الاستمرار في العمل ما يعيق تقدمه في العمل هو زيادة رأس المال له زبائن من القرى المجاورة وابناء قريته لقلة هذا المجال في المحيط هو شاب طموح نشيط ويريد التطور والتقدم في العمل
texts.en: Hadi is 29 years old and unmarried. He works providing supplies for parties, and rents out audio equipment. He has been doing this for three years. He loves his job and it is his sole priority. He wants to expand his store and increase his income. His business is distinguished for its innovative nature. With this loan he wants to purchase new lighting and audio equipment. His business is unique but he lacks the financial support necessary in order to achieve continuity and stability. He has many customers from his local and surrounding areas. He is an ambitious and energetic young man who wants development and progress for his business.

loans.use: to purchase new audio and lighting equipment for his business.

loans.name: Khodour

texts.en:
Khodour is a 38-year-old married man who is father to two children.  He has been the owner of a chicken shop since 2003. Khodour sells both live and  butchered chicken, depending on his clients' requests. His shop is clean compared to others in similar business.  He specializes in good quality products and affordable prices.

Khodour also makes special chicken dressings and prepared plates such as crispy escalope, in addition to selling eggs.  He needs a refrigerator to keep these products fresh.  For that reason, Khodour has requested a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva partner to buy a refrigerator. This is Khodour's fifth loan cycle with Al Majmoua.  His previous loans have reflected positively on his expanding business and increasing operations.  

Khodour works hard to improve his business in order to satisfy his family's needs and to expand his region of work.  He hopes to expand his business more and more in the future through selling cooked chicken plates and sandwiches.

loans.use: buy a refrigerator for his business

loans.name: Harapan Jaya 8 Group

texts.en:
Saniah is one of the members of this group. She is married and has three children.
She requested 2,000,000 Indonesian rupiah to buy vegetables like beans and spinach, which she will sell in her kiosk.
Because her education was only until elementary school, she hopes she can enable her children to reach a higher education level.

loans.use: to buy vegetables like beans and spinach.

loans.name: Amistad Y Union Group

texts.es: La señora Violeta es parte del grupo Unión y Amistad comenta que le pusieron así al grupo por que todos son amigos y están muy unidos. Ella se dedica a la compra, cría y venta de puercos desde hace 8 años y dice que el negocio no lo tenían planeado ya que empezó comprar para uso de ellos para las fiestas que hacían en su familia y que ya después la gente cuando quería hacer alguna fiesta iban y se los compraban a ellos. Doña Violeta esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de alimento, vacunas, desparacitantes, vitaminas para que los puercos crezcan rápido y pueda venderlos pronto y a un buen precio. Ella vende sus animales en su localidad y los compra ahí mismo y otros son crías de las cerdas que tiene. Una de las problemáticas que tiene Violeta por la cual no puede crecer mas su negocio es que su hijo el menor sufre una enfermedad llamada epilepsia y dice que gasta mucho en llevarlo a l medico. Ella tiene otros tres hijos mas uno estudiante de 3 de primaria y una niña de 7 años la cual estudia segundo de primaria, una niña de 4 años y su menor de 2 años. Doña Violeta día a día le hecha ganas para salir adelante con sus hijos, ya que desde muy temprana hora también vende frutas y legumbres en la central de abastos. La meta que tiene para el negocio es hacer una granja en su casa y seguir comprando más puercos para venderlos por mayoreo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Violeta is part of the group Unión y Amistad and says that they put this group together because they are all friends and very close.  She has purchased, bread and sold pigs for 8 years.  She says that they did not plan on having this business but she started to buy them to use for family parties and since then when people wanted to have a party they would purchase the animals for them.

Violeta is requesting a loan to buy feed, vaccines, anti-parasite medication, and vitamins so that the pigs can grow quickly and she can sell them quickly and at a good price.

She sells her animals in town and buys them there as well and others are bread from the pigs that she has.  One of the reasons why Violeta cannot grow her business is that her youngest child suffers from epilepsy.  She says that she spends a lot to bring in a doctor.  She has 3 other children, one is a 3rd grader, a 7-year-old daughter in primary school, a 4-year-old daughter and her youngest is 2-years-old. 

Everyday Violeta makes progress in advancing her children, since she gets up at a very early hour to sell fruits and vegetables in the central market.  Her goal is to make a farm business at home and keep buying more pigs to sell wholesale.

loans.use: to breed and sell pigs

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia de 49 años, vive con su esposo e hijo en su casa propia, cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por tener actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Julia desde hace 4 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral (pavos), cuenta también con una pequeña tienda que a instalado en su casa.  Su corral de sus pavos se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales, una vez que alcanzan peso y talla óptima los ofrece en los diferentes mercados de la zona y con sus ganancias podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más aves de corral de diferente especie como para adquirir más productos para surtir su tienda, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá pagar su crédito otorgado y solventar sus obligaciones de su hogar.    Julia es una mujer que a pesar de las adversidades de la vida a sabido sacar adelante a su familia en especial a su único hijo; con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo.
texts.en:
Julia is 49 years old.  She lives with her husband and son in her own home which has water and electricity.  Her home is located in Mórrope district, in Lambayeque department.  This area is noted for the fact that the local people farm, raise livestock and make handicrafts.

Julia has been raising and selling farmyard birds (turkeys) for four years.  She also has a small store located in her home.  Her turkey pen is located behind her home.  She feeds her birds with balanced feed and natural grains.  Once they have reached an optimum size and weight she sells them in the different markets in her area.  She is able to use her profits to provide her family with a better quality of life.

Julia has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy different species of farmyard birds.  She will also buy more products to stock her store.  She will use the income that she makes to repay her loan and cover her household's financial needs.  Julia is a woman who, in spite of life's adversities, has known how to get her family, especially her only son, ahead in life through a lot of effort and hard work.

loans.use: to buy more farmyard birds, and products to stock her store

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva lives in Uganda.  She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. Eva has a retail shop. She has been in this business for three years, and she works seven days out of every week.  Eva sells her products in a shop, retail.

Eva has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap, and cooking oil.  The main business challenges for Eva include transportation, ever increasing prices of commodities, and defaulters  .Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only.

Eva lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and boxes of soap, etc.

loans.name: Juliette

texts.fr:
Cliente de 43 ans célibataire avec 5 enfants dont l'age varie entre 7 a 24 ans, tous sont scolarises, dont 2 a l’université
Étant déjà a son  troisième cycle, elle a remboursée avec succès et a fait des épargnes considérables durant les 2 premiers cycles, ses ventes ont beaucoup augmentées, a l'heure actuelle , elle a des recettes de 50.000 a 100.000frs par jour.

Avec ce nouveau prêt elle va acheter des cartons de tomates, des boites de conserves de la macédoine, cartons de mais doux, des saucissons sec, des cartons de cassoulets. 
Elle a pour ambition d'ouvrir une boutique d'alimentation pour abandonner son étalage , puisque pendant les pluies , elle n'arrive pas a vendre, c'est pour cela qu'avec ses bénéfices elle a commencer a acheter des tôles , du ciment et a prendre a charge la scolarité de ses enfants
texts.en:
Forty-three years old and single with five children between the ages of seven and 24 who are all in school (two of whom are in college), this client is in her third loan cycle. She has successfully repaid her first two loans, and has saved a considerable amount. Her sales have increased greatly, and at present, her revenue is between 50,000 and 100,000 francs per day.
 
With this new loan, she will buy boxes of tomatoes, cans of fruit and vegetable salad, boxes of sweetcorn, dried sausages, and boxes of cassoulet [meat and bean stew]. 

She aims to open a food shop in place of her stall, since she cannot sell when it rains. It is for this reason that she has begun to use her earnings to buy sheet metal and cement, and why she has taken charge of her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy boxes of canned goods such as peeled tomatoes, fruit and vegetable salads, sweetcorn, and dried sausages.

loans.name: Presiosa

texts.en:
Presiosa is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has 3 children. 

Presiosa has a shop that sells recycled materials like bottles & metallic materials. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy additional recycled materials to sell.

Presiosa has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy recycled materials to resell

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is a single woman who owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are her water and electricity bills.  

For the past five years she has been operating a food café. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. In addition she operates a tailoring business from home which contributes as another source of income. She faces a major challenge in the seasonality of her business. She hopes to establish a retail shop in the future.

With the loan of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) she is requesting she wants to establish a water selling shop and purchase pipes, taps and an electric water meter. Esha decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to establish a water selling shop and purchase pipes, taps and an electric water meter.

loans.name: Makpurat

texts.ru: Макпурат 33 года, замужем и имеет троих сыновей – 11 лет, 5 лет и 3 года. С 2001 года Макпурат занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав со стартового капитала в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Макпурат насчитывается одна корова и 50 баранов. Для дальнейшего увеличения количества голов скота и закупа корма, Макпурат обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS).  Это позволит расширить ее хозяйство и повысить прибыль в бизнесе.
texts.en: Makpurat is 33 years old, married and has three sons, who are 11, 5 and 3 years old.  Makpurat has been involved in animal husbandry and beekeeping since 2001, having started with a capital of 15,000 som (KGS).  Today, Makpurat's farm has one cow and 50 sheep.  She requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to further increase livestock quantity and buy livestock feed.  This would allow Makpurat to expand her farm and increase business profit.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and livestock feed

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is married with two children, both of whom are still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a café, and her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Nuru dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase furniture, chairs and tables for the café. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase furniture, chairs and tables for her café.

loans.name: Ojo De Agua 1 Group

texts.es:
el grupo Ojo de Agua esta ubicado en la comunidad del Triunfo departamento de choluteca, dicho grupo esta intregrado por tres mujeres, las cuales se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo y han decidido formar dicho grupo para salir adelante con sus negocios y con sus familias, la cordinadora del grupo es la señora Fredys quien se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, ahi vende todo lo relacionado con la canasta basica.
Fredys es madre de 4 hijas.
Fredys en sus tiempos libres visita la iglesia.

Las otras dos integrantes del grupo son la Sra. Delia quien tambien tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion y la Sra. Cristina que vende refrescos y churros a los trabajadores de las empresas meloneras.

El credito lo utilizaran para la compra de abarroteria y refrescos.
juntas trabajan duro para salir adelante.
texts.en:
The “Ojo de Agua” group is located in the community of Triunfo, Choluteca Department.  This group is composed of three women who have known each other for a long time and have decided to form a group to get ahead with their businesses and families.  The group coordinator is Fredys who sells daily consumption items.  She has a home-based grocery store where she sells everything related to a family’s basic needs.  Fredys is the mother of four daughters.  In her free time, Fredys goes to church.

The other two group members are Delia who also has a home-based grocery store and Cristina who sells refreshments and churros to employees at the melon processing plants.  They will use the loan to buy groceries and refreshments.  They all work hard together to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 40 years old and lives in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. One of the children is currently in school. For the past four years, Florence has been working hard to manage her salon, which provides haircuts and styling for local women. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more hair oil, which will help Florence generate greater profits and improve her quality of life. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to continue growing her business. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Florence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more hair oil

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is a married man with four children. He is 49 years old and resides in Tagulalo, Aurora, in the Philippine province of Zamboanga del Sur.

To earn a living Francisco operates a manufacturing business specialized in decoration-making business. He sells his product to the tourists and to the local community members and this product is for export. Behind Francisco is the product he sell. It is used for decoration. The items behind him is not yet a finish product. They have to color it or beautify before he bring to the market or before he sell it. That items is made of LAMPAKANAY that can be taken in the roadside of the fish pond. This is a roll of string. Francisco has been in this industry for 7 years. Each month, he earns 11,000 PHP doing this type of work.

Francisco has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase decoration-making items such as coloring materials (varnish). Francisco has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, he wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more coloring materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair the house where he lives.

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr:
Seynabou est une femme mariée âgée de 74 ans et mère de 6 enfants.
Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis 01/09/2008 elle fait parti du groupe de solidarité Sope Moussa .

Elle pratique du petit commerce plus précisément la vente d'arachide de mil  et de haricots.

Avec son nouveau prêt de 500000 francs elle va acheter 10 sacs de mil 20 sacs d'arachides et 35 sacs de haricots qu'elle va revendre au niveau du marché de son quartier.

Grace à ses bénéfices Seynabou va aider son mari dans la prise en charge scolaire des enfants mais également elle va payer des ordonnances à ses derniers en cas de maladie.
texts.en: Seynabou is a married 74-year-old woman and the mother of 6 children. She has been a member of the banc villageois (village bank) since 01/09/2008. She is part of the solidarity group Sope Moussa. She practices a little trade specifically the sale of peanuts, millet and beans. With her new loan of 500000 francs, she is going to buy 10 bags of millet, 20 bags of peanuts and 35 bags of beans that she is going to resell in the market of her neighborhood. Thanks to her profits, Seynabou is going to help her husband with the school-based care of children but she will also pay for some prescriptions from her last illness.

loans.use: to buy millet, peanuts and beans

loans.name: Maritza Del Socorro

texts.es:
Comerciante, de 36 años de edad, originaria de Granada es Maritza , madre soltera, su hija tiene 10 años de edad, esta por finalizar su sexto grado de primaria además de ser su apoyo y compañía mientras ella atiende la pulpería y la pequeña  hace sus tareas de clase. Inicio su negocio por circunstancias de la vida pues se separo del padre de su hija. El apoyo de el ha sido casi nulo y ella no podía permitir que le hiciera falta nada a su hija fue entonces que  decidió poner su negocio en su casa de habitación donde puede generar ingresos y atender a su hija. Lleva 3 años con este negocio. 
Ella solicito el préstamo para surtir su venta de granos básicos, azúcar, aceite, productos lácteos, productos de limpieza. Una de sus expectativas a futuro es brindarle una buena educación a su hija y lograr agrandar su pulpería  donde ofrezca de todo tipo de productos para el hogar.
texts.en:
A merchant, Maritza is a 36-year-old single mother of a 10-year-old daughter, who is finishing up the sixth grade while also serving as her support and company. While she looks after the convenience store, her daughter does her homework. She started her business because of life circumstances when she separated from the father of her child. Though his support was minimal, she couldn't allow for her daughter to go wanting for anything and so she resolved to start her business in her home where she could earn an income and look after her daughter. She's had this business for 3 years. 

She is requesting this loan to stock up for sales of grains, sugar, oils, dairy products, and cleaning products. One of her ambitions for the future is to provide a good education for her daughter and manage to expand her convenience store where she offers all types of products for the home.

loans.use: to stock up for sales of grains, sugar, oils, dairy products, and cleaning products.

loans.name: Zebuniso

texts.ru: Зебунисо проживает в районе Пяндж. Ей 30 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Более шести лет она занимается шитьем. Кредит берет для приобретения новой швейной машинки, чтобы предоставить качественную услугу.
texts.en: Zebuniso lives in the Pyandj district.  She is 30 years old, married, and has three children. She has a high school education.  For more than six years she has sewn for a living.  She is taking out a loan to acquire a new sewing machine in order to provide quality service.

loans.use: to acquire a new sewing machine

loans.name: Divina

texts.es:
La  señora Divina  s tiene  cuarenta siete años de edad,  se dedica a   la siembra  de limón, plátanos  desde  hace veinte años.
  Tiene  una hija Fabiola de   doce años  edad, está felizmente casada con el señor Alberto a quien quiere y le agradece por el apoyo que le ha dado ya que los dos se dedican a la siembra de limón.
Ella pidio el prestamo para la compra de semillas para la siembra de limon.
Doña Divina tambien se dedica a la venta de pan desde hace siete años.
Uno de sus sueños es  seguir trabajando y sembrar más limón y plátano para obtener más ganancias.
Le da las gracias a fundación por darle el apoyo para seguir adelante y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Señora Divina  is 47 years of age.  She has been dedicated to growing lemons and plantain for 20 year.  She has a daughter, Fabiola, who is 12 years of age.  She is happily married to señor Alberto who she loves and thanks for the support that he has given her as they are both dedicated to growing lemons.  She requests a loan to buy seeds to sow lemons.  
Doña Divina has also been dedicated to selling bread for 7 years.  One of her dreams is to continue working and to grow more lemons and plantain in order to earn a greater income.  She is thankful to the foundation for giving her the support to continue ahead and pursue her dreams.

loans.use: to buy seeds for growing lemons and firewood for making bread

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 45 years old, married to Beatrice and has seven children. He repairs and sells used radiators and has been in this business for ten years. He earns a monthly income from the business of 8,000 KES.
Patrick is requesting his first loan of 20,000 KES, which he plans to use to purchase used radiators to repair and sell. He will repay the loan with the anticipated profit and save some of it. His hope and dream is to expand his business to a level where he can employ other people.

loans.use: to purchase used radiators.

loans.name: Sarors

texts.en:
Sarors, 43, is married. She resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband has been a blacksmith for over twenty years and is successful in his career. Two of her children sell clothes in the market in Thailand. 

In order to improve her family's living conditions, Sarors is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to raise capital for her children's business so they can purchase more clothes to sell. By doing so, they would generate more profits to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her children's business and support her youngest child in getting a more advanced education.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda tiene  48 años está casada con el señor  Miguel, tienen 3 hijos de los cuales  dos de sus hijos son independientes, el hijo mayor se fue a Brasil a trabajar ya que la familia de la señora Yolanda son de escasos recursos económicos y el hijo vio esa situación y decidió buscar un mejor nivel de vida trabajando en otro país pero lejos de su familia.
La señora Yolanda y su familia viven en la comunidad de Tamborada “C” de la ciudad de Cochabamba, gracias a varios años de trabajo tienen una pequeña casa donde viven, la principal actividad es la producción de la leche cruda, para lo cual cuenta con ganado lechero, el producto entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos. El destino del crédito es para la compra de forraje para el ganado, esto le favorecerá mucho ya que desea acumular forraje para esta temporada de lluvia habrá escases de forraje y además el precio incrementara.
Entre sus sueños y metas esta incrementar ganado hasta tener una pequeña granja de 20 cabezas de ganado y que su hijo vuelva de Brasil y de esa manera puedan estar juntos.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 48 years old.  She is married to Miguel and they have three children.  Two of their children are independent.  Their oldest son went to Brazil to work because Yolanda’s family is economically disadvantaged.  Seeing the situation, the son decided to look for a better standard of living but he is working in another country far away from his family.

Yolanda and her family live in the community of Tamborada “C” in the city of Cochabamba.  Thanks to many years of working, they have a small house where they live.  Their main activity is producing unpasteurized milk and they have dairy cattle for this purpose.  They deliver the product to a business engaged in making dairy products.  The purpose of the loan is to purchase fodder for the livestock.  This will help her a lot as she wants to accumulate fodder because there will be a shortage during the rainy season and also an increase in price.  Among her dreams and goals is to increase her livestock until she has a small farm with twenty heads of cattle and that her son returns from Brazil so they can be together.

loans.use: to purchase fodder for the livestock.

loans.name: Aliitasi

texts.en: Aliitasi is a 49-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and banana to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Aliitasi has requested a loan to buy equipment and fertilizer to make her business better. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Aliitasi hopes to expand her business in the future and save more money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer,wheel barrow,shovels,bush knives..

loans.name: Victorine's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Victorine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 30 ans et est mariée à un couturier du nom de Bertin. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Victorine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportées par Victorine et son mari. Victorine a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pour faire face aux besoins de sa famille, Victorine vend de l’huile d’arachide depuis une dizaine d’année. Victorine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Victorine sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Le crédit précédent a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des bidons d'huiles d'arachide.

loans.name: Cielo Azul Group

texts.en:
In the community of Plano Grande, or Large Plane, located in the outskirts of the community of Santa Lucía La Reforma Central Guatemala, amongst beautiful mountains and fresh pine forests, live the 11 women of “Cielo Azul”, or “Blue Sky” trust bank. 

Cristina, the group president, is 28 years old and has no formal education. She is a mother and a worker, moving ahead with the support of Friendship Bridge. Of her 4 children, ages 2, 8, 10 and 12, those who are old enough are studying in primary school, thanks to the hard work and determination of she and her husband. For her business, Cristina raises pigs and grows corn, planting, harvesting, and attending to her crops year round in addition to caring for her children and keeping her home together and running smoothly. With her loan, Cristina will invest in buying pigs and hens, to expand her animal husbandry business.

The majority of the group works in agriculture, growing corn and beans, and raising animals such as chickens, pigs, and sheep, and others run tortillerías, making fresh corn tortillas for each meal for their community to buy. In their 4 years with Friendship Bridge, the women are happy about the increased profit they are seeing in their businesses, as well as the different topics of the monthly workshops, which apply to their businesses and lives, and help them grow. With between 19 and 35 years of age, some of these ladies were able to study in primary school, and some did not have this privilege, but now, almost all of them have children, and are providing education for them, determined to secure their prospects of stability and thriving in life. 

Cristina is happy to be a part of Friendship Bridge and Kiva! Thank you, investors, for making this opportunity available to her.

loans.use: to invest in buying pigs and hens, to expand her animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Rosa Antonia

texts.en:
I sell clohing items from door to door to neighbors, business offices,markets, etc. I am doig this to support my children and get them ahead in life. Because my work is door to door it is very tiring but very worth it because it is enabling me to continue making payments on a piece of land where I can have the opportunity to build my own house one day. As the holidays approach business can be fruitful as people seek to purchase new clothes for their children or household items.

Loan Use: Purchase of blouses, skirts, t-shirts, clothes and other supplies.

Mis ventas las realizo ambulantemente, visito mis vecinos, oficinas, y mercaditos para vender mi productos. Por la necesidas de darles a mis hijos sus gastos he tenido que esforzarme y sacarlos adelante. Es bastante cansado el visitar a mis clientes pero el esfuerzo vale mucho, ya que casi termino de pagar un terreno en el que pienso comenzar a contruir mi casa propia, y despreocuparme de alquilar. En estos meses las ventas mejoran ya que todas las personas buscan comprar ropa nueva para sus hijos o utensilios para el hogar.

loans.use: Compra de blusas, faldas, camisetas, ropa de bebe y otros

loans.name: Azmari

texts.en:
Azmari sells and and buys used metal. He has 3 years' experience in the current business, before that he had a electronic shop but due to a lack of income he left that shop.

Azmari is 40 years old and was born in Kabul where he still lives, in a household of 8, in district 5. He started his current business with less materials, then he took a loan from AFSG to buy  used metals to support the family better financially.

Azmari's sons are working in an electronic shop so they have been able to own their house and make improvements to it. He hopes they all get ahead with their businesses and keep working.

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: 'tanti Cecile'

texts.en:
C. is a widowed woman leaving with 3 children in Anono a township in the eastern suburb of Abidjan. C. is doing the grilled meet & fish sale business to pay the whole life expenses of her family (children school expenses, family foods, clothes, etc.).  C. wants to develop her activities in order to be able to pay the grammar school in September 2007 for her first daughter (10 years) who will finish primary school in June 2007. She will use the loan to buy a deep freezer (refrigerator) in order to be able to purchase in bulk beef meet and fish and stock for further retail sell after she has grilled them. The grilled meet and fish activities are the only revenues resource for C. and her family.
C. heard about AE&I in Dec. 2005 from other women operating in her area. She has got since then, different microcrédits from AE&I, that she totally reimbursed timely.
C. is a dynamic woman.

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy a deep freezer (refrigerator) in which she can stock fresh meet and fish that she will grill before selling

loans.name: Nguyen

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen T. T., 48 years old, is a busy but cheerful woman in Kim Dong district, Hung Yen province. Having separated from her husband many years ago, she has had to work hard to support three children, a daughter and two sons. Now her oldest child, the daughter, is 26 years old and is married. The second one is a worker. She only has to support the youngest child who is apprenticing to a hair-stylist, yet she still takes pains to work because working is an indispensable part of her life.

She raises corn, beans and peanuts in a field of almost 1ha. In addition, she has chickens, pigs and a cow in her old raising facilities. However, she is not pleased with herself and wants to expand her business. She wants to borrow $575 to invest one half in building new raising facilities. The other half will be used for buying 250 more chickens and mash as well as paying for her child's apprentice expenses. Thinking that she will have a profit of more than $31.3 per month, the current income, she cannot hide her excitement.

loans.use: She wants to build new raising facilities and buy more chickens and mash and pay for her child's apprentice expenses.

loans.name: Bakhtiyar

texts.en: Bakhtiyar, 27, is single and lives in Salyan region, Yenikand village. He has run his business for 6 years and has steady customers who frequently place orders with him. He has some difficulty keeping enough supplies on hand to fill the orders he gets, however, so now he is requesting a loan of US$1200 to purchase necessary materials for carpentry.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials for carpentry

loans.name: Tigie Dankay

texts.en: Tigie is married with two children.  When asked as to whether she needs more loans, she said, SMT loans have changed her life for the better and she will be accessing the loans until she becomes financially self-sufficient.  Tigie is thirty five years old and she makes and sells tie dye materials which she started doing two years ago.  She meets her children’s education expenses from the business income.  She plans to increase her production and sell her items in Kenema town in eastern Sierra Leone.  She said a loan of $250 will enable her to increase her stock all at one time.

loans.use: Purchase materials to increase her production of tie and dye textiles.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en: Husein is one of the most active clients of MicroInvest. He became a client in 2005 and during his activity, he increased the volume of his food products and attracted a lot of  new clients. His food shop is located in Spitamen,Tadjikistan. Today, he has a wide assortment of food products. With the loan from MicroInvest, he purchased refrigeration. It has given him the opportunity to include milk and meat products to his assortment. From KIVA, Husein has asked for extra capital, which he plans to spend for purchasing  2 sacks of flour and 50 liters of oil to sell.

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
“I am originally from the big city of Lahore. I have two children, a boy and girl. My son is in school while my daughter is too young to attend school yet. My husband works in a mall as an elevator operator and earns a salary of US$ 110 per month. I also embroider clothes to earn a bit extra.

We live with our in-laws and my mother works in someone’s kitchen and my father-in-law is retired from his government job. He now wants to start a grocery store and we need a loan to help him start up this business. We will open the store in the main market near our home, where sales can be good. This will help increase our family income.”

loans.use: Open a grocery store

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina J. works very diligently selling aluminum utensils and candy in the central market in Chinandega. She is very well known in the market due to her selling abilities and for always having a winning spirit at her business. She is the mother of three children, and works to support her husband as he helps them and their humble home.

In order to raise her standard of living, she has requested the help of Ceprodel, which has supported her through loans that have been paid correctly and on time. Her current portfolio reflects eight loans through Ceprodel, which she has used to purchase her products.

Translated from Spanish by Mindy Burns, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de utensilios de aluminio y dulces es el negocio al que con muchísimo esfuerzo se dedica la dama Luz Marina J. en el mercado central del departamento de Chinandega. Esta dama es muy conocida en el mercado puesto que se caracteriza por tener habilidades para las ventas y mostrar siempre un espíritu de superación en su negocio. Es madre de tres hijos que se esfuerza para apoyar a su esposo en el mantenimiento de ellas y de su humilde hogar.

En busca de mejorar su nivel de vida, la señora Jarquein ha acudido a Ceprodel quien le ha brindado un apoyo por medio de créditos pagados en tiempo y forma. Su cartera crediticia actualmente es de 8 créditos con Ceprodel el cual los ha utilizado para adquirir sus productos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mwavita

texts.en:
Mwavita is 32 years old, married, and has been operating a tailoring business since 2007. Everyday she works from 7a.m. to 8 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan of $150 to buy more materials, including a sewing machine, for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Laura Elena

texts.es:
Laura A. is an enterprising 45 year old woman who describes herself as happy, optimistic and very responsible. She is married to Pedro Joaquín Lira Aguilar, who works on an oil platform. They are the parents of one son, Pedro Emmanuel, who is 17 and is in high school.

She started her business in May 1997 because she felt she needed to be busy, since she had stopped working when she got married and had a lot of free time on her hands. She also wanted to be fulfilled as a person, to feel useful and at the same time, have her own income so she would not have to depend entirely on her husband. At first she made cakes for her friends in exchange for them giving her the ingredients. One day - close to Mother´s Day - a friend recommended that she make cakes to sell. It seemed like a good idea to her and she had a lot of requests for that date. Now she makes cakes for weddings and Quinceañera celebrations (a girl´s 15th birthday, a type of "coming-out" party) and has many clients. Her wish is to organize her bakery.

She now needs a loan of US $375, which she is willing to repay within 4 months, to acquire the ingredients and baking molds she needs to fill her clients orders and also to make a greater variety of cakes and pastries. With your help, Laura will see her dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Laura A. una mujer emprendedora de 45 años que se define a si misma como una persona alegre, optimista y muy responsable. Esta casada con el Sr. Pedro Joaquín Lira Aguilar quien trabaja en una Plataforma Marina, son padres de un hijo, Pedro Emmanuel de 17 años, quien actualmente estudia la preparatoria.

Comenzó su negocio en Mayo de 1997 por la necesidad que sentía de mantenerse activa, ya que al casarse, dejé de trabajar y le quedaba mucho tiempo libre. Además que deseaba realizarse como persona, sentirse útil y al mismo tiempo obtener un ingreso para no tener que depender totalmente de su esposo, primero hacía pasteles para sus amistades las cuales solo le daban los ingredientes, hasta que un día un amigo le recomendó que hiciera pasteles para vender ya que se acercaba la celebración del día de las madres, lo cual le pareció muy buena idea y tuvo muchos pedido para esa fecha. En la actualidad ya hace también pasteles para bodas y XV años y tiene una clientela amplia. Actualmente su sueño es poner una pastelería en forma.

Ahora requiere un apoyo económico de US $375 que esta dispuesta pagar en 4 meses para adquirir ingredientes y moldes que le hacen falta para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes y también para elaborar más variedad de pasteles y postres. Con tu apoyo Laura podrá ver cristalizado su sueño.

loans.use: Purchase supplies.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia A. is 48 years old. She is married with twin boys and 2 girls. She works hard in order to provide a decent living for her family. She sells smoked fish and spices, and many homes enjoy her fish because of good quality and taste. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger quantity of fish and spices to serve her many customers. She believes with increased sales and income, she can provide quality education for her children. She belongs to the community group called Adoration Trust Group. The group members guarantee that each member repays her loans and provides social collateral to repay the loan.
Sophia was at a group meeting when this picture was taken.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of fresh fish

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilda is married and has 3 children. She owns a nursery where she sells a variety of plants, fertilizers, etc. Her business is located in a very busy area in town in the barrio called General Diaz in the city of Caacupe.

Matilda tells us that beside her nursery she also has a small store where she sells refreshments, but her nursery is the one that provides her with the most income and this is the type of business she really likes.

With this loan, she will be able to purchase a whole lot of diferent types of plants and fertilizers, seeds and hoses, bags, and flowerpots, etc.

Her main clients are the vendors who purchase at wholesale to later sell them at a profit. Her clients are from different cities such as San Bernardino, Asuncion, San Lorenzo and Ciudad del Este. They travel from far away to purchase her beautiful plants.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer.

Matilde, es una señora casada y tiene 3 hijos, ella es propietaria de un negocio que se dedica a las venta de plantas, abonos, macetas, entre otros productos para el jardín, su negocio esta ubicado en uno de los barrios mas concurrido y con mucho movimiento de gente que es el barrio Gral. Díaz de la ciudad de Caacupé.

Matilde comenta, que aparte de la venta de planta también tiene, una pequeña despensa dónde vende preferentemente bebidas heladas, pero aún así el negocio que mayor ingreso le genera es el de la venta de plantas además de que es la que más le gusta.

Con el crédito que solicita ella podrá comprar gran cantidad de plantas de distintas variedades también abonos, semillas y accesorios como mangueras, bolsas, macetas, entre otros artículos.

Sus principales cliente son los comerciantes que comprar al por mayor para luego venderlos nuevamente en sus negocios o de forma ambulante. Sus clientes son de distintas ciudades, que viajan varias horas para llegar hasta ella y comprar sus bellas plantas, algunas de estas ciudades son San Bernardino, Asunción, San Lorenzo, Ciudad del Este.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, plants flowerpots and fertilizers

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem S. sells groceries from her house and earns about $2 per day. Her husband is a cook for wedding ceremonies and earns about $1.80 per day. They live with six children in Baraykork Village, Kampong Thom Province. Because of an increase in customers, Mrs. S. would like to expand her grocery business. She is asking for a loan of $200 to expand her grocery inventory and decorate her store to attract more customers.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries for her store and decorate it to attract more customers

loans.name: Yaya

texts.fr:
Mr. Yaya M. was born on September 16, 1979 in the far north of Togo in the village of Kantindi. He is married and the father of two children. He is a refrigerator mechanic by trade and sells freezers and fixes fridge/freezer coils in Lomé's Agoè neighborhood. He set up his own store and workshop, “Strefi,” in 2004 and manages it with a great deal of professionalism.
